commit 55af8eac4fd70d943798294e848cfc53a5fdd0a4
Author: Brien Dieterle <briend@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-03-12 20:09:20 -0700

    layer merge fix, configurable legacy/custom OETF
    
    Added preference to set OETF (gamma) to custom.
    set to 1.0 to revert to legacy mode for old docs
    2.2 is more appropriate for sRGB files
    Fixed a layer merge issue.
    fixes #983
    references #265

commit 4490f0615972d57f33aa502f58bda29bdda7f360
Author: Brien Dieterle <briend@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-02-18 20:56:57 -0700

    inktool fix, linemode duration adj
    
    inktool was missing barrel rotation
    linemode was using a duration of 0.001,
    which renders lines as if they were drawn
    insanely fast.  We should add a control
    to vary this, but for now I made it
    one second in duration.

1	0	gui/inktool.py
2	1	gui/linemode.py

commit 8f23c97a298aae403b4f3a1964c5f2464190d901
Merge: 6c06f61f 9b37ade9
Author: Brien Dieterle <briend@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-02-12 23:04:59 -0700

    Merge pull request #973 from briend/pressure_alt
    
    Real Fake Pressure and Barrel Rotation

commit 9b37ade909fcaae7bc7f5033f16240357831e601
Author: Brien Dieterle <briend@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-02-11 21:25:13 -0700

    fake pressure/rotation controller
    
    Instead of sending static 0.5 for
    devices that don't support it, we can
    send anything we want, control it with
    a slider and hotkeys.  This opens up a lot
    of expression for users with mice or other
    unsupported devices.
    
    Also, this may be unpopular, but it is time
    to free up modifiers shift, control, and alt.
    Having these free allows us to re-use keys
    to support on-the-fly brush adjustments like
    changing colors, size, opacity, etc, while
    mid-stroke, and use buttons that are
    conveniently located

13	4	gui/application.py
48	0	gui/document.py
98	26	gui/freehand.py
35	1	gui/resources.xml

commit 82ce4549321f77733e2e9f2acdc22eef1faf9774
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-30 22:45:35 +0100

    Py3: fix for managed_install.
    
    This trick keeps managed_install and managed_uninstall working as
    documented with python3. Without it, setuptools shoots for /usr even if you
    aimed for /usr/local. It makes the path reports look nasty, but until we
    get proper pip3 support this will have to do.
    
    Packagers should continue to use "python[3] setup.py install" as normal.
    The managed_ commands are for regular testers and bleeding edge folks who
    want to keep their /usr/local tidy.

2	0	.travis.yml
1	1	BUILDING.md
6	6	setup.py

commit 1e2867e0e5eed650fc76aca9bdd57d95a5100080
Merge: 489911ea 89614604

commit e1c2a9f82d542bdb4c3699fbb96ea92f624322c3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-16 15:50:20 +0000

    CODEQUAL: require flake8 pass for new code in PRs.
    
    We now require all flake8 tests implemented by Hound-CI to pass for
    newly-introduced lines pf Python code. It's worth the pain.
    
    This automated linting works through GitHub review comments on pull
    requests, created by a bot running flake8. Quite a nice extra hint about
    code quality.
    
    My testing branch shows that Hound-CI seems to do a good job of it, once
    you understand what it does and does not do.  It's reasonable to require
    new lines of code to pass scrutiny, especially since you can make line-by-
    line excuses for the few occasions where you have to write something that's
    not pep8-compatible.

4	1	.hound.yml

commit 373a607c7597c7cc305b07163e4ede981eabcdf8
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-15 15:03:43 +0000

    Enable HoundCI for Python.
    
    I don't know if we need to turn off the default linter bundle yet,
    but let's get it yapping.

6	0	.hound.yml

commit c62ccfd6cc421038bcc22d93b98b7558362a3729
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-15 14:58:01 +0000

    CODEQUAL: let flake8 run globally & generate useful output.
    
    Now that the number of coding style violations is down to an approachable
    level, it's time to automate the Python linter checks and get serious
    about making the code consistent. I'm investigating Hound-CI for this atm.
    
    Part of that is allowing "flake8" to run naturally over the entire project.
    I've been using https://github.com/nvie/vim-flake8 for ages for new code,
    but it's very piecemeal. It's also why you see all those "flake8" commits
    in the recent history.
    
    The code complexity target is arbitrary. It's chosen to match the current
    MacCabe level of the layer stack's rendering method, and there is no magic
    about it. Change it if it's too restrictive.
    
    Anyway, with this commit, you can now run a recent flake8 at the top level
    of your cloned repository without any special parameters, and get a list
    of problems that can be usefully fixed.  And you should.  If you're
    contributing a code-quality fix, please submit it as a PR in its own
    right so that it can be reviewed and tested independently of other commits.
    
    The goal of all of this is to create a codebase with an enforceable and
    defined coding style, and no dead code or vars. I hope it'll reduce the
    line churn in the long run too, to make fork maintenance easier.

15	1	setup.cfg

commit db02a5e99327375fc39cf3db6eaf86c1c5972817
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-08 18:45:00 +0000

    Py3: fix lib.pixbuf.save() arg passing (again).
    
    Upgrading to Py2-unicode or Py3-str is always appropriate.
    
    Lack of this was breaking the thumbnailer under libgdk-pixbuf2 2.36.11 and
    Py3, causing seemingly-random trouble when browsing around in the file
    dialogs, and predictable trouble when saving.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#905.

commit 23eca429bf5e4405b836a9936d0ce7d17b824753
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-06 00:24:23 +0000

    Py3: JSON saving and loading, for settings dicts.
    
    Remove some dead helper code, and replace with explicit load/save.
    All uses of JSON data need to think about encoding between their load/save
    and their corresponding de/serialize. No one size helper fits all cases.
    
    Ubuntu Trusty's Python 3, as used on Travis-CI, has an annoying regression
    in the json module, unfortunately.  Fortunately, Python2's json.dumps()
    defaulted to encoding="utf-8", and we never overrode that. Phew!

23	2	lib/document.py

commit 8790eb3f72fd2e52b5ff73a6ec00d4ef36f6590e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-03-04 14:05:45 +0000

    Automated backups: more fine-grained syncing of settings.
    
    Things like the layervis code write their persistent data to the per-doc
    settings. This means that syncing was needed prior to saves and autosave
    backups.
    
    We originally had it hooked into the general doc sync_pending_changes(),
    but the extra full-flush sync was causing glitches.
    
    Make the lazy warning an exception again.
    
    Hopefully closes mypaint/mypaint#893.

commit 9e34a54146053d27d604890106ffb75eac85be50
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-28 02:42:25 +0000

    Swig: we have to pass filenames to C++ now, and it sucks.
    
    Fix an accidental cut-and-paste. That's what I get for taking the Swig docs
    too literally. Oops. The macro underneath was a wild attempt to get Python 2
    Unicode passing working like Python 3's, but it doesn't work on Travis (Ubuntu
    Trusty 14.04, still!), even when using its backports swig3.0 (version 3.0.2).
    Seems OK with swig 3.0.12, however.
    
    All this because you can no longer pass file-like objects and expect to get
    filehandles out of them in Python 3.

commit 17f80838e943f163717937d898eb76103f64607d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-27 23:46:33 +0000

    Begin fixing build and nosetests for Python 3.
    
    Lots of changes needed to get the build and the tests working with Python3.
    Not quite there yet, but it's a start.
    
    * New module lib.pycompat for minor PY2/PY3 compatibility fixes.
    * All our supported Python versions support b'' and u'', and bytes.
      - No reason not to be explicit.
    * Lots of doctest updates to work around u'X' vs 'X' repr()s
    * Remove flake8 exception for unicode, xrange.
      - These should be explicitly imported from lib.pycompat now.

commit dfdb69e1afe0f0b9557ae845c4e8d161083c308c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-25 21:18:20 +0000

    New commands: Refactor Layer Group (tiles/pixels)
    
    Add two new commands that are basically set operations on a layer group.
    
      * Refactor Layer Group
      * Refactor Layer Group (tiles)
    
    These compute a new common layer containing the intersection of all equal
    pixels (or tiles) from all the child groups content content. Those
    intersecting areas are then removed from the previous layers.
    
    The group must be isolated, and these commands normalize child layers when
    needed before they operate.

commit e5d9977949800bea8544978e6a422374673bfe15
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-24 03:18:00 +0000

    New commands: Remove Layer Backdrop (by tiles/pixels).
    
    Add two new commands
    
      * Remove Layer Backdrop
      * Remove Layer Backdrop (tiles)
    
    They replace the current painting layer's content with only those tiles
    or pixels where it is not exactly equal to its backdrop.
    
    Not sure about the name. "Backdrop" is quite a techie term. Also,
    when used appropriately, these can be used for extracting only the
    changed parts of two layers, e.g. an original layer and a duplicate
    you've painted over.

commit 5eebb8dd788019f3265759ea6dfc22b00b2dd210
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2018-02-21 20:49:04 +0000

    Rework rendering: extract ops, tighter tile loop.
    
    Update the rendering to add scope for some efficiency gains. The rendering
    code may also be more understandable, more consistent, and less repetitious
    now. YMMV, of course, but at least the mess is now a bit more centralized.
    
    * Layers no longer implement TileBlittable or TileRenderable.
    * Instead, they implement a new Renderable interface.
    * Rendering is now implemented by methods of RootLayerStack.
    * Rendered tiles can now stay in the render cache longer.
      - The cache is primarily keyed by tile index and mipmap level now.
      - Thus, drawing and painting now drops dirty cache tiles by position.
      - The cache is still cleared fully by layer property changes etc.
    * Saving will have gained a small amount of efficiency.
    
    Rendering now asks the layer tree up-front for a list of render ops to be
    executed as a little program inside the tile loop.  The render loop is now
    tighter since it longer has any recursive drilldowns executed for each tile
    composite op.
    
    The tighter this gets, the more feasible it becomes to do the tile loop in
    C++ (possibly with a dropped GIL, even).

commit a1d2823946a3db401d6f316da930b6562c32232f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-12-30 21:21:43 +0000

    Try to make the views feature a bit friendlier.
    
    * The "unsaved view" text seems hard to understand. Its a bad way of
      saying that there is no user-chosen view active. It's the normal state
      in apps without user-manged layers views, so relabel as "no active view"
      or similar.
    
    * Icon concept for "add" is now that of snapshotting.
      - Cameralike icon.
      - Updated tooltip.
    
    * New views are now locked by default.
      This makes it more obvious that something has happened after a new
      view is made active, and it fits the snapshot concept better.

-	-	desktop/icons/hicolor/scalable/actions/mypaint-layers-view-add-symbolic.svg
3	3	gui/layervis.glade
4	4	lib/layervis.py

commit c93d260d4d6c19e9a066198c14009915d0afcedc
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-12-12 21:39:45 +0000

    EXPERIMENTAL: add bulk layer visibility switching.
    
    This commit adds controls for switching between different views of the
    document. Views describe which layers are visible together.
    
    The list of views is saved to and restored from current .ORA file, but via
    the document-specific settings dict. It should be considered an
    experimental MyPaint-only feature for now.
    
    Open questions:
    
    1. Should views always be locked? This may make it simpler to use the
       feature correctly, at the cost of adding some potential confusion.
    
    2. Is the UI placement in the layers dockable correct? Should it become
       button-and-dialog?
    
    3. Do we need better icons?

commit 23bde159c0efb355d132a05dcd92e615728b0a2e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-08-21 21:29:32 +0100

    Allow per-document settings.
    
    This commit adds a settings dict to the current working document.  The dict
    can be monitored for changes by any UI, and it gets serialized into .ora
    files as a JSON file (data/mypaint-settings.json) that's indexed as a
    MyPaint-specific extension to stack.xml.
    
    These settings should be useful for palettes, perspective points, and other
    goodies, provided the data you need to save is expressible in JSON.

commit ee5a2834824cc7b307eba8f57b2c974b8d0761d7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-10-17 21:31:44 +0100

    Widen layers list rows for future work (discuss?)
    
    Some people might consider this commit inelegant or a bad use of sidebar
    space. Best I write an explanation of what's going on here.
    
    This commit makes each row of the layers list wider, but more informative.
    I'm doing this to support future work.
    
    (Also, double-clicking the name invokes the new layer properties dialog
    now, but that's probably gonna be way less controversial.)
    
    My goals with the widening are touch-friendliness and supporting a
    potential Layer Sets feature. If I add that feature, the opacity slider
    and the mode dropdown's functionality may move onto the layer properties
    widget and be merely represented in the list as indicators or texts.
    
    The click handlers for the flag and name columns may eventually fire the
    new property widget in a popover. Popovers are pretty, and feel exactly
    right for this context! However, popovers from sidebar widgets can't
    happen while the workspace module still allows toolstacks in floating
    windows ☹

307	160	gui/layers.py

    Layers window: add thumbnail previews column.
    
    This commit adds a slow, low-priority timer for regenerating layer preview
    thumbnails as the layers are modified. Layers that are part of a document
    tree now have thumbnails that update automatically, and these are shown in
    the layers window if it's visible.

    mipmaps to regenerate → balloons memory. No worse than the zoomed-out
    preview dockwindow though?

commit dbc528d6f311795da72f96880c472a8bc46b22f3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-09-04 13:33:28 +0100

    Bugfix: pass sized progress item to load_from_stream().
    
    load_surface_from_pixbuf_file() was not putting a size estimate
    on the progress item it was passed, causing an exception later
    on. This was causing vector layer loads from .ora zipfiles
    to be displayed with a "question mark box" fallback.
    Possibly was breaking more.
    
    Fix by adding a non-size assertion somewhere understandable,
    and doing the sizing operation with a stat().

commit 3308e0f18dc1ca28a5aee9236938b651f13480c1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-07-24 01:47:00 +0100

    lib.feedback: New mechanism for reporting feedback.
    
    File loaders and savers will need to estimate the amount of work
    they need to do, and count during the processing. It might be
    useful to expand this interface later to report strings too,
    but for now add a "simple" hierarchical report object which can
    be passed around where we currently use feedback_cb arguments.
    
    Part of the work for mypaint/mypaint#509.

    to https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/build-environment-updates/2017-07-12
    
    > * bumped pre-installed Python versions to 3.4.6, 3.5.3, and 3.6.1 on
    >   applicable stacks
    > * switch language: generic from connie stack to sugilite stack

commit 56d7079cba0809196f3692d881210f2c1caf57f1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-07-16 21:23:22 +0100

    Dynamics: reset button clears the mapping graph.
    
    When the brush dynamics are reset for a given input in the editor UI,
    the graph was reset to some spurious zero entries. This was the cause
    of some annoying knock-on effects in the brush engine, and since the
    meaning of "reset" is kinda obvious, we should probably do the least
    surprising thing.
    
    Note that setting the dynamic's ±y slider to *exactly* zero does the
    same graph reset (but see mypaint/mypaint#826 for a discussion of
    whether that's a good idea or not)
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#840.
    Addresses mypaint/libmypaint#99 and mypaint/libmypaint#100. Sorta.

1	2	gui/brusheditor.py

commit 724e4dd4debd4f68fca98ff17471029d0fb6246b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-07-09 20:52:00 +0100

    gui.dialogs: flake8, strings updates, docstrings.
    
    Make gui.dialogs flake8-compliant.
    
    Fix strings quoted with `' to use Unicode-literate “” instead.

commit e0843b7f784e637fdaa71ed65b60b0cb1dc9d5b7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-11 03:36:40 +0100

    Feature: add an "Import Layers…" action.
    
    This allows multiple layers to be loaded into the current document from one
    or more files that MyPaint knows how to load. It's a bit like the GIMP's
    "Open As Layers" command, and uses the same keypress (Ctrl+Alt+O).
    
    The imported layers all go into a single new group above the current layer.
    Hopefully that's not too inconvenient, although it would be nice to have a
    "Burst Group" command.

1	1	gui/drawwindow.py

    lib.command: allow AddLayer to add imported layers.
    
    Not just instances created by a constructor callable. Sure, you could
    use a factory method as a constructor, but this allows importing to
    work without the undo stack keeping a ref to your factory.

    Wayland: use CROSSHAIR not MOUSE cursor.
    
    Attempting to use Gdk.CursorType.MOUSE raises an exception on Wayland,
    and it's horribly ugly with X11 scaled cursors.

    it breaks stuff.

commit 527df05d026b4ce6641cdffffde14c714872bf30
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-01 22:08:49 +0100

35	25	lib/layer/tree.py

commit d6e76c98cfad1213d84820e43386789a8f783a3e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-06-01 21:14:58 +0100

    Add API to allow Cairo drawing on layers.
    
    This commit adds new "cairo_request" context manager methods that allow
    MyPaint surfaces and painting layers to be altered using a Cairo drawing
    context. It is now possible to use the Cairo API to:
    
    1. Draw directly into an 8-bpc RGBA pixbuf-surface.
    
    2. Draw over a 15-bpc RGBA tiled surface or a painting layer,
       compositing the result back into it with one of
       MyPaint's layer modes (isolated rendering, basically).
    
    3. Draw directly into a tiled surface or a painting layer,
       which lets Cairo's operators chew on the pixel data in
       8-bpc RGBA space and mess with its alpha.
    
    The API operates as a context manager because it has to use several
    temporary objects for format conversions.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#78 (no strokemap interaction though, and no speed
    guarantees).
    
    Helpful for mypaint/mypaint#150 and mypaint/mypaint#31?

13	0	lib/layer/data.py
21	0	lib/pixbufsurface.py
107	0	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 6698847ac2cab79eaf32ed023d346bb233d34d70
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-05-30 19:57:22 +0100

    pixbufsurface: flake8 tweaks (NFC)

23	28	lib/pixbufsurface.py

commit daf8a1dd2f604768efc4a8ec7a4cd0cc1c1818be
Author: Alberto Leiva Popper <ydahhrk@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-03-02 15:34:44 -0600

    Mode stack: Add layer for brush tools
    
    Previously, the mode stack would at most pile `OneshotDragMode`s on top
    of whatever tool was previously selected:
    
            <ModeStack [FreehandMode, PanViewMode]>
    
    Now, non-brush tools can be piled on top of brush tools so whenever a
    user swaps brushes, the active tool becomes the last used brush tool:
    
            <ModeStack [FreehandMode, SymmetryEditMode, PanViewMode]>
    
    I think this is a million times more comfortable, because otherwise I
    need to manually swap tools so much. I mean, when I choose a brush, I
    want to paint.
    
    Fixes mypaint/mypaint#530.

12	0	gui/brushmanager.py
1	1	gui/fill.py
30	2	gui/mode.py

commit 7f1bb0696ba68f1a618cc0d7bf3ce144b0ef5d16
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuel.por.aca@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-05-26 09:37:44 -0300

    Flatpak: Append -Nightly to the app-id
    
    To allow two desktop entries. This way both stable and master versions
    of the application can be started in parallel from the desktop.
    
    Adding desktop-file-name-prefix only changes the name inside the desktop
    file, not the desktop file itself.  So different app-ids is the way to
    go.

commit f8bcce777a46ec6fbdcd04d54a1123f24c7b7590
Author: Manuel Quiñones <manuel.por.aca@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-05-15 15:11:03 -0300

    Add Flatpak packaging
    
    Flatpak is a great way to distribute applications in modern GNU/Linux
    distributions.
    
    To build a flatpak package locally, follow this steps:
    
        cd flatpak
        flatpak remote-add --no-gpg-verify --user my-repo ~/flatpak-repo
        flatpak-builder --repo=~/flatpak-repo --force-clean my-build org.mypaint.MyPaint.json
        flatpak --user install my-repo org.mypaint.MyPaint
    
    Then it can be run from the command line like this:
    
        flatpak run org.mypaint.MyPaint
    
    A flatpak repository can be created to easily install MyPaint from a
    browser with one click. Is also possible to build a bundle for sharing
    with `flatpak build-bundle`.  A central place for building and hosting
    Flatpak builds named Flathub is in the works. And Alexander Larsson
    showed interest in adding MyPaint to it.

4	0	flatpak/mypaint-Makefile
4	0	flatpak/numpy-Makefile
102	0	flatpak/org.mypaint.MyPaint.json
4	0	flatpak/pycairo-Makefile

commit 687f3ea9e75a4b2eb8a9342144170e90f29ae7c2
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-04-24 01:49:29 +0100

    lib.i18n: Windows: use UI language as 1st choice
    
    This may screw over en_GB speakers (like me!) on Windows, since the UI
    language is always en_US on that platform. However it is more correct
    to assign the UI language the highest priority on Windows.
    
    Good job most dialects of English are mutually intelligible, right?
    This now gives me a reason to add a language selection UI somewhere.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#795.

55	34	lib/i18n.py

    use. This helps keep the build area pristine.

    like that, and to reinforce the idea that this is a demo, not a
    permanent way of running MyPaint.

    exists, and is much better translated (71.5%), this will create a paradox
    in language ordering for European Portuguese speaking users.

Date:   2017-02-19 00:00:29 +0000

    tdw, icon editor: fix the scale factor for HiDPI

    transformation matrix between model coordinates and logical widget
    pixels. This commit makes 1:1 pin-sharp again, and fixes some ugly
    rectangular glitches around screen updates when drawing.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#631.

commit 059c01c4ee9747ced842dc8ef63ca7199c6bd02c
Merge: 64a5b754 fb30717f
Author: Weblate <noreply@weblate.org>
Date:   2017-02-03 23:35:15 +0100

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

commit fb30717f9356295dbf2ed1f00116660445ff0915
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2017-02-03 21:56:21 +0000

    Add basic distutils support
    
    We need to get rid of SCons. It's a mess.
    
    https://wiki.debian.org/UpstreamGuide#SCons
    https://wiki.gentoo.org/wiki/SCons
    
    Let's use good old-fashioned distutils instead.
    We might as well use the standard Python tool for the job,
    and now that we're no longer building brushlib/libmypaint as a submodule,
    it makes sense to switch to it.
    
    Current state: the following just about works in MSYS2 "native" shells and
    Linux:
    
        python2 setup.py build
        python2 setup.py install --prefix=/tmp/somewhere
    
    you should then be able to run bin/mypaint[.py] after cd'ing there.
    One major difference between this and SCons is that all the Python stuff
    including the _mypaintlib.so extension now goes in $PREFIX/lib/mypaint. It
    works fine though...

1	0	.gitignore
1	1	README.md
1	0	desktop/mypaint-ora-thumbnailer.py
1	0	mypaint.py

commit ed997daf72ba5b712569d9897163c88ab53017e2
Merge: b02b7238 127d3456
Author: Weblate <noreply@weblate.org>
Date:   2016-12-06 01:40:49 +0100

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

commit 127d3456d6b07ac38ae55729bdef80ce8a27293c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-12-06 00:29:41 +0000

    win32: drop support for floating subwindows
    
    Floating subwindows, a.k.a. snapped-out windows are impossibly buggy UI
    on Windows GTK as of 3.18 thru 3.22. There are hideous offsets between
    cursor input and click target, and other deep, user-hostile interface
    glitches. They work fine in Xorg, but on Windows we can't release in
    this state.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#679.
    
    [Cherry-pick of c566e99be1823128783359220337e54d9f89b32a from v1.2.x]
    
    It would be good to revert this on master when we can figure out how.

13	1	gui/workspace.py

commit d4bb92ac9ad84ac5b494b1b38123e1e4a17db4f7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-12-06 00:24:07 +0000

    flake8: fix up import/code relative order
    
    [Cherry-pick of 0c058c6f65252bfe4ce9553f3d59fbdd687fb005 from v1.2.x]

2	1	gui/workspace.py

commit 7f9bf5aab087009750d186819e25a7f89480823e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-12-06 00:20:10 +0000

    Mark floating tool windows as deletable
    
    This has an effect on Win32, where clicking on the window surrounds' close
    button causes a crash. Utility windows on Xorg window managers seem
    never to show the close button.
    
    Minimally addresses mypaint/mypaint#679.

Author: probonopd <probonopd@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2016-11-14 12:20:53 +0100

    Generate and upload AppImage of each commit (#740)
    
    Experimental Appimage builds from @probonopd.
    
    Travis will generate and upload an AppImage of each commit. This works by bundling MyPaint, Python, and the required Python modules inside the AppImage.
    
    The URL of the AppImage can be found in the Travis CI build log, beginning with http://transfer.sh/
    
    Please test, and volunteer to maintain this.

commit 9b2252793eb054405ed72e2226ec372b01d4589e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-08-16 18:12:25 +0100

    Handle exceptions when loading cached thumbnails
    
    If a thumbnail cache file is corrupt, GdkPixbuf cannot load it and will
    raise an exception. The correct way to handle that is to log the error,
    move on, and try to generate a new thumbnail.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#725.

19	4	lib/helpers.py

Merge: 53b60f29 7530aabf
Author: Weblate <noreply@weblate.org>
Date:   2016-06-08 03:11:15 +0200

commit 7530aabfa219d7ec4ab3071f9536f05be97f229f
Author: Alberto Leiva Popper <ydahhrk@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-06-07 20:11:02 -0500

    Pan shortcuts: allow user to customize keys (#694)
    
    Pan Left, Pan Right, Pan Down and Pan Up used to be hardcoded into the
    arrow keys. I find this really awkward, as I need to pan often, my
    shortcut hand is sitting in the opposite side of the keyboard, and the
    spacebar option is a three step process my brain refuses to get used to.
    (Hit space, pan, hit space again.)
    
    This commit allows the user to customize the four directional pan
    actions.
    
    Arrow keys will remain default accelerators for panning even if the
    user reassigns them.

4	2	gui/accelmap.py

commit 6c4da2c5c395e98466bac41542367bd6f7f4b3dd
Author: Daniel Plachotich <danpla@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2016-05-20 11:36:50 +0300

    InputTestWindow: Stop reporting after closing. (#681)
    
    For a some reason, "unmap-event" is called twice, so "unmap" is used
    instead; "map-event" replaced by "map" for consistency (although
    it's called only once).
    
    An excerpt from the docs:
      The ::map signal can be used to determine whether a widget will
      be drawn, for instance it can resume an animation that was stopped
      during the emission of ::unmap.

commit 8bebf27a031f49538f62832df7044e5d5015ec7a

commit 44d1692c86a01c90bd2e03bf882cc7efff4e87ce
Author: Daniel Plachotich <daniel.plachotich@yandex.ru>
Date:   2016-04-30 21:36:24 +0300

    Replace drag_source_set_icon_pixbuf() with Gtk.drag_set_icon_pixbuf().
    
    Gtk.drag_set_icon_pixbuf() is the right way to set the D&D icon
    dynamically from the "drag-begin" event. drag_source_set_icon_pixbuf()
    should be used to set a "static" icon.
    
    In theory, they should work equally, but I noticed that icon set via
    drag_source_set_icon_pixbuf() is not visible if its size is greater
    than 55px (as in the brush list). Maybe it's a bug in GTK+ or
    something desktop-specific (XFCE), but anyway it's better to use
    the "right" way.
    
    For examples, search for "gtk_drag_set_icon_pixbuf" and
    "gtk_drag_source_set_icon_pixbuf" in the GTK+ sources.

1	1	gui/brushselectionwindow.py
1	1	gui/colors/adjbases.py

commit 996a33e14b6bc20cd2ac6af8e1d821f01e1ce697
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-04-30 19:29:14 +0100

    workspace: tab pages: eat drag-starting events
    
    The page widgets that contain the sidebar panels now fully consume the
    types of pointer event that can start a drag. This stops these events
    propagating up to the containing GtkNotebook.
    
    Fixes accidental/hypersensitive dragging of the current page's tab when
    clicking or dragging in a repositionable notebook page since GTK 3.19.8.
    
    Better fix for mypaint/mypaint#643.

23	4	gui/workspace.py

commit d91059460a44f00b5eed2931b06cf9f31130ac0e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-04-15 19:29:04 +0100

    README: use Debian's "new" libpng-dev name
    
    Debian have changed the dev package name with 1.6.21 to not contain a
    version code. It's just libpng-dev now, not *libpng16-dev.
    We're fine building against the 1.6 libs, so let's do that.
    
    Practically speaking, we're still compatible with both 1.6 and 1.2, but the
    dev packages conflict. Users will experience less friction if they start
    using the new name due to 2nd order dependencies we don't control.
    
    Formerly libpng-dev was a virtual package, so this name has been around for
    a while.
    
    Update the instructions, and mention the earlier libjson0-dev →
    libjson-c-dev name migration too. Might as well start listing these.

7	3	README_LINUX.md

commit 053bd0cbde3cc150d0724638806d0407b90d508b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-04-15 19:12:57 +0100

    Update brushlib submodule

1	1	brushlib

commit 39c461cf9f0b57de041fd1f83e829bffd787e3a6
Author: Daniel Plachotich <daniel.plachotich@yandex.ru>
Date:   2016-04-15 18:29:36 +0300

    ToolStack: Fix sticking of the last paned.
    
    The problem is that when we create a widget, its parent Gtk.Container
    is already connected to the "size-allocate" signal of the parent
    Gtk.Widget, so our handlers are always called after all child widgets
    have been resized.
    
    The simple solution is to override do_size_allocate() so that our
    handler will be called first.
    Another good thing is that the separator is now sticks when it's moved
    manually.
    
    Fixes mypaint/mypaint#298.

11	26	gui/workspace.py

commit 11d2e7ee6ec3a62a1269f45d9944a484fa98eea7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-24 19:47:45 +0000

    Catch+log exceptions when pasting
    
    This can occur when the layer type does not support loading from a bitmap.
    Layer groups are one example.
    
    Catchall exception handling is bad, so we'd better add a generic and user-
    facing "command or operation failed" exception that can be handled
    explicitly for 1.3.0. This will do for 1.2.1 though.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#603

9	1	gui/document.py

commit 2636248f62201b7e02c0adad76b7fc34b314f75a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-13 23:35:12 +0000

    filehandling: update dangerous action dialog
    
    Update the dangerous action dialog to allow Cancel/Continue wording.
    Cancel/Discard wording is bad for some languages,
    as reported in mypaint/mypaint#503.
    
    The dialog is now a much prettier MessageDialog.
    
    There are now only two main choices:
    Cancel, and a overrideable Continue button.
    The continue button should be assigned an imperative verb in most cases,
    one which echoes the title question.
    
    The new dialog uses a checkbutton for the save choice,
    which soft-interlocks with the Cancel button to emphasize its meaning.
    "Soft" interlocking means that escape still does a proper Cancel
    without saving.
    
    Dialog uses 3.12 features, so bump the required GTK version.

1	1	README.md
147	39	gui/filehandling.py

commit ec2792194d1a643ef266c8f68ac562f3c683b741
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-14 00:47:18 +0000

    clipboard: make synchronous, improve messages

    The main loop will still run.
    
    Improve clipboard messages: notify the user via the statusbar.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#595.

    workspace: take more care when removing pages
    
    It seems that GTK sometimes has the wrong idea about which pages are
    active, leading to issues like mypaint/mypaint#583. Taking more care when
    setting up the page removal idler in the close button handler is probably a
    good idea.

commit caacdac9960426fbeb49de5e0c471b2b8b8e87be
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-02-10 14:34:19 +0000

    Rect: fix cut and paste error in utility ctor
    
    Fix a silly cut and paste error in Rect.new_from_gdk_rectangle(),
    and add a test for this code. Test is mocked due to the inability to
    construct a real GdkRectangle on some systems (see #437).
    
    This typo was causing mispositioned windows in multi-monitor setups.
    Thanks for spotting this, @dothiko!
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#596
    May help with mypaint/mypaint#437

commit 1502bc9e9be16874fa47eda188773f1cbcbeca22
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-31 03:35:43 +0000

    Use updated libmypaint as submodule
    
    libmypaint now builds as a shared lib by default, and contains changes that
    make this happen. MyPaint still builds it statically as a submodule, but
    this will hopefully change before too long. Pull in the latest libmypaint
    so that it gets tested and used regularly still, for now.

1	1	brushlib

commit dca42cdd8de843a0ae191b0f2ae46f7c9b74eecc
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-31 02:23:46 +0000

    Travis: explicit use_sharedlib=false
    
    Explicitly build for testing with use_sharedlib=false. This is the default
    behaviour currently, but explicit is better then implicit.

1	1	.travis.yml

commit 76aff9ea6cae7519c9b00bf07bda7779b11c4da3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-31 02:09:01 +0000

    lib/SConscript: update brushlib tests LIBPATH
    
    Over in libmypaint, I'm refactoring tests/SConscript to make only a static
    PIC library, since the tests shouldn't be built for the new default
    shared-lib case (they wouldn't run without libmypaint installation).
    
    When libmypaint is built as the brushlib/ submodule of MyPaint, it is built
    statically. We're using the configuration variable to control whether the
    tests get built and run now, to give us future CI testing from source but
    nice shared-lib releases that don't pull in huge bundles of test crap. Best
    of both worlds? I hope so.
    
    Extend LIBPATH so that the mypaintlib Python extension can find
    libmypaint-tests.a in the static/testable case.
    
    Refactor the code a bit for clarity.
    
    Update to mypaint/mypaint#542.

3	4	lib/SConscript

commit 703fd6b9473f16a8da52e618537c4078e122cc70
Author: ShadowKyogre <shadowkyogre.public@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-29 23:25:45 -0800

    Check for use_sharedlib before building lib tests
    
    Prior to this, it would be impossible to run mypaint without the tests
    from brushlib. This shouldn't break the Travis build since it doesn't
    set use_sharedlib=true. It surrounds the relevant test code with
    ifndef's that check for the presence of NO_TESTS passed from g++. If
    NO_TESTS is defined, then lib/ avoids building any test related code.

17	4	lib/SConscript
4	0	lib/tiledsurface.hpp

commit d0deedb8bc4cda2598006bfd988a53e865f2b03d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-28 18:40:47 +0000

    BrushworkMode: always start 1st segment abruptly
    
    Much like the final leave() call ends its brushwork segment cleanly, the
    initial segment is now always started cleanly. This was optional, but in
    reality there is no reason for this. Worse, it was causing accidental
    strokes when leaving the ink tool for the default mode.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#571.

18	9	gui/mode.py

commit 8b3dd3a833fbb6a59e72cc18d32aade53a9ae54c
Merge: 10ee9b0e f31a4be7
Author: Weblate <noreply@weblate.org>
Date:   2016-01-27 19:33:50 +0100

    Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master'

commit f31a4be7e93a885e46ce7b59dc04108c43620a93
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-27 18:31:52 +0000

    brushkeys: avoid duplicate colours in history
    
    Restoring brushes from the default brushkeys was populating the colour
    history with spurious HSVColor(h, s, 0) entries. Erroneously, these were
    testing equal despite having differing h or s. This was happening because a
    lot of the stock brushes have black as their defined colour, and the
    initial set of brushkeys is populated from there.
    
    Fixed the equality test: two HSV colours with exactly 0 in the value slot
    must always compare equal. The same is true of HCY colours whose luma is
    either 0 or 1.
    
    Added tests for these literal edge cases.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#573.

24	0	lib/color.py

commit 10ee9b0ecd975028cf0838d28671ff79405638e2
Merge: 77f9a12f 081f6246

    causes grief for some unconventional installs: mypaint/mypaint#577.

    screenshot size being supposedly too large. No good technical reason is

commit 8119e9321f981c4734dd984eb7ef54fb6e04ad6b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-11 00:39:06 +0000

    Copyright info: update Licenses file
    
    Split LICENSE into Licenses.md and Licenses.dep5.
    
    Licenses.md is explanatory blurb and a summary. Licenses.dep5 is in the
    machine-readable and mostly human-readable DEP5 format file used by Debian:
    <https://wiki.debian.org/Proposals/CopyrightFormat>. The latter should be
    considered the master document for licensing info.
    
    Get rid of old COPYING.cursors file because its text is included in
    Licenses.dep5.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#546.

0	23	COPYING.cursors
0	100	LICENSE
952	0	Licenses.dep5
28	0	Licenses.md

commit 5cb8aa081a0697f06325e247f02868adcbb707bf
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-09 19:02:45 +0000

    1-shot rotate actions: reverse labels & icons
    
    In mypaint/mypaint#553, we decided that one-shot toolbar buttons that
    change the view should present themselves as affecting the canvas you see
    in the view. It's one less level of abstraction for the user, and thinking
    about it the other way only really makes sense for the Preview window.
    
    No string additions, just reordering → translations will be OK.
    
    Removed two tooltips, since their old content would have been confusing
    now. I'll raise a new issue about this, because they should be re-added
    when we're out of string freeze.
    
    It looks like it was this way originally somehow? The icons look better
    this way round anyway.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#553.

14	6	gui/resources.xml

Date:   2016-01-06 00:14:49 +0000

    workspace: handle empty tool stacks at startup
    
    Add proper handling for empty tool stacks at startup.
    Without this, floating windows with no means of closing
    could be created, with certain configs.
    
    Addresses the consequences of mypaint/mypaint#550, and at least brings
    MyPaint's UI back into a vaguely sensible state.

commit a2350c6a4daf4b9cfaf532be7336d7467b3d0cd4
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-03 00:09:15 +0000

    inktool: more cautious event capture
    
    Discard successive drag events which have the same position and time. May
    help with mypaint/mypaint#549.

9	1	gui/inktool.py

commit 922b995c8ac3f7ea7237c50cb845dfcfbcd573d7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2016-01-02 23:24:14 +0000

    inkmode: fix inter-node steps calculation
    
    Interpolation needs at least two steps. On some Windows configurations, it
    was able to calculate zero for the number of needed steps, which is
    surprising (and also causes a zero-division error in practice).
    
    For this to happen, the two middle nodes of the interpolation would need to
    have been recorded with identical times and positions. Perhaps the
    interpolation should just be skipped instead of drawn. The node probably
    shouldn't have been recorded either.
    
    Anyway, hopefully fixes mypaint/mypaint#549. But may just move the problem
    elsewhere.

1	1	gui/inktool.py

commit cd1c4e000c207bcd08065ae86754c364d7e97ebd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-30 01:43:28 +0000

    Translation: unmark some potential-problem strings
    
    Make some semantically trivial but syntactically complex translated strings
    non-translated. These particular ones might be a source of confusion.
    Criteria: made from only XML markup, Python string template directives, and
    whitespace that contains one or more newline or other fancy backslash-
    escape.
    
    Translators seem generally OK with these TBH, I'm just playing safe. They
    might be a source of confusion due to the complexity, and perhaps shouldn't
    have been marked for translation in the 1st place.
    
    I'd be happy to revert this commit if folks ask.

1	2	gui/drawwindow.py
1	2	gui/layerswindow.py

commit 680747014b9e4245278eb8157705e0bd2c13a666

commit e340830912c77b501fa6431981f4b2338af6b7a6
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-30 01:31:43 +0000

    Remove problem strings from translation set
    
    This commit marks some strings as untranslated:
    
    * That <xmin><ymax> nonsense in gui/brusheditor.glade
      - Axis labels were accidentally marked for translation.
      - Looks like XML markup but isn't, bad design really.
      - Keen translators translate "max" and "min", which breaks MyPaint.
    * Markup content for column data in the accelmap editor
      - Marking these for translation was a bit pointless, causes problems.
      - <big> & <small> are rare tags (not HTML) → get translated sometimes.
      - On reflection, these strings probably don't need translating.
    
    It's OK to remove strings from translation during a string freeze ☺

6	13	gui/accelmap.py
4	4	gui/brusheditor.glade

commit 8cb5825bc5a80178914c2d38cc2da6b9573824db
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-23 11:55:23 +0000

    inline_toolbar: never show the overflow arrow
    
    This can cause glitches with the layers window with specific combinations
    of configuration and sidebar widths. It's probably more robust to use a
    constant width for these utility toolbars.
    
    Hopefully fixes mypaint/mypaint#536.

commit 2dd4812da5e319a7d22d054285024ec584e74989
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-20 00:05:13 +0000

    Don't include proximity events in event masks
    
    We never defined handlers for these events anyway.
    
    The only reason for these events ever being included in the event mask was
    as a workaround for some PyGTK-era oddities. There seems to be no reason
    for these events to be included in the mask when running under GTK3+PyGI.

commit abdaf83e81cfa5dcc59a0f8c5671ca0e7153d7ce
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-18 21:45:10 +0000

    externalapp: use os.startfile on windows
    
    Use the nonportable os.startfile() way of working on Windows to workaround
    a segfault. Users will no longer be offered a choice of what to launch on
    that platform: use Explorer to set the default edit association for the
    extension you want to edit instead.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#531 enough to have it not hinder the release, but
    this is a pretty silly workaround for an upstream GLib/GDK regression.

commit b1b3b39eb4c6be034535a34bd42ad927d2befddf
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-11 00:10:00 +0000

    Fix segfaults from gdk_display_get_pointer()
    
    Replace calls to gdk_display_get_pointer() with non-deprecated
    alternatives. GDK 3.18.5 segfaults when this function is invoked at times
    when the core pointer's device is a tablet. May be limited to X11, earlier
    GDK versions seem to be OK.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#513.

24	11	gui/document.py
7	8	gui/mode.py
18	4	gui/workspace.py

commit a2e7037c57fed0163c67a034c3204a1fe17e606e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-11 00:49:56 +0000

    Remove or update deprecated get_pointer() calls
    
    Replace or remove deprecated calls to gtk_window_get_pointer() and
    gdk_window_get_pointer().
    
    * TDW's pointer-getter moves out of the renderer & is renamed.
    * Update linemode's call.
    * PixbufList doesn't need it, and it was only cosmetic.
    
    This doesn't address mypaint/mypaint#513, since these calls don't crash
    mypaint with affected GDKs. I just want the deprecation warnings gone.

commit e2b42a4723b8bd651d86fbf3cf1e26db45554ace
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-12-07 21:16:32 +0000

    brusheditor: workaround slider value label redraws
    
    GTK doesn't always redraw the value label of a GtkScale when needed.
    Work around by issuing an explicit queue_draw() when the user clicks a
    row in the treeview, or when a brush setting changes.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#524.

commit 0bca464cf50c681ffae57d4459f648ace40cb005
Author: cortexer <manuelstumpf@web.de>
Date:   2015-12-03 22:50:29 +0100

    backgroundwindow: do not overwrite background
    
    Removes some old legacy background loading code from the dialog
    initialisation, that is not needed any more.
    Opening the background chooser dialog for the first time has
    overwritten the background of an already open painting with the
    default background.
    Correct loading of the background is done in gui/application.py.
    
    Solves mypaint/mypaint#512

2	14	gui/backgroundwindow.py

commit ad1915347d6737b295cd634bec82a058ae78cb60
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-29 00:18:52 +0000

    autorecover: fix for Windows

    os.path.samefile() doesn't exist on that platform.
    
    Improve logging too.

17	2	gui/autorecover.py

commit fb92450d56cb666957c6c3474f40bcc5fc0eb4dc
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-28 23:51:26 +0000

    autosave: blank out filename before recovery
    
    Blank the filename before autosave recovery in case the user chooses
    not to save the document under the suggested name.
    In that case, the working file name should be blank after the cancel,
    meaning the user will be forced to choose a name again before quitting
    or starting a new file with Ctrl+N.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#508.

1	0	gui/autorecover.py

commit 818278c0de2c1251b3011470ae077616ea586d28
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-28 23:50:41 +0000

    autosave recovery: extra care over autosave choices
    
    Refuse to offer the current working doc's autosave directory for
    recovery under any circumstances. This inevitably leads to data loss.
    
    There are some corner cases related to elective autosave recovery
    where this happens. Not sure why: the folder should also have been
    marked as in use. However, an extra check doesn't hurt.

11	3	gui/autorecover.py

commit 441c04d6541008d652f704837ca1c70b0f9f9c24
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-28 22:47:35 +0000

    dialogs: improve brush import dialog
    
    Fixes a thing that's been annoying me for a while.
    
    * Make the brush import dialog's textview scrollable.
      Before, it was governed by the vertical size of the text,
      which could make the dialog unusable.
    * Improve dialog layout spacing.

commit f28e0a445baccbf186546a4b1e378d8566d2e145
Author: Alberto Leiva Popper <ydahhrk@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-16 12:04:53 -0600

    Improve AccelMap updates
    
    When the user defines a shortcut, always inform Gtk.AccelMap that the
    binding is being overridden, not initialized.
    
    This helps bindings survive restarts regardless of whether the
    corresponding action is present in the menus or not.
    
    Fixes mypaint/mypaint#497.

commit 94be81071209fb83df0ff29e47912cbd37d4f75e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-07 23:08:44 +0000

    Windows installer: make translations optional
    
    Allow users to choose not to install program translations, to deal with
    cases where the translations are bad or incomplete or both for their
    chosen language.
    
    Adding this short-term workaround closes mypaint/mypaint#348.
    
    The longer-term fix is to contribute good translations for your
    language using (currently) https://hosted.weblate.org/engage/mypaint/ ☺

6	1	windows/innosetup/mypaint.iss.in

commit b52eab7402724a0a3bf3f40e3e8afafc362022ed
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-05 22:10:12 +0000

    brushmodifier: initialize properties up-front
    
    Don't wait for brush_selected_cb() to be called before initializing the
    object's tracking properties. The callback should be run once at startup,
    but that happens in an idle routine. Initializing the properties when
    creating the modifier object fixes a potential source of race conditions
    and settings-dependent errors.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#485.

2	2	gui/brushmodifier.py

    tilt axes in events being handled. Probably these really come from X11
    space. Add yet another special-case workaround.
    
    Hopefully addresses mypaint/mypaint#460.

commit ab2bb78ae81efeebd563f5759239c41ccfaa82f8
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-11-04 02:51:06 +0000

    freehand: ignore alien motions while btn pressed
    
    In lieu of true multi-device stuff (which may not be possible for grab
    reasons), respond to button press and button release events by establishing
    a filter that causes motion events from other devices to be suppressed
    while the button is held down on the device you are painting with. We
    assume this latter device is the one that issued the click, just like the
    existing workaround for dodgy evdev event sequences.
    
    There may still be categories of input devices that don't send button press
    events when the nib is pressed down, but which still send pressureful
    motion events. Tablet PC semantics with the side btn1, for example. This
    code should remain compatible with those devices.
    
    This may help mypaint/mypaint#460, and certain jaggedy Windows glitches
    like mypaint/mypaint#177.

24	5	gui/freehand.py

commit 4f6593fcaffbed9b2e47d681e33b68e0c9d77ef3

commit f40bd31a2b2226332a7b0ee76deac7329f42fde1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-30 20:34:47 +0000

    tdw: suppress redraws during load and save
    
    Prevent TDWs from invalidating areas on screen when the model is
    changing while it's loaded or saved. When loading or saving, the UI
    is already frozen by putting it in the "insensitive" widget state, so
    use that as the controlling flag.
    
    Use the new area-render function to capture a view of the last
    sensitive state of the widget minus any overlays, and draw it
    while loading or saving for natural invalidations/redraws.
    
    (Turns out we do actually send a full redraw when loading or saving,
    so redraw the capture with a bit of alpha to make it look pretty and
    behave like widgets in the Adwaita theme, which also dim as of 3.18.x.
    Cleverer people than me can work on loading anims if they want...)
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#468 by reimplementing a Pixmap-based equivalent
    bit of code that was dropped for convenience during the transition from
    GTK2 to GTK3.

25	5	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 25f17313d5bc118159ab15aa86eba1741d773493
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-30 20:24:36 +0000

    tdw: new method for extracting a rendered area
    
    Add an internal method for extracting a rendered view within a screen
    rectangle, and replace the guts of get_color() with it.

53	13	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit fe2a569446b4abffce80ea91a0ce6e779b4087cd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-30 20:19:51 +0000

    Whitespace, stylistic, docstrings. Adds 1 doctest.

1	1	gui/document.py

commit 83a9e7b27b1623c326168b66d4ad5e89a52e9fe0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-21 00:12:36 +0100

    Pick Color: remove screen sampling feature
    
    Fix a segfault when picking from the screen by rendering a sample square of
    the document under the cursor, and averaging the pixels in that.
    
    This is a removal of an old feature, but the old way of doing things was
    never very satisfactory or very well supported across different DEs and
    other OS windowing environments. See the long list of bugs about this
    feature over time.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#333 - colour pick now ignores display filters.
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#444 - picking colours no longer crashes MyPaint.

commit 46c36cdc927b272a77da505647ad1804700eb2cd
Merge: 211861ef 5246883a
Author: Weblate <noreply@weblate.org>
Date:   2015-10-03 00:17:15 +0200

commit 5246883a4d63ee3d42767e3a717aa3362cceecb2
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-10-02 23:10:35 +0100

    Rewrite drop-shadow func
    
    Consolidate drawing drop shadows into a single routine, and extend its use
    to the drop shadows under floating action buttons. This works around a
    cosmetic defect with Intel graphics hardware, where radial patterns aren't
    rendered with the fidelity we need (sampling is every second pixel
    seemingly, resulting in a blocky drop shadow where fine detail's needed -
    nVidia hardware seems unaffected).
    
    Add a routine for calculating how much space a drop shadow needs.
    
    Add a z-height parameter for drop-shadow rendering. Maybe buttons could
    look different when pressed down one day.

commit f4d79d15bf2e6860b9a6e970eaa92dab35303d03
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-09-30 00:42:44 +0100

    Inking tool: force-directed layout for buttons
    
    Use some fake physics for layout to avoid button overlaps and other
    messiness. It'll probably need some messing with the constants.
    
    The accept button is placed near the final node to allow simpler
    continuation. Hopefully it won't get in the way there.
    
    The reject button is placed near the start node, because if you didn't want
    to stroke, you'll presumably be wanting to go back to the beginning and try
    again.

commit 69383e944b0a05d6657c18dbbcf800491d14564e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-27 22:42:37 +0100

    Workspace: fix some GTK 3.16+ annoyances
    
    GTK 3.16 and beyond convert a lot of normal UI elements into mystery
    meat systems which you have to hover over to discover. Not such a good
    thing for our sidebars.
    
    This commit makes the dividers look as though they can be moved again,
    and makes the scrollbar visible all the time when the stack's minimal
    height is too small to be displayed fully visible (thus preventing it
    from overlapping the close button).

20	0	gui/workspace.py

Date:   2015-08-27 22:35:23 +0100

3	4	gui/workspace.py

commit 3eb9589376e1fe9adcd8ba7ff6cf0014122a2326
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-27 22:34:17 +0100

    Workspace scrolls: fix stacking borders
    
    Seems that we're supposed to use gtk_container_add() in all cases since
    GTK 3.8, and not the deprecated gtk_scrolled_window_add_with_viewport().
    In fact it looks as if doing the latter was causing a stack of internal
    children to surround the canvas widget when MyPaint was repeatedly
    fullscreened and unfullscreened.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#92.

3	3	gui/workspace.py

Date:   2015-08-26 18:40:51 +0100

    cosmetic: fix LQ rendering blip after hide/show UI
    
    Not really a glitch, but an annoyance.
    
    Pressing tab to show and hide the sidebars was accidentally scrolling the
    canvas in a mode that's tuned for interactive panning. This meant that
    pressing tab caused a brief but noticeable blip of low-quality rendering,
    and an unnecessary redraw.

commit 0bc26c65365a1fe0846bd2cb53df0e8eaf2e9326
Merge: c1c0ab6b d9dfea9d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-25 22:26:03 +0100

    Merge pull request #418 from iSoron/scratchpad-modestack
    
    Dispatch mode-flip actions to the active document

commit d9dfea9d89a76b72dc7332383031655cd0ccb9b5
Author: Alinson Xavier <axavier@uwaterloo.ca>
Date:   2015-08-24 23:13:16 -0400

    Dispatch mode-flip actions to the active document
    
    All mode-flip actions are currently being sent to the main document. This
    causes issues such as mypaint/mypaint#272. It also makes it impossible to
    use other tools (such as line-drawing tools) on the scratchpad. With this
    patch, mode-flip actions are sent to the active document instead.

5	0	gui/document.py

    Logic change for the fallthrough case too: closes mypaint/mypaint#244.
    
    This commit does what mypaint/mypaint#417 does, but with less pulling on
    methods that, er, shouldn't have been exposed in the first place.
    Hopefully doing all the "real" key event dispatch in one place will make
    the code a bit more understandable too.

commit e07736fa461139d9f03f7c7fcceecf6cef8535f8
Author: Alinson Xavier <axavier@uwaterloo.ca>
Date:   2015-08-23 17:26:44 -0400

    Restore old color picker behaviour (hover to pick)
    
    In older versions of mypaint, it was possible to pick a color by simply
    holding down the 'pick color' hotkey and hovering over a color. At some
    point, this changed. Users were now required to hold down the hotkey and
    then drag over the color. This patch restores the old behaviour.
    
    Resolves mypaint/mypaint#253.

3	3	gui/colorpicker.py

commit 47496b83b550e7bf908fe90c6dd1b36fdfe98ded
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-18 01:16:14 +0100

    strokemap: speed up stroke render (real tile obj)
    
    It's not unusual for the tiles in the strokemap to be all ones, especially
    for big strokes of the kind that cause problems in mypaint/mypaint#8.
    
    Those can be stored in RAM slightly more efficiently (though zlib does a
    decent compression job), but there's a nice rendering speed gain to be had
    for strokes where all-ones tiles predominate over partly-filled times. From
    my measurements on a completely biased sample of one big image with big
    wide strokes: ~ 2.1x speed and no loss or much gain on an image with
    comparable big narrow strokes.
    
    Should help some more with the user experience in mypaint/mypaint#8, but I
    suspect the lingering-stroke part of that is already fixed by preceding
    commits.

139	31	lib/strokemap.py

commit b0e9d7fefd363df682afaed69d283cc51a595d1d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-16 03:23:59 +0100

    strokemap: render_to_surface only a limited subset of tiles
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#8.
    
    One problem with the existing strokemap implementation is that the
    time taken to render the overlay layer for a stroke shape sometimes
    exceeds the state timeout period.
    
    This commit limits overlay generation to just what's necessary.

    strokemap: API for finishing pending tile work
    
    Add an internal method for processing just specified queued tile work, if
    that's possible. It's only possible if every chunk of work in the idletask
    work queue supports being partially forced to completion for specified
    tiles: if the queue involves big global changes like translating/moving
    tiles, we'll have to use the old way still.
    
    This is intended to speed up stroke picking and blinking.

1	1	gui/document.py

commit ba8f9e135d68be420afd44457e0f94198cfb8b18
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-17 22:41:35 +0100

    stategroup: start autoleave timeout after on_enter
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#8 by making stroke-blinks more apparent.
    
    Picking very large strokes wouldn't make the stroke blink visibly. Picking
    medium-large strokes would blink for a shorter time than picking very short
    strokes, so it's clear there was a race condition going on.
    
    What seems to have been happening was that the strokeblink on_enter() for
    very large strokes could take so long to render the stroke for a fast
    keydown+keyup that the on_leave() fired almost straight away, as soon as
    the GTK event loop fell idle. This redrew the same areai that on_enter()
    exposed. GTK would collapse the two draw events into one at the extremes,
    and you wouldn't see the stroke blink.
    
    Still not sure why there was sometimes a lingering overlay layer. I've not
    been able to reproduce this for some time ☹

1	1	gui/stategroup.py

commit d04cd1719ca426b6f8e2e0e94c07d215b041df64

commit bae0db944dc1dd2afd7a5026d36cd395bd4f372e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-10 22:28:10 +0100

    Profiler improvements
    
    Now any system can run the profiler nicely, not just Linux-based ones
    with gprof2dot.py and dot installed. The output without the tools is
    more minimal, of course, but the .pstat files can be copied elsewhere
    for analysis and comparison.
    
    Document profiler usage (in a new DEBUGGING document).
    
    Use a special managed tempdir for profiler output. It's cleaned up at
    the end of the session to keep things tidy.

commit 5cc2da4ffa7360566109f385fe87e032f749af6d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-08 01:05:59 +0100

    Device monitor: fix missing notifications
    
    Fix: Windows users can now configure devices individually.
    
    It seems that Windows GDK 3.16 doesn't send device-added or device-removed
    signals when new devices are plugged in or unplugged. This meant that the
    Devices tab in Preferences wasn't being updated on Windows builds because
    it was relying on this mechanism for detecting changes to the list of known
    devices.
    
    Improve logging of new devices, and downgrade the messages for the
    GdkDeviceManager signals to debug level now that we're not relying on them.
    
    Addresses an oddity noticed as part of mypaint/mypaint#401.

20	3	gui/device.py

commit d31dcdc903a93d0264a5f760281fcdf32064ecf3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-06 19:02:53 +0100

    Build: don't require up-to-date local tags
    
    Requiring that the most recent tag in git match the base MYPAINT_VERSION is
    really just our own policy for making releases. For testers who also
    maintain their own forks, its more polite to simply warn about it rather
    than break their build.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#397.

commit 6048998bf56d6260af95c24b8fcdc26a5e5f5df5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-05 19:13:39 +0100

    Layer panel: flip eye+lock and type icons around
    
    Putting the eye and lock icons on the left (for ltr languages) is closer to
    other art apps.
    
    I had my doubts about doing this during string freeze, but I guess for a
    sensible layout, you don't need fancy multi-cell columns after all. So no
    string changes needed :)
    
    Second advantage: this makes Adwaita's new (and horrid) mystery meat
    scrollbars break things much less. There's almost no need to click on the
    type icon for a layer, so it doesn't really matter when the scrollbar fades
    in above it. Before we had the lock icons on that side, and it was
    difficult to click on them when there were enough layers in the stack to
    require a scrollbar.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#144.

13	8	gui/layers.py

commit 58c1dbbaccd2f87cfb6bc47e393fa2b2fd169ddd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-01 21:11:48 +0100

    lib.i18n: fix fallback-to-C hack
    
    If someone who understands several languages has a prioritized LANGUAGE in
    their environment (or one derived from their OS settings), but prioritizes
    a dialect of English which we don't have a message catalogue for, MyPaint
    should fall back to "C" (i.e. the source's US English) at that point. Not
    after some later English dialect in the priority list, because other
    languages they prefer less than (their first choice of) English may
    intervene.
    
    Weird corner case discovered in mypaint/mypaint#389.
    
    Assumes that all varieties of written country-specific English are mutually
    intelligible.
    
    Still not even really sure that this is needed.

4	4	lib/i18n.py

commit 270c055cb7791dc200e101a7b3ba57adfcd1fe7f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-08-01 00:14:44 +0100

    Open/save dialogs: fix preview update bugs
    
    The preview pixbufs weren't regenerating when clicking around in the load
    and save dialogs, and in some cases the lack of update was actively
    misleading (you might save over the wrong file without realizing).
    
    * Fix code that just ate an exception without reporting it.
    * If there's really no pixbuf available, hide the preview pane.
    * Use our standardized pixbuf loader wrappers
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#382.

2	2	gui/filehandling.py
51	14	lib/helpers.py

commit b8f0b620b7bf82863064d6573f98febde77a8493
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-31 02:19:43 +0100

    brush dnd: make it less weird
    
    When dragging a brush from a source group into a separate target group
    where it already exists, don't do anything.
    
    The old behaviour was weird, and I keep having to explain it to people
    which is generally a bad sign. Before this commit, the brush would be
    repositioned within the target group *and* forcibly removed from its source
    group causing lots of updates and all the tiles shifting around.
    Additionally, having different behaviour on a second attempt to drag an
    item from one group to another was, er, "unique".
    
    It was like that because this was the only way of removing a brush from a
    group until now. The context menu fixes that now.

2	6	gui/brushselectionwindow.py

commit cb66b24fe7e13ab38aa28aec476bc587a07adc78
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-31 02:11:17 +0100

    brush dnd: fix inability to drag brushes
    
    Fix misuse of the display string for the brush as the identifier of what
    was being dragged.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#359.

commit a3cd99157693cf7c115261017105d5d1cf412e44
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-28 18:26:51 +0100

    Windows: fix import order at startup
    
    Change the order of some imports
    
    * mypaint[.py] is now an OS+environment setup & start script
    * gui.main is responsible for early GTK and GLib-related workarounds now
    * gui.application performs the first import of mypaintlib,
      which must be deferred later than the workarounds. Add comment there
      about it in the imports section.
    
    Why? Well, unless the import and setup order is strictly:
    
    1. initialize i18n support
    2. import Gtk
    3. import mypaintlib
    
    then icon loading on MINGW64 builds fails.
    
    This is another hint that something is amiss in the guts of the C++
    extension, but changing the import order suffices for now.

17	0	gui/application.py
10	0	gui/main.py
3	18	mypaint.py

commit f178dfaab2201b5c884f8eb01579cacd01253407
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-25 12:24:04 +0100

    Prefs: convert scraps prefix to unicode when changed
    
    Not doing this can be the source of exceptions encountered later when
    trying to save scraps, if the path contains Unicode characters.
    
    The json module used for settings storage is fully capable of storing
    unicode objects and loading them back in reliably.

4	1	gui/preferenceswindow.py

commit 836ae3eaf310576435a8078db38b64d729a21730
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-25 17:08:36 +0100

    Make expanduser_unicode do nothing on Win32
    
    The encoding used by sys.getfilesystemencoding() isn't roundtrippable,
    which breaks scrap saving. The "~" convention has no real meaning on
    Windows, and there are better defaults for things like the scrap prefix on
    that platform, so just have the func return its input coerced to unicode.
    
    All paths that MyPaint stores in RAM or saves to the config should be using
    Unicode anyway.

3	1	gui/filehandling.py
22	0	lib/fileutils.py
0	1	lib/helpers.py
2	2	mypaint.py

    the builtins.

1	1	gui/application.py

commit b4e54a3e8ecbed07ca9580cff8eebe00e2908691
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-25 00:36:31 +0100

    Auto-save recovery dialog: exception fixes
    
    Internal MyPaint paths are unicode objects, but they also have to be stored
    in a treestore for the autosave recovery dialog. Convert the column values
    to and from utf8-encoded byte strings to avoid exceptions when clicking
    around in the autosave recovery list.
    
    Fixes mypaint/mypaint#374 for me on Win7 64bit Professional with various
    flavours of non-ASCII %USERPROFILE% paths.

5	0	gui/autorecover.py
7	1	lib/document.py

commit e780df058f012c75cff84d60c4b38b4694d49c8f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-25 00:29:45 +0100

    Make our fake C_() always return unicode
    
    Probably should be the rule for other gettext-like wrappers as well.

21	4	lib/gettext.py

commit 802e4402e3ff5ba2d3f61bfeefc1a12d773b0da5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-24 22:12:15 +0100

    GLib filename encoding workarounds
    
    Address several issues arising from GLib returning filenames encoded as
    UTF-8 on Windows (and not sys.getfilesystemencoding()) but encoded in the
    actual fs encoding (or its override) on other platforms. Both varieties of
    filename are represented as Python bytes (str) objects, and this can be a
    source of encoding cockups when we do Unicode-based display and path
    manipulation.
    
    Writing some more Pythonic wrappers which convert properly to unicode
    objects seems appropriate, as MyPaint should be Unicode-only internally.
    Most commonly the values we need to manipulate are the ones from
    g_get_user_*_dir(), so write some convenience wrappers for those too.
    
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#372.
    Addresses mypaint/mypaint#374.

5	7	gui/application.py
3	3	gui/main.py
3	6	lib/document.py
129	0	lib/glib.py
3	2	lib/helpers.py

commit 9b6fd5723a27c837c47d8709b7e6801b8b117ec7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-25 00:39:35 +0100

    Fix mypaintlib import order screwing up i18n
    
    If mypaintlib is imported too early, i.e. before the i18n setup, it can
    mess up what the GLib get_*_dir functions return. This probably indicates
    that it or something it uses is doing something wrong, but it's easier to
    fix this by doing the checker import later than by chasing down the source
    of the error.

18	15	mypaint.py

    Pinch i18n setup code from QuodLibet
    
    The platform-specific LANG/LANGUAGE setting on Windows and OSX is
    quite a bit more advanced than our own reinvention. To say the least.

commit 8eda06621706fd14f9f9fda5c89a24d256d97bb8
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-23 22:41:20 +0100

    Windows logging: don't redirect stdout/stderr
    
    Redirecting these filehandles in this manner can cause crashes under some
    unclear circumstances on Windows. Turn it off on that platform since it's
    pretty dubious code anyway.

    using the new scheme, "<Whatever>Panel". Ones named using the old naming

    evaluation.

commit adc90311996f37679f84440f590a723d30295534
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-21 19:53:47 +0100

    Version numbering scheme update
    
    Move away from date-based version numbering for the first series of
    beta releases, largely for aesthetic reasons but also because I'll
    be tagging release points in git for the betas, making "git describe"
    a useful tool. Version numbers in builds will resemble:
    
        1.2.0[-beta.0[.3]][+git[export].1234abc]
        |     |     |  |    |
        |     |     |  |    Build/export info (not part of tarball)
        |     |     |  |
        |     |     |  3rd commit after the "v1.2.0-beta.0" tag.
        |     |     |
        |     |     Beta release 0; corresponds to a release tag.
        |     |
        |     Pre-release marker: beta releases.
        |
        Version this is a pre-release of.
    
    It is now very important to have tags available in the git checkout,
    and for them to match up with the base revision in the code, so this
    is now enforced. Building from an exported source tarball will still
    work without git however, and this style of build will form the basis
    for binary prereleases in the form of Windows installers released
    through github, and Debian packages released via the Ubuntu PPA.
    
    * lib.meta: update docs.
    * lib.meta: bump to v1.2.0-beta.0.
    * lib.meta: when called as __main__, write the entire hybrid
      metainfo script on stdout.
    * lib.meta: enforce git tagging requirements when extended version
      information is requested and this isn't an unpacked source tarball.
    * SConscript: update for the new calling convention.
    * release.sh: update for the new calling convention.
    * release.sh: remove reminder to tag - that gets enforced now.

14	32	SConscript
185	23	lib/meta.py
14	39	release.sh

commit a980f26950bb1f7cefbeb9a90d5bd6c2aa5682bc
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-21 22:06:05 +0100

    Windows canned build: fix variable init order
    
    Fix use of a variable before it's initialized, for the export-from-git
    style builds. This could cause unintended reuse of the same source tarball
    between builds.

2	2	windows/build.sh

commit e271855c0d610f48380eece2e69f9c1f77f56a56
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-21 01:11:08 +0100

    Layer Solo: respect the background visibility flag
    
    Reverse an earlier decision to always show the background in layer solo
    mode. It's more useful to have two distinct renderings for a solo-mode
    layer, controlled by the Show Background toggle:
    
    * When the background is shown, the current layer affects it directly.
      This makes it obvious what the layer currently does.
    
    * When the background is hidden, the current layer is rendered in Normal
      mode over the background checks.
      This makes it easier to edit the "real" data in a layer.
    
    When the current layer is being blinked on a layer change, the
    show-background state is temporarily inverted to make the blink look more
    distinct.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#233.

0	1	gui/document.py
12	10	lib/layer/tree.py

commit c52147ef0d8f2425a46f01fd34c04b191f8c27f2
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-19 22:51:46 +0100

    Layers list: don't always scroll on content change
    
    Only scroll the list to the current layer on a layer content change
    notification if the layer that's been changed is the current layer.
    
    This change allows the user to scroll in the layers panel so that the
    current layer is no longer visible, and then toggle lots of layer
    visibilities in that area of the list. Before, the list would scroll to the
    current layer after the 1st click.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#308.
    
    Drawing on the current layer will still scroll the layers panel so that
    the layer being drawn on is shown in the list. This is intentional, and
    was the primary use case for this bit of UX design.

3	3	gui/layers.py

commit 5983985132494486e329cc3a4989c9861d295fda
Author: Andrew Chadwick <a.t.chadwick@gmail.com>
Date:   2015-07-19 22:25:39 +0100

    Use a single tile for zero-area external edits
    
    When editing a painting layer with no data in it yet, use a minimum size
    that's larger than the unhelpful 1x1 default area for exported files. The
    user should be able to draw something even if it's a silly edit.
    
    Closes mypaint/mypaint#241.
