commit 425fbab096b3a9453e0aca3064f50484fd01452d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-06-11 18:22:03 +0100

    drawwindow: switch filename and app name order
    
    * Update the format string for titlebars with filenames
    * Also mark the strings for translation, just in case
    
    I've noticed that most of the programs on my desktop suffix filenames with
    the app name, not vice versa.  This has the effect of putting the more
    user-relevant information, namely the file basename, at the front of the
    titlebar string.  That allows crowded window lists in panels to display
    more of the user-relevant information despite their truncation of titlebar
    strings.

4	2	gui/drawwindow.py

commit 5c8961691d684e0bad6a4b896988d3d36dd9a994
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-27 22:40:57 +0100

    Code robustness: drag and selection
    
    Fix a rare race-condition exception during treeview updates which can
    (sometimes) be triggered by repeated reloading interleaved with bashing
    away at other actions. Basically do not assume that the layer data is
    available in the treeview row data functions.
    
    If the selected layer is completely removed during a drag, updates which
    query it can raise an exception if they're not carefully coded. Fix three
    related exceptions which can be revealed by attempting to drag the last row
    of a flat structure such that it becomes a nested structure.

commit 6d0b66abaec10621c94e772eb17c0b0d5d45bd63
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-24 17:23:14 +0100

    layer: fix args to canonpath, add doctest
    
    RootLayerStack.canonpath()'s position-based fallback for non-empty stacks
    is now "usefirst", i.e. fall back to using the highest layer in the stack.
    This follows the inverting of the layer path addressing, but arguably this
    is better for the user than the old fallback.
    
    Update all uses of the old fallback ("uselowest").
    
    Add unit test for canonpath().

Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-23 23:46:37 +0100

    layer: more events, more update logic
    
    More fine-grained events to watch via the root stack:
    
    * background_changed()
    * background_visible_changed()
    * current_layer_solo_changed()
    * current_layer_previewing_changed()
    
    More display and state management logic. For example, bubbling layers now
    manages the current layer path. Changing layer modes now results in redraws
    directly from the layer stack. Other changes:
    
    * RootLayerStack.current_layer_solo is now an attribute only.

commit 41515f5df7733eb3efa4cae2e6a7c38dcfb07436
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-23 19:19:42 +0100

    layerswindow: visual refresh (icons, viewer)
    
    Draw the viewfinder corners more finely, and pixel-aligned unless the view
    is rotated. Looks much cleaner, IMO.
    
    Viewfinder "L"-shaped corners are no longer 1:1; they reflect the ratio of
    the actual viewport.  Lose the middle "-" for very long viewfinders.
    
    Make icons symbolic. Use the view-zoom icon for clicking outside the
    viewport area, since the action is to move or zoom there.

commit 1d799d3e4e876d14c54d9bea5306b18a63c427a2

0	5	lib/document.py

commit 7fb77b447c813bb11e458d4b1e357b4214df9a74
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-17 20:48:55 +0100

    layer stacks: reverse storage order
    
    Storing layers in rendering order is becoming increasingly bad for any
    purpose other than rendering, so reverse it.
    
    Layers are now stored in order from the highest layer in the stack to the
    lowest. That's the same as OpenRaster's reading and writing order, and the
    same as GTK's tree layout order in a GtkTreeView.
    
    - ORA loading and saving is fixed accordingly in this commit.
    
    - The necessary GUI rework is deferred to a later commit :) having all tree
      paths use the same raw lists of indices will be a HUGE win for finer
      grained layers window updates and general GUI code quality.
    
    - Raise/lower/up/down commands, pick order, backdrop rendering for Sample
      Merged fill all inverted.
    
    - Tree structure notifications from the model now follow the assumed GUI
      rendering order.
    
    This commit also gets rid of some dubious postorder traversals of the layer
    stack in certain places.

4	4	gui/document.py
21	15	lib/command.py
1	2	lib/document.py
154	92	lib/layer.py

commit 0dd763f3a102f4941a922292fd46dcdb8561efb2
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-17 20:30:02 +0100

    LayerStack: notify tree changes for listlike calls
    
    Make the list-like access methods on layer stacks announce any changes they
    make to the current tree structure via the root stack.  This mostly does
    the right thing provided that the nodes in the tree are always unique.
    
    Insert and remove notifications are recursive.

132	7	lib/layer.py

commit b319466a2e6cb6d53ece115fc08f43b1576532ea

Date:   2014-05-17 20:04:28 +0100

    layer: minor exception syntax tweak

commit 6319998f7c5b8dca3847d94a91b817114a2b0193
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-17 19:58:32 +0100

    root stack: can now observe current layer property
    
    Make changes to the current layer an observable event in the lifecycle of
    the root layer stack.
    
    Also make the get/set property functions more robust in the face of bad
    data. In particular, the property can now be set to None to reset it -
    although you'll only see None as a value from the getter if the document is
    empty, which should never be the case.
    
    deeppop() now tries to preserve the current layer path.
    deepremove() does the same, and now returns None (like it should).

41	19	lib/layer.py

commit b42a672ed5a62a19124ce137ce646daea104d5e9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-17 19:29:19 +0100

    Update unique layer naming
    
    If the user tries to rename a layer with a null name, they get the default
    name for this kind of layer as a starting value.
    
    When the UI displays a layer in the layers group with a null name, use the
    default name there too. There's something better than this around the
    corner; for now it's just safest to make the view code not permute the
    model.
    
    Layer names are uniquified when added to the root stack using deepinsert().
    
    Remove ancient name='' args during layer handling in various places.

commit b925cb049bfaf1c467385ac5eb331d0bd46ee3f1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-05-17 18:42:05 +0100

    layers: remove old layer expanded/collapsed state
    
    The expansion state of a layer lived in the model, and this was dubious.
    Whether the layer is expanded or collapsed in the GUI is a matter for the
    GUI components alone. It's OK for the model itself to signal that it would
    like the interface to expand or collapse a path, however, and it would be
    OK to reflect (but not store) expansion state in the model one day should
    we choose to save it.
    
    Remove expand and collapse management options from layer bubbling. This
    command should only have one codepath and it should do the Right Thing™.
    
    (This commit will break things a bit until the new layerswindow code in the
    pipeline starts using the new expand/collapse events)

0	17	gui/layerswindow.py
40	43	lib/layer.py

commit 197b78c76e509a20ad574f3c79f90fa9ba44a74f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-23 20:06:48 +0100

    gui.document: brush change cmds now flush updates
    
    Flush updates before adjusting brush settings when the user changes the
    radius, opacity, or colour. This is to address changing these values while
    painting a long stroke: in these cases, the stroke should be split into a
    fragment before and a fragment after the change.

9	0	gui/document.py

commit 3b13c5ee1f08185438201ae5df0140e066f46e58
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-13 01:32:28 +0100

    Generalize old "stroke splitting" call
    
    * Refactor stroke splitting as a general input flush request
    * Refactored freehand painting accordingly
    * Refactored geometric lines tool accordingly
    * Refactored layer moving accordingly
    * Fixes https://gna.org/bugs/?21854
    
    Switch model "stroke splitting" mechanism over to a more general
    replacement covering all types of undoable change to the working document.
    What used to be done as a "stroke split" should now be done as a flush
    request on the model, flush_updates(), which pulls in changes from anywhere
    registered to provide them. This naturally includes the current interaction
    mode, and may include other sources of document updates.
    
    Doing this allows highly interactive tools which don't draw strokes (e.g.
    Move Layer, Fill) to finalize what they're doing when the user invokes a
    command which does something else to the document (e.g. Clear Layer).
    
    The neatest way of using this new mechanism this is to retool the undo
    stack commands for interactive modes to do work between their construction,
    and their committing onto the CommandStack. The document is then updated
    interactively via the "live" but uncommitted command object so that it can
    keep track of everything that happens.

2	2	gui/brushcolor.py
252	111	gui/canvasevent.py
3	1	gui/document.py

5	0	lib/document.py

commit a8ddd5fd35650fde7d850aecdf27a54282461cc9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-23 19:38:04 +0100

    observable: tidy up repr() forms
    
    Make repr()s which contain details of bound methods not require the
    underlying object of the method to be repr()-able yet. This is because
    observers can be set up during instantiation of the underlying object, and
    it's unduly strict to require them to be fully repr()able at this point.
    
    Also, brevity is nicer.

35	11	lib/observable.py

commit acf12045d524422c5e7c02430161444f2dc945ca
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-23 19:03:05 +0100

    observable: Python3 compat
    
    MyPaint doesn't use Py3 yet, but it will one day. This submodule is fairly
    nice syntactic sugar though, so make it forward-compatible for others to
    reuse, since that was always the intent.

5	4	lib/observable.py

commit 35a44769dcd3f06a1cda1f1a341f98e1bdffefa5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-13 19:42:13 +0100

    observable: squelch recursive calls to events
    
    Rationale: an event notification on an object correlates to a single
    lifecycle event. Recursive calls are meaningless and probably erroneous.

11	2	lib/observable.py

commit f8158d40ea9b940fc22a4af513d42151a62dda6f

Date:   2014-04-13 19:38:54 +0100

    stroke: minor stuff - possibly not needed?

3	2	lib/stroke.py

commit ddb327bbbb3a861ac1d1caa560945663b79a14c7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-04-13 19:14:05 +0100

    filehandling: decrease the "don't care" time again
    
    Decrease the period of time the user must spend working to gain a
    confirmation dialog at app shutdown about the unsaved work to 1 second by
    default. People still complain about this, with good reason!
    
    We always attempted to justify the these excessively long "even bother
    asking" timeouts - 8 and previously 30 (!) seconds - by citing testing
    cycles and the faster exits allowing for faster testing and debugging
    turnaround.  Since we have debug flags during build and at runtime now,
    this justification for the default is more clearly fallacious.
    
    Now if these are turned on, then the "don't care" period will be greater:
    15 seconds with both enabled, 8 seconds with only one, 1 second by default.

31	12	gui/filehandling.py

commit 5c7ab4d61e9e409eabe08a9c1dafbed4bc8aa1fa

commit f4bba9c24e27ffc8b14062fc0f3059a61641c30c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-03-21 18:56:08 +0000

    layer area invalidations: modernize notifications
    
    Migrate layer content observation to something that doesn't involve copying
    notification callbacks around whenever we copy a layer. Non-root layers
    must now be constructed with a ref to the root of their tree, and
    invalidations are forwarded there. Layers are still unaware of their
    location in the tree, however, and do not manage a parent link.

commit 02bc51aa40df912e59d16b133b88e98eb038df9c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-03-21 22:18:55 +0000

    LayerStack: use accessor methods, not _layers attr
    
    The underlying list of layers in a LayerStack is intended to be fairly
    private: modifying it should be done via the LayerStack methods so we have
    the option of one day adding cascading notifications.

commit 04e681f7fbc30db6e4db550e02485f03a72a20f5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-03-25 18:48:01 +0000

    doc: abstract out the layer picking iteration
    
    Fix https://gna.org/bugs/?21847 - hiding a parent layer or locking it now
    causes its descendent layers to be un-pickable.
    
    Layer picking and context picking both rely on the same iteration across
    layers tree leaves, so split out the iteration to avoid code duplication
    and drift (which was already evident). Also make the radius and opacity
    cutoff parameters tweakable.

55	19	gui/document.py

commit 32d806638831459bc4f3e9bc30d53b64430b61ee

Date:   2014-04-10 22:25:18 +0100

    icon sizes: fix a GTK 3.12 exception during load
    
    Gtk.icon_size_register() no longer returns wrapped enum types under this
    version of GTK.  We probably don't need to register these size anyway,
    according to recent docs.

commit 44551e6cd1dc0322194f4a36825b4e7704595902
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-04-07 00:56:59 +0200

    Use relative path for brushlib git submodule
    
    This way the same protocol (git/https/ssh) is used for submodule
    as the top-level repo, avoiding problems with fetching if you
    don't have a ssh account on gitorious.
    If you fetched before, you may need to delete the two lines in .git/config which says:
    [submodule "brushlib"]
            url = git@gitorious.org:mypaint/libmypaint.git
    
    before re-running "git submodule update --init"

1	1	.gitmodules

commit bedbe56ae767a5e891c41fd037f38edc8026fa45
Author: Brien Dieterle <briend@gmail.com>
Date:   2014-03-15 11:47:45 +0100

    brushlib: new tilt calculation
    
    Tilt value did vary (incorrectly) with ascension.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?21735
    
    Quote from http://sourceforge.net/p/linuxwacom/mailman/linuxwacom-devel/?viewmonth=201203
    
    "GIMP, Inkscape, and MyPaint all treat the values they get from GTK as
    the normalized length of the tool's projection along the corresponding
    axis (they take the arctangent of the values to get an azimuth). While
    GTK doesn't explicitly state that this is what applications receive,
    its a reasonable reading of their documentation: "tilt attributes
    range from -1.0 to 1.0 ... representing the maximum tilt to the left
    or up ... [and] to the right or down". It looks like in practice GTK
    actually only scales the tilt values it gets from X based on the
    minimum and maximum. Its not what applications expect, but appears to
    work well enough that nobody's bothered to file a bug."

1	9	brushlib/mypaint-brush.c

commit 4b42c87b507786b967ffe3a306386223c83a8700
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-02-11 12:27:32 +0000

    layer model: use Compositing-1's. Add mask modes.
    
    Re-enable the useful group features that OpenRaster 0.0.2 doesn't allow,
    like visibility, locking etc.
    
    Implement a useful subset of compositing modes to allow masking, and use an
    SVG-like layer stack rendering model similar to that defined by
    
      http://www.w3.org/TR/compositing-1/
    
    Masking is achieved by making an isolated group containing a mask layer as
    its uppermost layer, and setting the mask layer's mode to "Destination In"
    or "Destination Out".  Yes, that's a bit fiddly at the moment. Yes, special
    "Masked group" or "Masked layer" classes would probably be more usable.
    
    Update the UI to make all this machinery available to the user.
    
    These new rendering modes can be less efficient than just src-over
    compositing on top of a solid background, but expose flags on the C++ mode
    objects to allow the Python code to make smart decisions about whether to
    skip things or invoke faster code paths.
    
    Add test code for the speedup flags and general error-freeness of the new
    layer mode code.

9	9	gui/layermodes.py

commit b295eeabab804bbcd9eef1efb3babbd54991b5cf
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-02-02 23:08:30 +0000

    OpenRaster conformance: nobble some group features
    
    To fully conform to the current OpenRaster draft specification, rendering
    flags like opacity or compositeop need to be disallowed on layer stacks,
    which implies that layer groups must not render in isolated mode, to use
    terminology from the W3C Compositing-1 specification.
    
    For now, since I'd like to get the other parts of this crazy refactor back
    into master, we must silently prevent the user from changing, loading,
    saving, or seeing certain layer properties if the layer is a layer group.
    In other words, turn off the new, useful things that layer groups would
    allow until the specification can be updated, a process which will require
    agreement from the GIMP and Krita devs.

9	0	gui/document.py
22	0	gui/layerswindow.py
14	1	lib/document.py
69	9	lib/layer.py

commit 4370c8904dde4befd085a098ff38102c50749bc0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-01-09 12:18:12 +0000

    fill: rework Sample Merged for new layer stack API
    
    Just doing a big pile of Merge Downs is not the same thing as compositing a
    tree-structured layers stack properly. It's inefficient too, for flood
    fill. Instead, composite the tiles that flood_fill() needs to sample from
    using a temporary on-demand adaptor, caching the readonly source tiles for
    efficiency when fills reenter already visited tiles.
    
    Abstract out the main flood_fill() routine so it isn't tied to a particular
    source surface implementation.
    
    Layer stacks can now be flood_fill()ed into another layer (although they
    don't support read+write tile access), so Sample Merged just becomes a side
    effect of using the root layer stack as source.

5	6	lib/command.py
20	0	lib/layer.py
161	100	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit fb66a610b58044ebac4edd9285da27308184b728
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-01-07 00:43:31 +0000

    pixbufsurface: add exception handling

    into scanlines: it just crashes. Wrap blit_tile_into() calls inside the
    generator used by fastpng to log the exception even if we can't raise it
    normally at this point.

commit 8366b88b75b01e27fa0d20c27ac46f6937b8bc50

    - Replace with isolated rendering over a cached Cairo checkerboard pattern.
    - Move Layer Solo, Layers Above, and "Layerblink" state to the model. Even
      if they're not saved, they're needed for rendering, and rendering is an

      layer-solo without any major state notifications.

      from the Layers dockable panel.

      Layers Above Current. These modes now show in the dockable too.

commit 5cf4318d5fdfcf6c68e3a712cec5cebd87509935
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-11-28 12:40:42 +0000

    layer: implement copy(), use for Duplicate Layer
    
    Add a generic but customizable copy() method for layers, for use by
    DuplicateLayer. Mostly just shorthand for save/load snapshot, but we also
    replicate layer flags.
    
    Background layers cannot currently be copy()ed.
    
    Implement save/load snapshot for ExternalLayer so that it can be copied.
    The copy and snapshot semantics both demand an independent copy of the
    file, so make load_snapshot() perform a copy within the document working
    directory.

commit 95963e4e26f61afc47e073e957a971b610feaaa9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-27 18:41:20 +0100

    external layers: add load from/save to ORA
    
    Add a basic OpenRaster load and save subsystem for non-bitmap data which
    GdkPixbuf knows how to support. SVG is pretty much the only useful example
    of this sort of data right now.
    
    The vague idea here is that past revisions of the external file to be
    edited will reside in the layer's private tempdir for the duration of a
    session, and that editing will be modal so that MyPaint's undo and redo
    work.  However, this isn't set in stone just yet: could add a file watcher
    interface instead, at a later date.

    handle. Basically copied here from lib.document, with some API completeness
    stuff added in.

commit bc68f3da14d9721ce30fc649e17aa70e5ff857fd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-11-14 02:39:51 +0000

    model: working-doc tempdir, and cleanup at exit
    
    Add a working-doc tempdir which persists for as long as a document is open,
    i.e. from opening one document to opening the next. This tempdir
    persists for as long as the undo stack (and its actions) have a meaningful
    relationship with the loaded document.
    
    External layers are expected to keep loaded files at various undo points in
    the temp dir. It may be useful to add detection and cleanup of unreachable
    disk state to things that drop off the undo and redo stacks too, in order
    to prevent this area growing too big. This will do for now though.
    
    Automatically clean up this area at application exit, and when
    transitioning from one doc to the next. Both are guarded by dialogs.

1	0	gui/drawwindow.py
76	21	lib/document.py

commit cb2ef7e09ccd5c8ab2af1fc4efa79974c341a57f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-27 17:57:14 +0100

    non-painting layers: fix loading, painting
    
    Fixes necessary to support layers which cannot be painted to.
    - Reject attempts to paint to layers with no stroke_to() method
    - Allow ORAs to be loaded with current layers that don't have a strokemap

    I guess.

commit 2df70902d0f8736ff29f75b7036373a0f52f09ea
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-27 17:45:41 +0100

    layer moves: refactor cleanup(), split+customize
    
    The cleanup method is now called after everything has been done. This
    allows it to be overridden to initiate more events, e.g. moving strokemaps
    in later idle routines. Update API docs to reflect this.
    
    Add custom layer move classes for painting layers, and the external layer
    stub.

commit 6a87b7ffb4326fec2a3d95a526662d3716ead29b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-01-15 15:06:45 +0000

    Update README: librsvg dep.; remove gtk3 notes
    
    Mention librsvg as a runtime dependency. As noted in
    https://gna.org/bugs/?21482 , the GtkPixbuf loader module is commonly
    supplied in a separate optional package, and users will need to make sure
    that it's installed in order to get icons now.
    
    Remove the GTK3 notes, since the migration bug has now been closed.

1	1	README
0	72	README.gtk3

commit 7dd6b455098c0120e232384e8e0c2c0590b5448f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2014-01-05 17:38:10 +0000

    prefs: UI updates; large toolbar icons by default
    
    Space out the prefs window a bit more, and add an explanatory note to the
    bottom of the View page telling users they'll have to restart to see the
    icon size and dark theme variants.
    
    The "large" (24x24, same size as before) icons are prettier, so turn them
    on by default. There is a known problem with Ubuntu 12.04 LTS (and similar
    versions of GTK) where larger symbolic icons do not render correctly. This
    can be worked around by upgrading or by selecting small icons.

commit e9cf05a00da0977572ff07c0f9e14664a5a4c029
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-30 04:27:36 +0000

    freehand: split out, add pressure/tilt interp
    
    Split out freehand mode class: it's getting way too complex to keep around
    in the base module.
    
    Events gathered by the eventhack code do not have pressure or tilt
    information. Infer this information from surrounding motion-notify events
    using a cubic spline to ensure a smoother fit.
    
    Handle mouse button-releases as zero-pressure events for consistency, and
    explicitly handle transitions from zero to nonzero pressure and vice versa
    to avoid "hook" artefacts.

commit 107cbff87e709731f4b71ee4e708e12a44bf318a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-24 15:06:28 +0100

    freehand: rearrange some processing
    
    Detect and fix zero-dtime events earlier in the chain than before. Move
    tilt and pressure fixups earlier too.
    
    The goal here is to enqueue only arrays of raw absolute floats that we can
    interpolate between nicely as needed.

126	109	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 877108796deb007a18cbc8c4f3a5dbdd194471d9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-22 04:15:31 +0100

    eventhack: interpolate pressure and tilt axes
    
    The eventhack code doesn't record pressure or tilt since that requires
    knowledge of the maxima and minima for their raw readings in order to be
    compatible with GDK's translated values. Such code would be fragile, so
    instead interpolate their values based on the detailed eventhack times and
    the time and axis values from the coarse events that make it through GDK's
    motion compression.
    
    Move pressure and tilt faking and sanity checking up front, since we now
    interpolate using the sanitized values from this phase.

62	48	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 9c5178aabd9eb56586a74524bcd0e39a9da9000a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-21 12:55:17 +0100

    eventhack: acquire GIL, bump data tuple refcount
    
    Ubuntu 13.10 (and maybe other systems) require the GIL to be held during
    then event filter, so wrap the filter in the appropriate calls. Not
    required for all systems, but it's good practice to do this given that the
    filter uses Python API calls outside the scope of the Python interpreter,
    where execution may or may not be threaded. Fixes a segfault on affected
    systems.
    
    http://docs.python.org/2/c-api/init.html#non-python-created-threads
    
    Also bump the data tuple's refcount for the duration of the filter's
    operation, if the display type is supported. Technically not needed given
    the framework in which it's called, but will be safer in case of error.

10	4	lib/eventhack.hpp

commit d9fd3bea655ec3dc2311eff732a04670f67ee585
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-20 03:13:11 +0100

    input events: add event filter to improve capture
    
    Add an experimental GDK event filter to capture events before GDK itself
    can motion-compress them and thus break our drawing accuracy. See
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?21003
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20822
    https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=702392
    
    Good coding practice dictates that we don't try to do too much inside this
    fairly horrid little hack, so we only queue the pointer position and the
    timestamp. For all the events GDK 3.8+ drops on the floor during a frame
    clock cycle (which the filter now captures), we use the tilt and pressure
    info from the event on the event that did make it through. Interpolating
    would be better.
    
    Before: 50-60 events/second for all devices.
    After: 200 events/second with an Intuos 5. 80 with a touchpad.
    
    This hack only works on X11 platforms right now

commit 44df033f09f14eb2a9de6580740b4749fcc6a3b3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-10 21:30:49 +0100

    Fix incorrect path for palettes on first run
    
    Fix an "No such file or directory: u'./palettes/MyPaint_Default.gpl'"
    exception when installing fully. MyPaint wasn't communicating its palette
    search path correctly to its color record-keeper component after creating a
    new-style config tree on its first run. This was only happening when
    running the first time from somewhere other than the build tree.
    
    Compounding the error, running from the build tree just one time somewhat
    unhelpfully makes this error message go away by loading the default palette
    from the file in the build tree, where the default value happens to be the
    right path. This sequence of events conspires to hide the underlying fault
    from testers and developers in subsequent runs.
    
    Fixed by making the parameters to ColorManager mandatory (since then
    failure to supply useful args will result in a more identifiable
    exception).
    
    Thanks to deevad for the good spot here: https://gna.org/bugs/?21184

1	1	gui/brushcolor.py

commit 852c3c89502690ab1702c6a77d9d19e9eacde119
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-10-07 17:22:24 +0100

    workspace: make paned contents prettier
    
    Add visible frames implemented as GtkScrolledWindow wrappers for the
    sidebar and canvas Paned slots to improve the distinctiveness of these
    elements from their flanking toolbar and statusbar.
    
    We now automatically repack the central canvas's widget hierarchy to make
    its frame vanish when entering fullscreen mode, and undo the change when
    leaving.  Users will want the full extent of the screen when fullscreened.
    
    Using a GtkScrolledWindow and not a GtkFrame for the canvas makes the UI
    more consistent (my test themes assign different appearances to frames and
    scrolledwindows inside paned). It also raises the possibility of "merely"
    exposing a couple of GtkAdjustments on the TiledDrawWidget to allow real
    scrolling, at least when MyPaint is not in fullscreen mode.  A somewhat
    dynamic system where the visible extents are the actual document bbox plus
    one sensibly-sized page might work acceptably (i.e. patches welcome).

44	3	gui/workspace.py

commit c902fe1cb6ccda70d49a5d1aba87958cdee34848
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2013-07-13 20:53:26 +0200

    lib: Avoid circular dependency between tiledsurface and pixbufsurface+strokemap

    workspace: test for attrs, don't use exceptions
    
    Code style: it's better to test for attrs explicitly rather than rely on
    catching the exceedingly generic AttributeError. Rationale: these attrs can
    be, and often are, methods with their own code. We want to know about this
    exception if/when it happens.

commit 6dfbf11d94b345e1e1c0e5185c1d3fda1aced033
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-09-07 18:36:37 +0100

    Basic flood fill feature
    
    Add a very basic flood fill command. Currently only fills the current
    layer, and does not consider layers underneath the current one when
    considering which area to fill. Zero-alpha areas can be filled.
    
    MyPaint uses an infinite canvas, so the flood fill is limited by the
    document's effective bounding box (i.e. its frame if enabled, or the extent
    of all its tiles in all layers).

commit 373c2208f8a811cf704b37c72aad668b4aecbe17
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-09-04 13:17:00 +0100

    canvasevent: turn off stroke queueing
    
    Stroke data queueing (and its cheesy interpolation) wasn't liked by our
    testers, so turn it off by default. We can remove it later on if the GTK
    team provide a fix for motion compression, or if we come up with a proper
    solution ourselves; conversely, we can make it an option if that's not
    going to happen.
    
    https://mail.gna.org/public/mypaint-discuss/2013-09/msg00000.html
    
    Event queueing is still enabled, since it speeds things up measurably and
    doesn't introduce any slow-tracking-like behaviour.
    
    Switch to collections.deque rather than list for queues, again in the name
    of reducing overhead during event processing. Deques are just under twice
    as fast as lists for queue and stack behaviour.

107	42	gui/canvasevent.py

commit bcfb1c74a3a910abb0cade76a2aa0e4901b1a4f7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-20 23:47:59 +0100

    load_ora(): fix mispositioned frames
    
    Bugfix: the active frame size was being set, but not its position (which
    should always be the origin of the MyPaint canvas). More apparent now that
    the frame is enabled automatically if a non-whole-document-bbox size is
    found in a loaded OpenRaster image.

2	1	lib/document.py

commit 030fcabe8fee83474b2d3443a825bb2dd41e8b65
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-20 23:28:17 +0100

    strokemap: allow non-tile-aligned stroke loading
    
    Permit stroke data which isn't precisely tile aligned to be loaded.
    Necessary because it's easy to generate such data merely by moving the
    frame's left or top edge before saving.

3	6	lib/document.py
9	1	lib/layer.py

commit 3414b620886dff3a2a7f2a940b01fbb4c68bcd3a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-17 17:16:50 +0100

    stroke idletask: remove immediate processing
    
    Processing perceptual tile diffing at the end of a long scribble with huge
    brush was causing UI holdups due to some of the work being done immediately
    over a certain threshold. Since the user now has an immediate sense of how
    much stroke work is queued due to backend processing (they'll see by how
    much a hefty stroke is lagging) they'll probably hold off when things get
    bogged down. This hopefully kills off an annoying hang for no easily
    discernible reason.
    
    If the unboundedness of these queues becomes a memory problem, we can
    impose throttles on the input side, and add some UI to give the user a
    sense of when the input stroke queue is very full.

1	1	gui/canvasevent.py
13	30	lib/idletask.py
63	41	lib/strokemap.py

commit 7127efd94ceff8868fbba1cd09ac30e30ef100b1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-04 23:30:27 +0100

    freehand mode: improve scribble responsiveness
    
    Improve responsiveness and the effectiveness of Slow Tracking under GTK3 by
    processing input events with as fast a turnaround as possible, and
    deferring both motion data cleanup and stroke rendering via a pair of
    queues. Adds a degree of linear interpolation, primarily to make smaller
    chunks of work for the backend renderer, allowing it to return quicker and
    stop lagging the CPU cores (one of which will be handing input events at
    the same time).
    
    This helps address the problem since GTK3 was turned on by default in
    commit 90b3ade2 whereby very, very fast scribble strokes would turn into a
    series of line segments rather than nice smooth curves, even with Slow
    Tracking. The speed with which GTK3 delivers input events seems to be very
    much more bound by concurrent CPU use than with GTK2 for reasons which have
    me guessing.
    
    Brush authors will need to introduce a small amount of Slow Tracking (not
    Slow Tracking Per Dab) to allow this fix to take effect for their
    super-fast scribbly brushes: existing ones with Slow Tracking in the 0.5 to
    1.0 range seem to do OK on my system at least, so try that.
    
    Major user benefit of these per-mode-instance queues: strokes which are
    slow to render are now seen to be "working slowly" in the UI, and can be
    cancelled during the render/display crawl by pressing Escape. Better than
    staring a blank unresponsive screen, anyway.
    
    Fairly hefty potential drawback: greater total overhead. The finer chunks
    mean a reduced capacity for MP stuff. Perhaps some messing with
    begin_atomic/end_atomic and when they're called might work (more
    stroke queues...)

173	38	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 7e27a6905a9baf7f5509e26187f8d2c350f0d092
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-20 00:40:45 +0100

    load_ora(): enable frame if it was customized
    
    Enable or disable the frame when loading an OpenRaster file. The frame is
    enabled if it's not the same as the calculated MyPaint image size, i.e.
    the extent of the image's tiles. Avoids having to save a flag in stack.xml,
    at the expense of some possible user confusion.
    
    Users who change the frame extents hopefully get what they want when an
    image is loaded now. Users who want an infinite sketchpad and no frames on
    loading should also be happy.
    
    To revert from a customized frame to a default one, set it to the bounding
    box of the document. There's a button for that in the dialog, but perhaps
    it needs a "reset everything" button too?

13	3	lib/document.py

    Adjusting the frame, enabling, and disabling it are now command stack
    actions which can be undone or redone.

commit 4d8c385c5c6eb661af7d5b344d2f1685736a5845
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-18 18:04:50 +0100

    Fix brush settings not updating until editor shown

    dropdown controls for the same things were not working until the brush
    editor window was shown for the first time. Fixed by moving the callback
    binding for these GtkAdjustments to the main application instance.
    
    Document the dict that contains these things, since that's the primary
    interface for accessing them.

8	6	gui/brusheditor.py

commit 78d020a3db6e99be8b3b3fc699cfe602c354a724
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-02 19:55:20 +0100

    brusheditor: various fixes & UI tweaks
    
    Bugfix: update the brush settings user interface when a new brush preset is
    chosen by the user. Doing this discards the current set of brush settings,
    replacing them with the newly chosen set, and the UI was not reflecting
    this.
    
    Clone now copies the currently edited settings, and the current brush's
    icon into its newly created brush.
    
    Various language and icon choices in the UI. Ensure the subwindow is
    smaller than 800x600.

commit 13f6f24c7896c0fdc70951eea0aec68c9625bb9c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-08-01 23:03:47 +0100

    brusheditor: tidy up brush settings editor GUI
    
    New look for the brush settings editor, reusing all of its code into a new
    module. The editor now takes the form of an index tree with the settings on
    the left, a main area with base values and curve foldouts, and lots of
    lovely whitespace and headings and indent. It should be more comprehensible
    to new users like this, hopefully!
    
    For my Xfce4 desktop at least, subwindows in fullscreen need to EITHER
    reject keyboard input entirely and be added to the keyboard manager, OR
    accept it and be fully modal dialogs with properly set transient-for hints.
    Mixing the two styles leads to Great Confusion in fullscreen mode.  This
    applies to things like spinners even, so the brush input curves now use
    scalebuttons. Hopefully OK there...
    
    The GUI layout for this window is now defined in a GtkBuilder XML file,
    editable in glade (see glade/run.sh). It's a bit of an evolving hack given
    that we have to template it for all the fiddly little per-input widgets,
    but it seems to work sanely.

7	0	gui/application.py
791	0	gui/brusheditor.glade
934	0	gui/brusheditor.py

10	0	gui/resources.xml

    Brush icon editor: split out, rework
    
    Remove icon editing from the brush settings editor.  Editing icons is a
    different task with a different work-flow: the icon must be locked for
    editing, and can then be worked on with brushes, perhaps its own perhaps
    others.
    
    Rework the brush icon editor into the newer style, with big friendly action
    buttons down the right hand side.  It also shows exactly what's being
    edited, and what the edit state is all through the process.

commit 63980f199493e2cc5c4f4c5cd40734490e6ce786
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-06-09 20:56:00 +0100

    workspace: support parameterized construction
    
    Move object creation out to a separately defined factory+cache to keep
    things simpler in workspace.py.
    
    Convert tool widget lifetime signals to @events.
    
    Tool widgets are now long-lived. Turns out that making GTK widgets
    short-lived will just leak with the version of PyGI I'm using, so use a
    cache for the tool widgets and convert the API to hide/show.  Further
    encapsulate direct access to the tool widgets too: shouldn't be needed;
    tool widgets should have no app-specific magic embedded in them.
    
    Docstring and test updates.

5	5	gui/application.py
19	13	gui/drawwindow.py
203	240	gui/workspace.py

commit 730a4dee6e7fc945de925f8ee66f5d7a20fc380c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-06-09 20:46:09 +0100

    Add a standardized gobject factory
    
    Allows construction of classes on the fly, based on their class's GType
    system name (which is auto-registered in modern Python GTK+ code), plus a
    bundle of parameters which further identify the widget needed.
    
    Rationale: support dynamic tool widget tabs, including ones for individual
    brush collections.

261	0	gui/objfactory.py

    have some leaks that requires us to be a little more careful anyway.

commit 9b9ca04bda26cd2edcace1c76ee34e512842ca78
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-06-01 22:28:26 +0100

    logging: pretty colours, and --logfile now copies
    
    Update logging: pretty ANSI colours with a specialised formatter, for POSIX
    console (isatty()) logs only. Colourize by level, assign attributes for
    interpolated strings and numbers in the message templates.
    
    The standard Python logging module supports more than one handler, so
    reimplement --logfile so it sends a (plain, uncoloured) copy of the log
    messages to its output file rather than just reallocating sys.stderr and
    sys.stdout. However we still do the reallocation trick to catch GTK
    assertions on the Windows platform, or any other installation that logs to
    files by default.

17	7	gui/main.py
91	5	mypaint.py

commit 0b54e0223c147b078877339a322a45ad2272faf0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-05-31 12:39:19 +0100

    workspace: parameterizable building from layouts
    
    Allow tool widget "tabs" in the workspace to be constructed with static
    parameters. These parameters can't be changed over the lifetime of the
    widget, and get saved and restored in the usual way.
    
    This is intended to allow the brush and colour selectors to be split up
    across multiple tabs: parameters will hold the brush group name, or the
    colour selector subtype.

1	1	gui/drawwindow.py
31	17	gui/workspace.py

11	10	gui/brushcreationwidget.py

commit 34e53bac8ff8107ecd6333d4cbae2ee881b8c051
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-05-31 01:16:00 +0100

    Add weakref-friendly syntax sugar for observers
    
    Python decorators for defining observer list interfaces in a way that's a
    bit more public and formal and documentable than a plain old list member.
    Uses some cute C#-like syntax for tacking on callbacks and additional
    behaviour as tersely as possible.
    
    Observable "@event"s set up this way store weakrefs to their observer
    objects if the callback is a bound method, to allow them to die off
    naturally.  Not needed right now, but it'll be necessary later on to allow
    dynamic (parameterized, and shorter-lived) tool widgets to observe the
    brushmanager, for example.

309	0	lib/observable.py

commit 98b98a87fb01119ad00901e2f309d1467fe981f8
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-05-31 00:17:21 +0100

    Various debug prints: replace w/ standard logging
    
    Python has a standard logging module with lots of goodies. Categorization
    of messages and module reporting to name just two. Let's start using it in
    place of print (or print(), considering Python 3).

commit 845c21f5df160040faf962d832b7ebdefea89087
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-05-30 10:56:27 +0100

    workspace: integrate tab-based layout replacement
    
    Begin using the new gui.workspace layout code. This replaces a large chunk
    of old, crufty code with a nicer system that makes better use of the screen
    space and is built more closely on top of internal Gtk types.
    
    User improvements/changes:
     * Sidebars are now present on both sides of the screen.
     * Drag tabs around to reorder and to move docked tools between
       sidebars and a floating window state.
     * Fullscreen is a bit more understandable: there's an auto-hide timeout,
       and poking the sides of the screen or hovering over a hidden floating
       window reveals the hidden controls.
     * Fullscreen state is remembered between invocations now.

    (lib.document) at construction time. Instead, feed in the model to use with
    set_model() after construction. If it's not set, draw a blank screen.

    controller (gui.document.Document) to the code which creates a
    model/view/controller cluster.

    the number of physical cores. For instance: export OMP_NUM_THREADS=2

commit fbec5171eaad627fe663b977d877f75047f9e02c
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2013-06-30 09:28:44 +0200

    gtk3: fix tdw display update glitch
    
    Don't use cr.user_to_device() any more because we didn't create the
    cairo context, so we can't know what "device" means. To transform
    points, we need to maintain our own transformation matrix now, because
    the cairo context includes the offset from the menu to our canvas.
    
    2nd half of bugfix for https://gna.org/bugs/?20904
    
    Also, drop some GTK2 codepaths. This stuff should be checked for
    performance regressions some day.

102	120	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 1860c35b7363ffff87747384e393ddb3c8f172c8
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2013-06-29 21:43:53 +0200

    gtk3: fix tdw rendering translation error
    
    partial fix for https://gna.org/bugs/?20904
    
    GTK3 uses cairo internally now, so we may start out with a translation
    when rendering. The previous code did create cairo context directly,
    always starting with the identity matrix.

1	1	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>

    gtk3: rename pygtkcompat.py --> gtk2compat.py

commit 77370fdcc91e01f8c0100c9221d7193c504bf456
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-27 12:21:33 +0000

    gtk3: helpers fixes for GTK3
    
    Fix breakage when saving under GTK3: "TypeError: GInterface.__init__()
    takes exactly 0 arguments (1 given)" with gio.File(filename).
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20650
    
    Gio.File is no longer the simplest way of generating a canonical URI for
    thumbnailing: GLib now sports routines for doing this. So use those. This
    commit breaks PyGTK, but nobody was too fussed about the prefs changes
    which also broke PyGTK. Let's just move on, I guess.
    
    Fix import order to let the tests run.
    
    Update docs.

4	6	lib/helpers.py

commit 9d5513f32d46a984a16e96fa4bf7d96002ce0dcf
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-27 03:14:00 +0000

    glade: fix runner script
    
    Certain installations of Glade have no hardcoded data search path, and bomb
    if they can't find icons for their main shipped catalogs. Assume the spec
    defaults for $XDG_DATA_DIRS if it's not set prior to overriding it.

commit 39dc933631926a96e4c614ed9cb553692d08f06c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-24 01:09:09 +0000

    gtk3: replace deprecated GtkStyle accesses
    
    GtkStyle and gtk_widget_get_style() are deprecated in GTK3, and can cause
    exceptions in certain unclear circumstances, so replace it with code using
    the more modern GtkStyleContext.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20637
    
    Also draw the layout.py stuff specially again in GTK3: helps discriminate
    the widgets.
    
    Tested with MediterraneanNight and Greybird.

    app: function access to the singleton

    constructed from glade can get required handles onto the application
    singleton without requiring a ref to it as a constructor argument, or
    dubious calls to set_app() methods during their lifetime. Simplifies
    writing glade-compatible widgets, at the expense of something that smells a
    lot like a global variable.

commit cf723b74cde5d1878a2bc148e5e22b5c60a6e2a1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-12 00:09:34 +0000

    startup: add support for XDG user config dirs
    
    Add support for XDG-style user config and data areas on POSIX systems, for
    new users of MyPaint only. "User data" means a user's brushes, backgrounds,
    and scratchpads. "User configurations" are the keybindings and preferences.
    
    * User data will be stored in ~/.local/share/mypaint
    * User configurations will be stored in ~/.config/mypaint
    
    There is no migration script, but if ~/.mypaint exists it will continue to
    work for now. Experienced users can migrate their existing configs and data
    to the new location manually, and then delete the old .mypaint directory,
    but be careful about scratchpad settings using the old directory's path.
    
    The old command-line -c option will still make an old-style combined config
    area. Use this if you need to be certain, or use the XDG environment vars.
    
    On the Windows platform, both locations should use CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA same
    as before - a nice quirk of what glib gives us. However, not all glib
    versions do this correctly, so this commit also officially removes support
    for pre-2.28 glib in order to support Windows more consistently.
    
    Shorter version: we now require the lowest stable glib version which
    includes commit 9d80c361418f94c609840ec9f83741aede7e482c. That's glib
    2.28+ (Debian testing/Wheezy and up, or Ubuntu Oneiric).

63	37	gui/application.py
5	3	gui/backgroundwindow.py
8	17	gui/filehandling.py
74	24	gui/main.py
43	32	mypaint.py

    functionality is now supported via the editable palette widget.

commit 1746d4c8a74d95b2c0eff2ca6d5d2206b6af657a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-16 21:49:07 +0000

    thumbnails: use GIO to make canonical URIs
    
    Minor interoperability bugfix: saved thumbnails were not being stored under
    the right names if the paths to the files being thumbnailed included
    brackets (and possibly other edge cases). Add a test case for the URI
    generation.
    
    Using GIO adds no new dependencies on a Debian-based system: it's bundled
    with gobject in python-gobject-2.

commit 1cd0a557aebb8f4dadb702cf3a1b58b43fe26aed
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-08 12:55:48 +0000

    doc: fix regression in fit-view toggle
    
    Calling the view-changed observers in an idle routine broke a (somewhat
    fragile) interlock used for making the behaviour of the FitView toggle more
    sensible. Fix by making those calls immediate.

13	8	gui/document.py

commit 2ebc1458fd62f47ddc723f5579883735df37cb98
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-06 08:44:13 +0000

    doc: call view-change observers in idler
    
    After user testing and profiling, call the view_changed_observers in a
    low-priority background idler to avoid excessive recalculations and
    sluggishness when panning the main view using the DragMode.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20583
    
    Manipulations done with the preview window are done at a higher priority
    since they need more immediate feedback.

27	3	gui/document.py
2	1	gui/previewwindow.py

commit f9aefe2bbc79347029be53d6e9689c2e1afe26d7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-02 22:29:32 +0000

    tdw: remove redundant observer interfaces
    
    Remove the defunct rotation and movement observer interfaces from
    gui.tileddrawwidget. No problem with spying on changes to individual TDW's
    transformations, but it should be done as a single observer interface and
    not broadcast details of individual rotations and translations. It's better
    to keep the state in one place.
    
    For now, there's view_changed_observers on the main gui.document.Document,
    which does the same thing. It could be moved to the TDW if needed; it's
    only in doc as an evolutionary accident.
    
    Reverts changes introduced in fddaf9dc6dc042b44bf28411fb78ea417589aee7

0	14	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 45cf49515e7665f9b96c590eb22093dd2baf8e92
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-03-02 22:17:52 +0000

    preview window: get ready for integration
    
    Fixups and code tidying for alown's <ali@lown.me.uk> excellent preview
    window addition to work with the post-1.1.0 changes. Thanks, Ali!
    
    Some functional and code changes here:
    
    - Rotation bug fixed.
    - Hook into the new view_changed_observers interface for updates.
    - Overlay minimises screen updates.
    - Widget zooming shows all of the main view rectangle, as well as the
      document bbox.
    - Click to move the main-view rectangle because it's simpler, though
      drag works too.
    
    This UI isn't completely settled yet, and perhaps we need an arrow to show
    the "up" direction on the overlay, and any mirroring (suggestions, please!)
    But it's working well enough to be integrated now, hopefully :)

315	211	gui/previewwindow.py

commit f3070e6bb72a4447d6f4e3eafd9cb695598b1c04
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-27 01:50:53 +0000

    preview: use effective bbox; reduce rescale freq.
    
    Use the effective bounding box for the document: if the user has the
    frame turned on, it should be respected.
    
    Reduce the frequency of rescale-and-recenters a bit by only doing it
    when the bounds of the document have grown. Prevents some UI juddering.
    
    Catch new widget size allocations and rescale then.

commit a6af6a2270199668608aea76fed6e370b840a68b

    mask editor: update New dialog, allow luma changes

    when considering colour schemes fr dark and light values. Scroll wheel
    will do for now - do we need a Reference Luma slider?
    
    Luma in these sub-dialogs is based on the working brush's luma, but
    constrained between 0.25 and 0.75. Same thing for mask load-save dialogs.
    
    Update the New mask dialog to make mask colours which suit the current hue
    distortion (RYB, RYGB, ...)

commit b3c0ecbba42b27d8db2871a18f35d3dd6e971301
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-31 01:55:35 +0000

    freehand cursors: add presets, add crosshair style
    
    Add prefs UI on the View tab for cursor presets, and set thin, medium, and
    thick styles of circle. For the circle styles, "light outline" is the
    default, a white circle inside a black one with some alpha.  It suffers
    from a hardware rendering bug on some systems, so add "medium" and "heavy"
    outline options with black borders to all sides at a couple of extra
    weights.  Good compromises, hopefully.
    
    Add a simple crosshair style for those who just want to know where the nib
    of their pen is. It uses icons to show the fancier brush blend modes.

commit f267bbaa2a5e1875d2dc29ff74b460b7520a1708
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-14 14:16:19 +0000

    brush popup: moving cursor out closes
    
    Close the brush popup dialog (with a reject code) when the user moves the
    pointer away from it. Use several pixels of slack around the edges to allow
    the dialog to be resized under certain WMs and DEs, and to allow for
    less-than-perfect moue coordination.
    
    Bugfix: closing the window no longer destroys the dialog.
    
    Minor stuff: add docs and comments.

commit e59dd067cfd5f5969f16c2764bd4ef4eebfb72f1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-13 19:31:57 +0000

    windowing: general support for chooser dialogs
    
    Base class for popup-like dialog windows designed for choosing one thing
    quickly, e.g. the quick brush chooser. Such windows appear directly under
    the mouse, remember their size in the application preferences, and should
    close when the user has made a selection.

commit 2ebd897757673bff0c2c9074ca70bd1f2f2c98ca
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-13 11:44:37 +0000

    desktop: add thumbnailer for Gnome 3 Nautilus
    
    We didn't previously ship a thumbnailer because that would have introduced
    a dependency on GConf. Since Gnome 3.0, Nautilus uses a far simpler system
    requiring only file installation, so it's OK to support that.
    
    Partly reverts 53feeda57b57686db4194ada421988039b5f8d5c, and removes the
    need for a tempfile.
    
    Tested with GNOME Nautilus 3.4.2 under Cinnamon 1.6.7.

commit 23fd56c860856f94d5635808222da94fea1f4e74
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-12 07:48:10 +0000

    multifile saving: skip thumbnailing and recent mgt
    
    Do not save thumbs for multi-file PNG saves: it would be incorrect to do
    so. Also don't store them in the recent-files manager in case saving a file
    with many layers swamps it.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20422
    
    Really, multiple-file PNG saving should be an export only option.

commit db248de85bccb57e60758ac16e4c0b5733cf1d3e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-11 14:57:33 +0000

    cursors: increase diameter by 1px
    
    Increase the cursor ring diameter by a single pixel. Judged by eye
    using the pixelblocking and 1pixel brushes, since those are nice and
    sharp. I think this brings the new cursors more into line with the old
    ones.

1	0	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit e6779880d202cb57d13a14c91fbee6a4555d003e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-11 14:32:21 +0000

    cursors: hotspot fix; reduce min size; even sizes
    
    All in the name of making the new cursors feel nice and precise.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20415
    
    Add back even sized cursors, to be more like the old bitmap+mask set.
    Not certain why this was off; perhaps to reduce the number of cases
    while discussing feel and precision (odd sizes are simpler).
    
    Change the default colours back to pure black and pure white.
    
    Experimentally reduce the minimum size to 3px for more precision (one
    white pixel surrounded by a ring of black). We should make this
    configurable via the prefs dialog IMO because it's *way* too small for
    proper usability. But some expert users seem to like flyspeck cursors :D
    
    Move the hotspot 1px up and left. This should be the bullseye of an
    odd-sized cursor, and is probably a bugfix for that.
    For an even-sized cursor, it's the North-West pixel of of the 4
    surrounding the exact centre.
    
    I think, if the feel is right for odd-sized cursors now, we could adjust
    the freehand painting position to the South-East by half a pixel for
    even sized cursors.

18	6	gui/cursor.py

commit 8e7e4cd9aaaff19d5622d5607724d5816ce334de
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-11 01:29:21 +0000

    gtk3: fix exception when picking strokes
    
    Fix a pointer-coordinate related exception when picking strokes with the
    "W" key. We're still using a deprecated method, but until we make tdw
    multi-device-aware, we can't do much about it, and the alternative
    get_window().get_pointer() is worse (mistagged, I think; incompatible
    return signature), and itself deprecated.

commit 2b2d496e2722bf958acd852f626e4f5295784826
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-11 01:01:08 +0000

    gtk3: fix exception with color details dialog
    
    Fix exception caused by code using a PyGTK field that's gone in GI+GTK3.
    
    (Technically GtkColorSelectionDialog is deprecated too, and we should be
    using the simpler GtkColorChooserDialog for new GTK3-only code. That's
    fine for trivial things like choosing a frame colour, but too limited
    for subtle painting colour choice. If it's dropped during the GTK3
    cycle, we can implement our own replacement.)

1	1	gui/colors/uicolor.py

commit 59309edaf62d1b13bafb87fd7fff8923faa0f6dc
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-11 00:21:48 +0000

    toolbar: ungrab keyboard too when hiding dropdowns
    
    Fixes a GTK3 situation where keypress events got ignored immediately
    after the toolbar's dropdown panels were hidden until the grab was
    broken by some other user action which established a grab, e.g. by
    moving the viewport with the pointer.
    
    Possible candidate oneliner for any 1.1.1 release: it's generally a good
    idea to ungrab what you grab regardless of the UI toolkit you're using.

commit 84ac7cb6b787ef1c1efd8b7182e4b301435ac36e

commit d8d80532fce9dceab26b901876131947eb7af5dd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-10 01:39:35 +0000

    gtk3: fix picker getting stuck in grab
    
    GI+GTK3 reports button numbers strangely when peeking at the last event
    on the stack (something horrid we need to do when responding to a
    non-keyboard-iniaiated Action, e.g. a mouse menu selection or a toolbar
    button press). Record a null button press initially, and let the first
    subsequent button-press record the number so that the release works.
    
    This code is getting somewhat hairy. Do we need the preview thing at
    all? It's cute, but I count two other colour previews on my screen most
    of the time. It's also somewhat slow for GTK3 mode, perhaps because the
    screen pixel reading code itself is slower? Definitely breaks the
    feeling of continuity in a hold-and-drag pick.
    
    For fullscreen mode, when it matters, could it be converted to an
    optional fading overlay that just triggers and then fades out whenever
    the colour changes? Perhaps near the pointer, perhaps in a corner.
    Something similar for brushes might be nice too.

17	5	gui/canvasevent.py

1	1	gui/mypaint.xml

commit 4b9eeb4dc603e99d0d7e349f8b6664e5dea3fa11
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-19 02:31:26 +0000

    Fit-view command: now a toggle
    
    Convert View→Fit into a GtkToggleAction. Toggling the action on fits the
    view to the document, as before; toggling the action off goes back to
    the previous view. Potentially useful for changing between a global
    overview of the document and local zoomed detail as part of a fullscreen
    workflow.
    
    If the user interactively adjusts the view in either state, the toggle
    and its saved view state are cleared.
    
    Rename the Action to be a little more illustrative of what it does.
    
    Split the API for this and resetting the view into programmatic methods
    and user action callbacks.

3	0	gui/canvasevent.py

    happen before the GUI exception handler is active, with the result
    that the program doesn't start any more. (Ideally, we would show
    a dialog at least, and give the user some hints how to remove the
    brush(es) in question.)

commit f37699e8b8d2df4a33a925f313f1f8c1329cac84
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-04 17:39:44 +0000

    README: sandbox location must be absolute
    
    The sandbox location must be absolute, otherwise you'll end up with
    multiple sandbox locations which will then need to be recombined, e.g. if
    --install-sandbox=SANDBOX is used, you'll end up with
    
        ./SANDBOX
        ./po/SANDBOX
        ./brushlib/SANDBOX
        ./brushlib/po/SANDBOX
    
    Update installation docs to explain this.
    
    Thanks to Ryan Schmidt for uncovering this: https://gna.org/bugs/?20399

8	6	README

commit 17322aebbbbcd9084305d2cad49d690c6ffbaddb
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-04 13:43:36 +0000

    brushlib: use the standard header for malloc()
    
    Portability: using the Linux-specific malloc.h was breaking OSX builds.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20398

commit df3afd837ebaa9794f9b0eaaa32bd7b0ae8efcf7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2013-01-04 04:28:33 +0000

    move-layer: fix a race condition with leave()
    
    Leaving due to a springloaded mode keyup was causing leave() to be
    called while idle callbacks were still processing the finalize code,
    leading to an exception. Fix by forcing everything to completion during
    leave() while the mode is still in a good state.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20397
    
    Also spotted and fixed a similar one with the move idler.

20	0	gui/canvasevent.py

    Plan is to move this iteration all the way into C/C++ and
    there do it in a multithreaded way, similar to how the brush
    engine rendering works.
    Also split out some rendering code to separate functions.

    is provided, making the usage very convenient. See TiledSurface::tile_request

    lib: Store backgrounds using TiledSurface
    
    First step towards storing all pixel data in the same way, to
    avoid code duplication, have a unified way of accessing such data
    and make it easier to switch out this storage (to a GEGL based Surface).
    The Background class is left as a tiny wrapper around TiledSurface.

commit ec7b1d7e98832e755143dd84716a35e709aa1779
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-31 00:34:18 +0000

    toolbar: rearrange, better defaults
    
    Move the line modes back to their dropdown, but alow them to be enabled
    on the toolbar as well, via the config menu.
    
    Hide most blend modes by default, with the exception of the eraser.
    
    Downside to the above two changes: there are now five toolbar icons
    which cannot be hidden. Hopfully it's sensible to have them there all
    the time.
    
    Use the blend mode icons in the dropdown rather than checkboxes. They're
    more visually interesting.
    
    Couple of fairly nasty naming hacks here, essentially reusing the
    _("Line Mode") string a couple more times in a naughty way. The UI
    translates fairly nicely in German still, although there's a minor
    pluralization inconsistency introduced in an obscure menu.
    
    Minor dropdown spacing stuff.

commit b9536086559f43100a4240e06d22c86ffc850643
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-08 20:43:44 +0000

    color picker popup: replace with mode+overlay
    
    Replace the old color picker popup window and stategroup stuff with an
    InteractionMode and an overlay. Throwing top-level windows around was
    the cause of several weird grab issues when dealing with multiple input
    devices and input drivers. Maybe it's best to just draw stuff like this
    onto the existing canvas and use the same grab/drag management as other
    modes. Possibly related:
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20384
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20358
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19710
    
    Adds round corners for the preview rectangle, addressing a cosmetic
    concern raised in
    
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-development-and-suggestions/annoying-colour-picker-behavior/
    
    Making it a mode allows it to be added easily as a toolbar button, so
    do that as well.
    
    Functionally, this is a like-for-like replacement, although the preview
    no longer follows the pointer outside the main drawing area. It's still
    possible to pick colours there, however. Thus there are no string
    changes: this code reuses the old menu label and context.
    
    Testers of 1.1.0rc1 may need to rebind their Pick Color action: the
    machine-readable action name has changed.
    
    Internally, adds keyup timeouts for modes launched from a keyboard-
    friendly "flip" action. The popup window doesn't use it, however.

2	2	gui/application.py
41	6	gui/canvasevent.py

4	7	gui/drawwindow.py
2	1	gui/menu.xml

1	0	gui/toolbar-editmodes.xml

commit ba58bb27c4d29d999ce64627eda002eff0da7709
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-20 18:42:38 +0000

    drawwindow: re-fix Escape fullscreen regression
    
    It's probably better to handle the fullscreen-exiting part of pressing
    Escape by queueing an unfullscreen() before the active mode handles the
    keypress. Since 5cbfc867 active modes handle the keypresses fully by
    default to prevent space-activated widgets from activating if they have
    focus; however this broke 5d100ff's fix because the connect_after()
    callbacks didn't then run.

7	20	gui/drawwindow.py

commit 27dfbd4da8973e3c5d447fc7faaf4f2645aad489
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-17 19:40:28 +0000

    tiledsurface: return dirtied bbox in end_atomic()
    
    Return the dirtied bbox of an atomic tile access section to Python code
    as a 4-element tuple. Handy for debugging, but unused right now. It
    gives us an alternative method for performing screen updates later if we
    want to rewrite that, and more closely refects the brushlib API.

commit 5677218c32f7fecfcbaa566bc8c686c7262c7749
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-12-15 06:41:59 +0100

    fix scons problems with old files lying around
    
    This fixes a bug where strokes were not updated on canvas until the
    canvas was moved - of course, only if you had old .so files lying
    around. Users had to solve this with "git clean -xf" before.
    
    (Ideally, old .so files shouldn't be used even if they are there.)
    
    Clean up more old cruft when running "scons -c".
    
    Problem was reported here for example:
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-development-and-suggestions/new-cursor-from-git/msg11871/#msg11871
    I could reproduce that by building many old versions, and then master.

commit e80f3c1b60a17ca7fb683d7e6dae46cc916a45db
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-14 00:13:06 +0000

    cursors: less obtrusive defaults; now configurable
    
    Following forum discussions, make the cursors far less obtrusive by
    default, but configurable in most aspects. Currently the only
    configuration is by hidden options in settings.json:
    
    cursor.freehand.min_size - integer minimum circle size
    cursor.freehand.outer_line_width - floating-point line width
    cursor.freehand.inner_line_width - floating-point line width
    cursor.freehand.inner_line_inset - integer inset, circle outmost edge to inmost
    cursor.freehand.outer_line_color - RGBA tuple of floats
    cursor.freehand.inner_line_color - RGBA tuple of floats

81	75	gui/cursor.py

commit dee4e9bf7e3fd322b5e52fef3f47750558d6f3cf
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-13 17:30:59 +0000

    cursors: make a bit thinner; bugfix
    
    Following user feedback (the first of lots, I'm sure! - please tell us
    if you have an opinion on this), make the cursor thinner and don't vary
    it in line width by size. Smaller alpha shadow too, although that
    shouldn't be too obtrusive.
    
    Related bugfix: decide what counts as a "big" screen based on monitor
    rather than screen dimensions: this will be better for multihead. "Big"
    now means 1920px or greater.

14	21	gui/cursor.py

commit 9882f28fb585f0b7152a750b24e4bb5b645c119f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-08 04:11:13 +0000

    cursors: freehand brush cursor updates
    
    Introduce a new cursor style for the Colorize brush blend mode.
    
    Use Cairo-drawn RGBA cursors in PyGTK/gtk2. Most displays will be
    capable of this now, and even gtk2 will use a fallback if it can't.
    Removes the need to maintain gtk3 code as a separate code path (mostly)
    
    Slightly fatter and bolder than before, but hopefully in keeping with
    both the old ones and the newer DMZ cursors used elsewhere. Hopefully
    this will keep Windows users who can't see small cursors happy. We can
    tweak the minimum size or the line widths if people still complain they
    can't make out the cursors, or make a "chunky cursors" prefs option if
    needed.

146	84	gui/cursor.py

    brush from the quick brush chooser popup. Doing the accept on pointer-up
    avoids this. Seems not to happen with the mouse, at least with Xfce 4.8.

commit 38347df61ba82cff6366c2c0fe3e6d00bbdda7b0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-10 19:52:23 +0000

    color picker: grab fix: destroy window after use
    
    It seems the spurious and stylus-specific grab that was hanging around
    after colour picking is cured by destroying the popup window after the
    pick is done.
    
    Refactor color picker to create its window for the duration of the pick,
    destroying it afterwards. Reenable its normal call in the canvasevent
    dispatcher.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20358
    
    There are still some cases when stylus-specific grabs persist after the
    picker is done, but the situation is now much more managable for users
    aassuming they don't want to pick outside the drawWindow or in the
    palette window or something. I suspect these are now in the domain of
    actual GTK (or WM) bugs, and hopefully fixable when we migrate to GTK3.

commit d1b6518ace20ff8832685461ef5f2ff6884f55a5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-09 17:34:20 +0000

    canvasevent: workaround color picker grab release
    
    Dispatch ColorPopupWindow as if it was launched from the menu if it was
    actually invoked by [<Modifierss>+]ButtonN. This means you don't get
    the popup window when picking unless you use the keyboard and hold the
    key, but it avoids a fairly horrid _device specific_ grab release
    problem that can't be addressed directly with PyGTK.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20358
    
    Binding to a pointer button is still possible, but because we no longer
    grab you can't drag around to adjust the colour finely, and nor do you
    get a preview. You just have to keep clicking.
    
    Of note; at least one user has expressed aesthetic concerns about the
    picker's appearance, and that they'd prefer not to see the picker at all
    if it's distracting.
    
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-development-and-suggestions/annoying-colour-picker-behavior/
    
    This workaround isn't intended to address that concern (sorry!) it's
    just intended to create a system that doesn't lock users out of menus
    and tool windows. Hopefully this will just be a temporary measure.

13	1	gui/canvasevent.py

commit f04c6128359f7a2e61885a209a39a426b0242b0d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-09 16:57:26 +0000

    colorpicker: better integrate with canvasevent
    
    Some code love for the color picker:
    
    * Remove hardcoded modifier keys stuff now it can be launched with any
      combination. It still does a "modifiers still held" test, so record
      which modifiers were held when the window appears.
    
    * Both styles of grab fix different bugs, so do both. Other code adopts
      this strategy too.
    
    * Split up the code flow into different event handlers a bit. Slight
      voodoo here, but ensuring the window is shown fully before grabbing
      ay be more correct.
    
    Partly ameliorates https://gna.org/bugs/?20358 by fixing the "first
    launch does not update" problem with the stylus. The rogue grab for
    second and subsequent stylus launches of the picker, which as far as I
    can tell is device specific, is *not* fixed, but can at least now be
    undone by drawing a stroke on the canvas.

60	29	gui/colorpicker.py

commit 3caecbe9a3a80a68eea7700463c87fbd87874ac5
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-12-08 17:34:10 +0100

    brushlib: Fix resizing of operation queue causing line gaps
    
    The previous code for copying the values in a tile map to a bigger
    map during resize did not take into account that a tile
    would be stored in a different position in the bigger map.
    Thus when processing after a op queue resize, the dirty tile list
    would point to wrong, empty queues. This caused gaps in drawn lines
    the first time they exceeded the op queue size.
    
    Sorry for big commit. Also makes all functions that have
    to do with the tile map operate on a TileMap instead of OperationQueue.

70	63	brushlib/operationqueue.c

commit dc7b5ee8935e453a3aab318a27ed58281e392a35

Date:   2012-12-08 17:43:26 +0100

    brushlib: Split out more code in operation queue that manipulates tile map
    
    Also marks the know issues the code has. Will be fixed shortly.

57	29	brushlib/operationqueue.c

commit a7c1d803e9d4099a78b6ff4ecdd498ffff5c8fa0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-08 15:04:47 +0000

    brush list: revert double-click action
    
    After testing it properly with a stylus: it didn't quite have the "feel"
    I wanted. Felt right with the mouse, but with the stylus I found I was
    doing accidental drags after double-clicks, and accidental double-clicks
    during selection. Perhaps tablets "bounce" too much to make double-click
    activation a good idea when other stuff is going on.
    
    I think it should be possible to edit properties from the brush list,
    but this doesn't look like the right way to do it.

commit d6b60511aaece4eafca524d483ae8ef70bb1cff9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-06 02:36:59 +0000

    color picker popup: use a pointer grab again
    
    Fixes (on my system, tested in Xfce4 and Unity) two problems with the
    color picker popup window:
    
    - Picker popup doesn't disappear when using a modifier+pointer button to
      activate it
    
    - Picker popup doesn't update continuously when the R key (or any other) is
      used to activate it.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19710
    
    Back and forth on using a pointer grab vs. a gtk grab, but this now
    seems the better approach. Fingers crossed.

commit daa8c5b33206d0a3e42c3143161c14d351a9c56f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-12-06 01:33:45 +0000

    brushlib: improve tilt ascension stepping
    
    Perform tilt ascension interpolation steps in the direction of the
    smallest angular difference between input event tilts. This removes some
    ugly 360 degree twirls when passing from -180 to 180 or vv. This angle
    can be hit much more easily with the recent canvas rotation compensation
    code, so best we fix it.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19988
    
    Tested with faked tilt inputs only. Testing needed.

24	2	brushlib/mypaint-brush.c

commit efc6af233d5860b9f6cc683eda6424642b5d94e1

    String reported: "eGalax Inc. USB TouchController"
