commit 57bcd033bc0db08bb54d894ae673f8c0d32a5c51
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-30 13:01:21 +0000

    drag modes: exit the mode if grabs fail
    
    Another attempt at fixing https://gna.org/bugs/?20068
    
    Falling back to the mode's passive state is proving confusing and
    potentially annoying. These conditions should be rare enough for popping
    the mode stack to be a valid approach if grabs fail.
    
    Code tidyups: less silly names for the start/stop methods. Ungrabbing
    won't work because the conflicting grabs are evidently external to the
    app, so remove that attempted workaround. Exclude double and triple
    clicks from starting grabs (shouldn't be an issue, but we'll see).  The
    keypress handler is now are now fully responsible for starting its drag,
    so never start one in a motion handler and clean up test. Eat all motion
    events in a grab.

33	26	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 775dec1844b0f26e7c50ad73ee9372628aa04cb4
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-30 01:56:04 +0000

    layer win: nicer toggling of visible & lock
    
    Don't immediately scroll the layers list to the currently highlighted
    row if the user just scrolled it to a far-away layer to toggle the
    visibility or locked flags on that layer. This allows users to toggle
    off a set of far-away layers more conveniently.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20330
    
    However the current layer should remain visible much of the time so
    users don't get lost. Experimentally, automatically scroll the list back
    to the highlighted layer after each stroke on the canvas, and also after
    changing the current layer's opacity or mode inside the dialog. The idea
    here is that if you change a layer, you get to see which layer just
    changed in the layers list.

39	13	gui/layerswindow.py

commit 5cbfc8679c2dcd0fd209ed6bbfdffba376d4d5f6
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-30 00:46:14 +0000

    keyboard events: do not propagate
    
    Fix regression: keyboard events no longer propagate by default. This was
    causing some widgets to activate confusingly, giving the appearance of
    hangs and nonresponsiveness to spacebar drags.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20326
    
    Derived class handler code is still responsible for declaring when an
    event has been logically consumed, but the base class's fallthrough code
    has been modified so that the default is to not propagate the event when
    falling through to try other mixed-in behaviours.

22	13	gui/canvasevent.py

commit d5335873bfc3a7bdfbf510d1d78b46107a9d008e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-29 13:55:19 +0000

    dragmode: various grab fixes
    
    Various grab fixes to address a couple of difficult to reproduce bugs
    that result in sticky modes:
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20333
    
    Working hypothesis is that this is something else in the user's desktop
    session breaking the grab. Detect when that happens, and pop the mode
    stack to avoid any question of never receiving the spacebar key-up.
    Exiting the drag is probably better for users than leaving them stuck in
    it with no option other than batting keys. Add some detailed debugging
    printout when drag grabs are broken by something.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20068
    
    Working hypothesis is that this a race condition against some other grab
    of the same app, probably an implict grab belonging to a colour
    selector. Attempt to fix it by rather assertively ungrabbing before
    trying the newly active dragmode's grabs. Also, be insistent that a
    complete grab has happened before really starting the drag. Failing safe
    is better than failing sticky and forcing users to escape out.
    
    Minor fixes: work around a "self.doc is None" exception under unclear
    circumstances, and ignore random accidental button presses - presumably
    other buttons - while in a drag.

67	9	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 34cca9ae2c47b2eecb45c2df75af07ecddb56f16
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-27 13:08:02 +0000

    flips: ignore mods; layer move: exit if no mods
    
    Mode flip actions are intended to be bound to keypress shortcuts, where
    modifiers are arbitrary and shouldn't imply mode-hold or behavioural
    changes. Therefore, instruct modes constructed in flip activations to
    ignore the initial set of modifier keys.
    
    Make LayerMoveMode exit after dragging if no modifiers were held when it
    was entered, or if launched in response to a mode flip action. This
    makes it nicer to bind to unmodified pointer buttons.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20307
    
    This leaves open the question of whether drag-like mode buttons on the
    toolbar should persist or exit after their drag, with specific reference
    to the expectations of tablet PC users: I'm undecided, but at least we
    can now address it as a separate issue.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?16869

29	1	gui/canvasevent.py
38	6	gui/document.py

    https://gna.org/bugs/?20295

    flatten the whole image if you switch to an application that doesn't
    support a particular layer mode.

commit e00ba7af73e1553631297f39bf4b80d17193fbae
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-02-06 12:53:45 +0100

    pixops: flat2rgba/rgba2flat infrastructure
    
    The idea is that a layer's rgba tile can be converted to flat and
    back. While in flat mode, we can manipulate the colors that are
    actually visible on-screen after compositing. When converting back
    to rgba, the alpha is increased where required to achieve the
    wanted on-screen effect (in normal blending mode).
    
    Terminology for the 15bit pixel formats:
    rgba = red*, green*, blue*, alpha (*premultiplied with alpha)
    rgbu = red, green, blue, unused
    flat = red, green, blue, minimum_alpha (used by flat2rgba)

104	0	lib/pixops.hpp

commit 517aea89592f886387e9d08f6bba7e8c79d5531c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-25 00:02:49 +0000

    brush menu: strings review, translation contexts
    
    String review for the brush menu. Add translation context to all items.
    
    Language and terminology: attempting to be more consistent with other
    similar concepts e.g. the "Opacity" of a layer. Try to balance with
    shortening text to be more quickly readable in context.
    
    * Strokes are now objects we can refer to.
      Outside a context in which we're not already talking about brushes,
      call them "Brushstrokes"; within, "Strokes" will suffice. If we need
      to refer to the strokemap in the future, perhaps use the terms
      "[brush]stroke information" or "[brush]stroke data"?
    
    * Brushkeys are now called "Shortcut Keys".
      Rationale: split into separate words, don't repeat "Brush".
    
    * The user's brush collection in the app, and 3rd party brush packs can
      both be referred to as "Brushes", plural. The distinction should become
      apparent in use.
    
    Menu ordering: Saved brushes, then brush settings, then brush pack
    commands.

25	15	gui/brushselectionwindow.py
3	3	gui/drawwindow.py
21	17	gui/menu.xml
27	15	gui/mypaint.xml

commit 623f148904bb23b155e8834b8789babc34404c5b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-23 18:22:42 +0000

    UI: connect mode flips, fix translation contexts
    
    Add menu items for mode radio flipping actions, and file them in the
    correct menu for the thing being controlled by the mode. Move the radio
    actions into a submenu; it's unlikely that anybody'll use them directly,
    but they illustrate the concept, and give people who don't like the
    flip-style actions an alternative action to bind a keypress to.
    
    Translation contexts: add several, and correct the earlier approach
    which used prose. Now use menu paths as described in
    https://www.gnu.org/software/gettext/manual/html_node/Contexts.html
    
    Translators: ensure you're using intltool-extract 0.41.1+: this should
    be able to deal with contexts in UI XML despite what the GTK docs say :)
    See https://gna.org/bugs/?20293
    
    Shorten and neaten lots of menu items (using translation contexts to
    disambiguate), and demote some extreme detail actions that are only
    really there so users can bind them to a keypress into submenus near
    their related entries.
    
    Still some work to do here before the string freeze I haven't had the
    time to review every menu item (Brush, Color and Scratchpad, primarily)
    
    Add sensible (to me) key bindings for the drawing modes:
    
        P = Freehand ([P]encil/[P]ainting)
        K = Lines and Kurves
        J = Connected ([J]oined) Lines
        O = Ellipses and Circles (letter shape, near freehand)
    
    all of which bind to the mode flip action.
    
    I guess we should start calling them tools now?

commit 6230dd133a029b3d5b443b840407bbbb06b0b9bd
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-23 18:10:31 +0000

    mode stack: support contextual pushing, mode flips
    
    Add support for pushing modes onto the stack contextually, based on each
    new mode's opinion of the modes it can usefully work on top of. Modes
    now broadly fall into three categories:
    
     1. modes for drawing (freehand, straight/curve, sequence, ellipse)
     2. modes for editing other stuff (frame, symmetry one day...)
     3. modes for manipulating  the view
    
    where higher numbers can stack onto lower ones sensibly, and pop back to
    them.
    
    Also add support for radio flipping actions: sort of like toggle actions
    but with the state stored in like-named radioactions. This will allow a
    single key to be used for both push and pop, which is useful in the
    above framework.

53	4	gui/canvasevent.py
14	6	gui/document.py
7	0	gui/framewindow.py
5	0	gui/linemode.py

    when bound to an action, right now).

commit e73b4df3e360a69ee95b0e02d77e73b0a7f854fe
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-22 03:10:11 +0000

    idletask: fix finish_all() data loss; add docs
    
    Bugfix: finish_downto(0) didn't always empty the queue, which could
    cause data loss for callers of finish_all().
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20309
    
    Possibly this is caused by rounding, either inadvertantly to int or just
    general floating-point weirdness.  Anyway, guard against it with type
    forcing and assertions, and more importantly make finish_all() always do
    what it it promises.
    
    Document module.

commit 7991ae56c5e73043068af38710b0546ccfb8fd8b
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-16 12:51:37 +0200

    Make tile store interface in MyPaintTiledSurface concurrency friendly
    
    Store a request state object in the consumer that wants to get/set tiles,
    and allow tile stores to attach information to this object at the
    start of a request, and use this to finalize the request on a subsequent
    call.
    The C++ interfaces used in MyPaint is not changed. Instead the wrapper
    classes serializes requests so that one happens at a time.

commit c1521edbc0fd9c60ff9d374dad3b570b02970e24
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-23 23:36:29 +0200

    brushlib: Prepare for queued processing of operations
    
    Introduce the OperationQueue class, which will hold operations
    to be processed. Right now the API is in place, but only holds one
    operation per tile. This is sufficient as long as we do immediate
    processing (the op is pushed and popped within a single draw_dab call).

    needs addressing somewhere else, e.g. by enabling the Undo GtkAction

    implementation parly in Python. Have to embedd a Python interpreter
    in the executable, and get the C surface interface from the Python instance
    using SWIG.

commit 754cba54e69100b404eb4213296b11b96be0e9fb
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-17 18:34:21 +0000

    modes: make more of them switchable
    
    Factor out switchability, allowing more modes to push temporary
    sub-modes (and perform arbitrary actions) in response to configured user
    input. In other words, panning, rotating and zooming with button 2 is
    now supported when adjusting the frame. That plus any non-mode action is
    now possible from line-geometry modes.

commit 3953268d11bc0c162c09e102130bd51c9f966db6
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-15 19:11:39 +0000

    canvasevent: improve flow for spring-loaded modes
    
    Make spring-loaded modes actually persist for as long as modifiers are
    held. Not bouncing between modes will be better for UI feedback.
    
    One little benefit: (any modifiers)+(toolbar button click) now engages a
    "secret" versions of some modes which lasts only for as long as the
    modifiers are held. For frame manipulation this means the dialogless
    version of the mode. Really the "secret" version is just what you get
    when you bind it to a (modified) button press via preferences.
    
    Fix: releasing modifiers while dragging in oneshot+spring-loaded modes
    should not exit the mode. That now happens correctly when the drag
    finishes.

97	47	gui/canvasevent.py
23	18	gui/framewindow.py
15	24	gui/linemode.py

commit 2254739b37ac5adc1f841e80f7d91a428d14f0ad
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-24 13:04:57 +0100

    Improve button mapping, spring-loaded modes
    
    New look for the button mapping preferences tab, allowing more actions
    to be tied to pointer buttons and combinations of modifier keys. Added
    support for more than 3 buttons, allowing Wacom pad buttons to be
    assigned to MyPaint functions. Actions can now have more than one button
    combination pointed at them.
    
    Removed all the hardcoded button mappings. Everything is now managed in
    user preferences. Space is now a fake Button2, and responds to the same
    bindings.
    
    Updated button mapping defaults: Ctrl equivalents for all Alt+button
    combos. Popup menu is now on Button3 where it belongs - my personal
    preference because I don't use colour history, but it can be set back to
    the old color history behaviour in preferences.
    
    Some interaction modes are now spring-loaded, which means that if
    they're started with button-modifier combinations, they cancel when the
    modifiers and button are released.
    
    Mode classes now use cooperative supercalls, to allow common code to be
    shared via mixins. More modes are now zoomable and rotatable with the
    mouse wheel, but support's still lacking for mode-switching via the
    button map and also modifier+drag translations, rotations and zooms in
    some of the fancier modes.

32	21	gui/application.py
465	0	gui/buttonmap.py
429	263	gui/canvasevent.py
31	31	gui/framewindow.py
15	6	gui/linemode.py
30	86	gui/preferenceswindow.py

commit 726fd8a0b25cd970b66bcf2eaabc9be57f5fa878
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-14 13:21:55 +0000

    mypaint.xml: make compat with intltool-extract
    
    Amend GtkBuilder XML to keep intltool-extract 0.41.1 happy. This version
    requires translatable="yes", not the translatable="1" which GtkBuilder
    itself is happy with. This allows strings to be extracted with
    
      intltool-extract --type=gettext/glade gui/mypaint.xml
    
    and do more than just generate blank .h files.

195	195	gui/mypaint.xml

    down to GTK instead. Seems right, but I hope it doesn't break
    something else.

2	4	gui/drawwindow.py

commit aed08632feecbabee7b3ee8f8f73ddf2cf341f27
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-09 01:57:29 +0000

    SetLayerOpacity: don't recalc bbox needlessly
    
    Minor UI jerkiness removal for a special case. If SetLayerOpacity makes
    no changes to the effective opacity - which should only happen for
    invisible layers - the command now no longer recalculate the bbox of the
    layer once or twice for each move of the opacity slider. This can add up
    to an appreciable but small delay for layers with a lot of tiles, and
    jerkiness in what could be a smooth slider.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20287
    
    The problem really lies with tiledsurface.get_tiles_bbox() and
    MyPaintSurface.get_bbox() iterating over index-tuple-keyed hashes merely
    to obtain four numbers - would it help matters elsewhere to maintain a
    cache of extents?

6	2	lib/command.py

commit bd87d61c4a07143ac69e3f78f4c8cf4edb9ba12a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-09 00:54:37 +0000

    layerswindow: reorder controls, better spacing
    
    Now we have more blend modes, the mode GtkComboBox's menu can be cut off
    short and awkwardly if the layers dialog is near the bottom of the
    screen. Therefore move the controls which show details of the current
    layer to the top, and the controls which affect the layers stack to the
    bottom. The result is closer to the way the GIMP does it, and gives more
    footroom for the combobox's menu. Headroom might now be a problem, but
    layers aren't created using a mode that's further down the list: Normal
    is at the top.
    
    Space out controls in the Layers subwindow a tiny amount for some
    breathing room. If this seems right, we should use it in other dockable
    subwindows for consistency.

28	9	gui/layerswindow.py
2	1	gui/widgets.py

commit bb77d164fcc5589f1d448bfba2f98f96385f7ea3
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-07 20:48:11 +0000

    blend modes: add missing ones, redo as templates
    
    Implement all the missing layer blend modes from the recently published
    
      http://www.w3.org/TR/compositing/
    
    Specifically this adds Darken, Lighten, Difference, Exclusion, Hue, and
    Saturation layer blend modes.
    
    Added human-readable explanatory tooltips to the blend mode dropdown in
    the Layers subwindow.
    
    Fairly deep internal changes to the way layer compositing works: we now
    use templates which inline blend mode functors working with *non*-
    premultiplied components in place of the messy arrangement of macros and
    functions operating on premultiplied components. This should make it
    easier to implement pluggable compositing methods other than src-over at
    a later date, if that's what we decide OpenRaster needs.
    
    There's one template specialization already for the most common editing
    case, Normal + Src-Over. We can add more as needed for other blend modes
    which can be reduced down sanely to faster forms, using premultiplied
    operation or something else.
    
    Time: < ±1% - though that's really only the tweaked Normal + Src-Over.
    We should add more blendmode-specific tests to tests/test_performance.py
    
    We also now insist on contiguous data within tiles, but this should
    already have been the case for all layers.

commit 5df4df22cd452e5ab154c40c6e10542f5958fd63
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-03 22:23:10 +0000

    backgrounds: handle loading exceptions better
    
    If libgdkpixbuf cannot load a background image for any reason, it raises
    an exception. Rewrite the background error handling to more tolerant of
    this, and use longer aggregated error messages. With broken Gdk-Pixbuf
    installations, there might be a lot of background loading exceptions.
    
    https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/mypaint/+bug/1070298

commit a22e286b279eb884493a27b577dc1bcf5eba9064
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-11-02 21:30:10 +0000

    color history: fix most-recent adjuster
    
    Fix display of the most recently painted colour in the Colors subwindow
    by listening for both automatic stroke splits (so that opaque splatter
    brushes update the history like they should) and for when the user lifts
    the pen (so the dialog and history is updated immediately even though
    the last stroke isn't split yet).
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20279
    
    Some secondary fixes and tweaks:
    
    Test and fix out-of-box defaults and restored cases; document new order
    for history.
    
    Fix: default colour now isn't just RGBColor.new_from_hex_str()'s boring
    mid-grey (oops). It's now the last item in the history.
    
    New default history colours; might as well since that needed its order
    reversing.

commit f7b9ba53edf37a5a793c937a501076936fa60282
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-10-31 21:40:04 +0100

    build: enable more assertions
    
    We seem to be building a 2nd environment now which didn't remove
    the -DNDEBUG that python-config adds. Remove that flag there, too.
    
    This fixes a warning, and assertions are pointless if nobody enables
    them. We have HEAVY_DEBUG for performance-critical stuff.

5	1	lib/SConscript

commit 3d1f3be947c8cb8424c36d5d3a8029bd88b062f0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-10-31 19:08:58 +0000

    layer modes: add soft light blend mode
    
    Add the svg:soft-light operator, specified as being the W3C SVG one(s)
    by the OpenRaster specification.
    
        http://www.w3.org/TR/SVGCompositing/#comp-op-soft-light
        https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/FXTF/rawfile/tip/compositing/index.html#blendingsoftlight
    
    The current SVGCompositing reference has an incorrect derivation for
    working in premultiplied alpha, so let's not implement that for now. The
    nonpremult math is correct and matches the current FXTF one.

    layer modes: factor out some fix15 arithmetic
    
    This sort of code is much easier to understand and write without
    bitshifts peppering everything. Use inlineable static functions and try
    to standardise types and operator names initially; we can get clever
    with macros and/or templates later if we need it.

    tablet detection: switch to whitelist

    produces strange bugs (e.g. https://gna.org/bugs/?19664).

commit 3d5836be194ec6bd9b1158515411e44729e6af80
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-09-20 21:36:32 +0200

    brushlib: fix smudge starting transparent
    
    Fix a problem where a smudging stroke would suddenly start
    with transparency, even in the center of a solid layer.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?20034
    
    Fixed by reordering of code: update the smudge color before using
    it, instead of after. I'm not sure why it wasn't ordered like that
    before, I see no advantage to the old order.
    
    After calling reset() on a brush, the smudge color is set to
    zero (transparent). Use the LAST_GETCOLOR_RECENTNESS state (which
    is also reset to zero) to detect the initial get_color().
    
    Reordering changes the behaviour of all smudge and watercolor brushes
    very slightly, in theory. In practice I was unable to notice any
    difference at all.
    
    MyPaint still has a tendency to round down the alpha channel and
    thus introduce slight transparency when smudging the same spot really
    often, but it is a different problem.

35	43	brushlib/mypaint-brush.c

commit 353c09f6177696848047fc138dc55444f37bb08b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-09-20 20:15:28 +0200

    gtk2 pressure detection stuff
    
    clean up debug prints a bit, add another device exception

44	22	gui/application.py

commit 8b4fdf24af32cb0c94dcdbe92878f2db516951b8
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-09-20 18:15:40 +0200

    docstring update
    
    I respectfully disagree with what was written here :-)
    
    For MyPaint "stroke" and "mouse button" are two entirely unrelated
    concepts; we have a somewhat confusing mix of those terms here.
    
    It seems that recent xorg/wacom setups don't send a stylus "button
    up" event until pressure is zero, so maybe the result is the same
    for most setups (e.g. default click force).
    
    But the real stroke certainly starts before callbacks in
    input_stroke_started_observers are called, and it is possible
    to make very faint strokes that trigger neither callback.

10	7	gui/document.py

commit 5a4f6b0aff84b7d1532a4d0dc5221e87d8957d55

Date:   2012-09-16 11:55:32 +0200

    allow to choose if brushkeys remember color
    
    It seems to be a tradition to change this behaviour every now and
    then. Time for a preference (not in the preferences window, just
    a toggle item in the menu). Also, update the current code to the
    new brushmodifier behaviour.
    
    Should we remember the color together with the brush?
    Yes: http://gna.org/bugs/?15381
    No:  http://gna.org/bugs/?16977
    Yes: http://gna.org/bugs/?19548
    Let's put an end to this insanity :-)

    around 3x on a Core 2 Duo 2,2Ghz laptop. So we enable it by default.

commit 5a877ee05fbcf5fde6c86dc25b1b45ff71617f66
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-09-14 12:31:07 +0200

    brushlib: Move begin_atomic / end_atomic vfuncs to MyPaintSurface
    
    The transaction concept is generally useful and should be present
    on the public interface of surfaces. This will suggest consumers
    to make use of it, which allows surfaces to implement deferred
    rendering/processing.
    Implementing these vfuncs is optional for a surface.

Date:   2012-09-09 22:04:46 +0100

    command stack: permit updating the last command
    
    Allow the last command on the undo stack to be updated, to avoid having
    to use undo() then do() in circumstances where only the final state of a
    user's choice is deemed to matter in their workflow.
    
    Fixes https://gna.org/bugs/?20096

commit 32cb453d1b68d0648fa3dc0838084907a71b93b6
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-27 19:29:32 +0100

    fastpng: ignore non-RGB embedded ICC profiles
    
    Gimp 2.8 happily embeds greyscale color profiles into PNG data with RGB
    samples. This seems like a GIMP bug. Neverthless, it's revealed one of
    ours: we need to be able to cope with non-RGB color profiles. Just
    dropping them on the floor (similar to Gimp 2.6) should suffice while
    we're using libpng to perform the limited number of transformations we
    support.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?20064

14	1	lib/fastpng.hpp

commit 39bbd8e064d0fb1b72f10f42bed70ea81b274f5f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-27 17:48:48 +0100

    Drag modes: ignore failed attempts to grab pointer
    
    Workaround for https://gna.org/bugs/?20068 - a GTK2 issue where some
    other widget fails to release its pointer grab (an implicit grab?)
    before the drag mode's grab is established.
    
    Hopefully this won't screw too much up. For the more common of our drag
    modes, the grabs are only there to make handling across multiple docs
    and tdws, e.g. the scratchpad's setup, saner: they're not essential in
    the single window case.

9	1	gui/canvasevent.py

Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-26 22:57:13 +0100

    keyboard: fix an exception when pressing Escape
    
    Not every window added to the keyboard manager will have a self.app.
    It's fine for the KeyboardManager to retain its own reference to the
    singleton application instance.

commit 8c8fa10d0ebde1530480fe8314ed1580b22594b7
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-08-19 16:32:59 +0200

    optimize brush selection
    
    Simple optimizations in brush.py:
    - don't report no-changes to observers
    - get rid of 2300 calls to dict.deepcopy()
    
    This reduces CPU time for brush selection by 50% and makes
    the "pick context" feature more responsive again.
    
    We still are doing all the work 3 times for our 3 different
    documents (gui, scratchpad, brushcreation widget).

commit 0bceafc0bcb0be308b02201d6da15e298e41c2d0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-16 02:17:09 +0100

    frame: make editing the frame a mode
    
    Frame editing is now hopefully a little more intuitive: added a toolbar
    button and a corresponding bindable action for editing the frame. Dialog
    and mode are now combined.
    
    Users can now drag the frame edges while the tool/mode is active. The
    cursor reflects what will happen on canvas while the mode is active.
    
    The dialog crop buttons now unconditionally enable the frame: users will
    always want to see the result of these actions immediately.
    
    Added a horrible icon for frame editing mode. Really we need a better
    one (a fancy ormolu picture frame, maybe?)
    
    Minor dialog layout stuff.
    
    FrameToggle is now a real ToggleAction.
    
    lib/document.py: strip out frame moving and delta accumulation: it's now
    managed by the top mode.
    
    Gtk3: fixed pointer_ungrab() breakage.

commit 41bf4e4c347f56b64b4dec5b33ff0d0cb463aae9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-10 22:03:29 +0100

    Add interaction modes for lines, view manipulation
    
    Refactor LineMode to support the new modes interface.
    
    Line modes are now accessible a) from the kitchen sink default freehand
    mode with modifiers+drag, b) from the Edit menu and c) from the toolbar.
    Other locations are possible too, of course.
    
    I prefer all the sticky modes to be visible together on the toolbar
    while they're the only reflection of what mode the app is in, but we're
    admittedly getting a bit cluttered up there now. It's probably time for
    some judicious culling and replacement.
    
    New icons for rotating and zooming the view in "cursor and view" style,
    and a generic Tango-style one for moving stuff.

commit 9af8805b416e2cbe5610dcc98dffb45428fd77b2

commit b171a0f2ee5417d49eb0d99e3144ed0124e32ea9
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-08-08 14:49:04 +0200

    optimize new random generator
    
    Don't call rng_double_set_seed() any more while painting.
    Reduce RNG quality settings.
    
    For the brush "classic/coarse_bulk_1" this reduces the RNG related
    functions from taking 9.5% CPU down to 0.5% (of all brushlib activity).
    
    This breaks a feature where brushlib can re-render a previous stroke
    exactly by restoring the initial state. (And removes the reason for
    not using the system's RNG in the first place... uhm...)
    
    Appart from the slightly nicer "live stroke preview" on the canvas
    when editing the brush settings, this feature was unused for quite
    some time now. It was used for undo/redo in early days. Actually it
    was already broken before this commit (since the new RNG, I assume)
    for some reason that I was unable to figure out.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19879

6	2	brushlib/mypaint-brush.c
12	1	brushlib/rng-double.c

commit 4f0b12420818befe7a3d9e509bf692978a66d9b7
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-08-08 12:26:54 +0200

    fix rand_gauss() offset
    
    The previous random_gauss() had a very prominent bias since
    the introduction of the new integer RNG. Fixed by converting
    the algorithm to float and removing the integer RNG completely.
    rand_gauss() was the only consumer of integer random numbers.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19879

7	13	brushlib/helpers.c
2	2	brushlib/helpers.h
12	18	brushlib/mypaint-brush.c
0	126	brushlib/rng-int.c
0	19	brushlib/rng-int.h
0	27	brushlib/tests/test-rng.c

commit cf84c7a0c3c831350f52187c2143991ca361dca0

    canvasevent: fix exception with bad devices

2	0	gui/canvasevent.py

commit 366e1007755c8e572cd74c11b92876f5efc55805
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-08-01 02:12:23 +0100

    keyboard and pointer input: big refactor
    
    Move even more stuff out of the TDW, moving the input processing stuff
    to a stack of interaction mode objects owned by each gui Document, only
    the top mode of which is active. gui.document.Document ("doc") objects
    are evolving into something more like classical MVC controllers.
    
    The new InteractionMode objects know which doc and which tdw was active
    at the time of the event, which may allow us to add additional views of
    a model controlled by a single doc.
    
    Active interaction modes' handlers can freely push new sub-modes to the
    mode stack, and pop the stack when they're finished: this is how
    switching modes using modifiers now works. There's an enter/leave
    protocol at work for ensuring grabs are released appropriately.
    
    * Replaces older button-press abstractions.
    
    * Modes replace dragfuncs: certain modes are specialised for dragging between
      pen-down and pen-up events, and for keypresses involving space.
    
    * Bye bye tdw's DragHandler, hello new super-grabby DragMode base class.
    
    Differences between space drags and button-down drags are abstracted
    away by the DragMode interface.
    
    * Can now space-drag and zoom etc. on the scratchpad.
    
    * Input stroke observers now belong to the gui-doc only.
    
    * Global pressure mapping is now an Application attribute.
    
    The controller classes track last event position and time on their TDWs
    so that all modes can use the information, and so that it updates for
    all modes.
    
    * There's a minimal canvas controller for testing and the
      brush icon editor: it uses a freehand-only mode which cannot be switched
      using modifier keys.
    
    TODO: need Actions for changing the active mode. Kinda what we're aiming
    at here.
    
    TODO: merge "linemode.py" modes into the new structure. This already
    uses its own similar scheme.

99	2	gui/application.py
22	8	gui/brushcreationwidget.py
1	1	gui/brushselectionwindow.py
3	1	gui/brushsettingswindow.py
867	0	gui/canvasevent.py
241	95	gui/document.py
0	194	gui/dragfunc.py
34	176	gui/drawwindow.py
7	5	gui/linemode.py
6	13	gui/scratchwindow.py
103	315	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 3b4046b7b0e0ff8d0529dfd737e42f882fed7c01
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-31 14:42:07 +0100

    tdw: split cursor stuff to a mixin
    
    Cursor stuff belongs on the renderer, but it's highly reusable and
    doesn't really carry much of its own state. Therefore make it a mixin.
    
    Generate fewer cursor updates (ISTR MS Windows cursors being reported as
    a little flickery), and move cursor sizing to the new mixin to make what
    the new conditional brush_modified_cb() does easier to understand.
    
    Various minor cleanups.

commit 6220fb9c61dbbb16f3a61b98f5c14c12018011e1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-30 22:41:03 +0100

    color adjusters: modifiers should do 1 thing only
    
    Behavioural fixes for the colour bending implementation (microadjusting
    the selected colour by selecting with button2 or button3 then dragging).
    Modifiers should just toggle between three operations and not combine
    them: it's easier to explain and much easier to figure out.
    
     * Unmodified + button2/3 drag: select, then adjust luma.
     * Shift + button2/3 drag: select, then adjust chroma.
     * Control + button2/3 drag: select, then adjust hue.
    
    Bugfix: base hue bending on initial hue, not intial chroma. Oops.

18	15	gui/colors/adjbases.py

commit 7177a5273f899476fb1079af9b9eef93b2e239ae
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-27 17:50:29 +0100

    luminosity/luma: use the same coeffs everywhere
    
    Use the coefficients from the forthcoming Compositing and Blending 1.0
    specification from FXTF everywhere we compute luma: it'll help to avoid
    inconsistencies like being seemingly able to brush-colourize a Color
    layer visually brighter or darker with with a colour of the same exact
    shade and 100% opacity.

10	13	brushlib/brushmodes.c
16	6	gui/colors/uicolor.py

commit d9539a308641ce9ad157c11047a07d4e43260155
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-26 20:20:33 +0100

    pixops: add color and luminosity layer blend modes
    
    Artists can now use layer-based colourization and lightness setting, as
    described at
    
    http://www.androidblues.com/JealousyStepbystep/jealousystep.html
    
    This implementation uses the algorithm described in the PDF Reference,
    the Cairo documentation, and most recently in a W3C (FXTF, i.e. SVG and
    CSS) Editor's Draft specification. Let's refer to it in OpenRaster files
    as svg:color and svg:luminosity and hope the SVG names don't change.
    
    http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/FXTF/rawfile/tip/compositing/index.html
    http://cairographics.org/operators/

212	0	lib/composite_rgbx.hpp
5	0	lib/layer.py
102	0	lib/pixops.hpp
2	0	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 20a3bc8a988f36f16714058168174ec05d21d2a5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-25 19:22:42 +0100

    Layer stack actions: update, make more keybindable
    
    New keybindable commands in the menu:
    
      * Raising and lowering a layer in the layers stack
      * Duplicating the current layer
      * Renaming the current layer
      * Setting the current layer's visibility
      * Setting the current layer's locked status
    
    Renaming a layer is now undoable, for consistency with the other layer
    metadata commands.
    
    Internal changes
    ----------------
    
    A more sensible implementation for labelling unnamed layers. It's not a
    fix for https://gna.org/bugs/?17991 yet, but that really isn't going to
    be fixed until we decide not to allow unnamed layers at all, or save our
    bodged-in reference numbers.
    
    lib.command.RemoveLayer can now remove the final layer. If it does so,
    it replaces it with a new unnamed layer. Required by the cleaner
    nameless layer labelling code, which uses the layer to store its own
    ref number, and it's better for identity and semantics. It was always
    silly that "removing" the final layer would keep its name.

commit 3c4dbb514f7a02973c92bdea6353b5838ae7e36c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-19 00:06:36 +0100

    toolbar+panels: initial fixes for pygtkcompat-gtk3
    
    Fix up toolbars and dropdown panels so that they initialize without any
    exceptions under pygtkcompat+PyGI+GTK3.
    
    Unusual:
    
    * gtk.Action.connect_proxy(w) -> Gtk.Activatable.set_related_action(a).
      - old form deprecated since 2.16
    
    * The gtk.Action.set_tool_item_type() classmethod is better handled by
      overriding create_tool_item() when making toolbars via UIManager.
      https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=653303
      - supposedly since 2.4
    
    The usual mess:
    
    * Fix menu button bold to use markup - nicer for the more restrictive
      PyGI-era Pango wrappings.
    
    * .allocation -> .get_allocation();
    
    * .window -> .get_window();
    
    * .parent -> .get_parent();
    
    * gdk.pointer_ungrab() requires a timestamp;
    
    * Popup menu positioners have args in a different order.

commit eb2e9a72fced4a885f0290246b05e4d029f71712
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-09 23:37:18 +0100

    tdw: fix size_allocate_cb for gtk3
    
    Fixes Gtk assertion in stroke_to() after resizing the window.
    
    GdkRectangles have changed and we can't keep references to them around
    indefnitely any more, without generating strange results if we try to
    perform arithmetic with their attrs. Assign the info we need to real
    python ints instead.

commit b9049d1ea197a7e9bc57691f8d97e5ada189ba4e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-08 22:51:29 +0100

    tdw/pixbufsurface: more gtk3 compat
    
    Fix up subpixbuf and sparse updates stuff so that tdw sort-of works
    under gtk3... until you try to resize it, sigh.
    
    Have to use our own copy of gdk_pixbuf_get_pixels_array() in mypaintlib
    since it was a pygtk thing and is no longer supported. It's Gdk-version-
    independent code.
    
    This adds mypaintlib deps on pygobject and gtk+. Add a hopefully
    temporary build flag for form's sake, mostly. Use "scons enable_gtk3=1"
    at build time, and set the environment variable MYPAINT_ENABLE_GTK3=1 at
    runtime.

    area. Lack of them was causing a layout glitch, and it's the right thing
    to do anyway. https://gna.org/bugs/?19902#comment2

    some tabs are going to be hidden by having narrow sidebars ow windows,
    it makes more sense to put the most useful ones where they're most
    likely to still be on screen.

commit e6855f74dc53748d66e08bac95658104d393a9aa
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-13 02:17:35 +0100

    SConstruct: profiling debug symbols on by default
    
    Debugger symbols are primarily used for profiling purposes in MyPaint,
    and take up little space in the binaries compared to the default
    backgrounds. Therefore build with -g by default as discussed on IRC.
    If distros have policies against compiling with debugging information
    and no equivalent of dh_strip, they can use "enable_profiling=0" at
    build time to suppress this behaviour.

5	1	SConstruct

commit eba3d0d36bb453db89f9654fe19855766a26235f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-11 20:32:59 +0100

    SConstruct: make debugging optional
    
    Debugging should be optional, and sisabled for normal builds. Packaged
    builds will strip debugger symbols out anyway, but it's still better
    form to use the existing debug flag and not builds them in each time.

commit 4bc69d850ead4bae17c4e7bb762d70e0c0fbcb39
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-06 22:34:05 +0100

    triangle: use gtk.HSV directly: breaks pygtk 2.17
    
    It makes the API more convenient when porting to GTK3 using our
    pygtkcompat layer to not have to pull it into the colors submodule.
    Rewrite HSVTriangle to wrap gtk.HSV directly; supporting ancient GTK
    versions will just hold us back, given pygtkcompat wants compliance with
    pygtk 2.24 anyway.
    
    *** This breaks compatibility with pygtk versions prior to 2.18 ***
    
    Ubuntu lucid (old LTS) users should upgrade to the new LTS, precise.
    I'm not supporting the old Ubuntu LTS any more with the PPA builds.
    Debian squeeze (current stable) users should either upgrade to testing
    or unstable if they really want to test new software, backport pygtk, or
    use Debian's stable MyPaint releases.

2	2	gui/colors/__init__.py
33	101	gui/colors/hsvtriangle.py
11	11	gui/toolbar.py

commit 4d9deb914e5f8e5046bdddc24eaecf7a918a5e08
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-05 03:30:41 +0100

    palette view: drag/drop and active area tweaks
    
    Improve handling of cursor feedback.
    
    The area with no swatches is now never treated as containing a colour.
    This means that you have to actually click on swatches to select them,
    but it makes dragging more understandable. Dragging to where there is no
    swatch is now always a move (or copy) to the end of the palette.

26	15	gui/colors/paletteview.py

commit 52ceff8f84a0512e19717ef8d31358e9e659e5d1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-05 03:19:51 +0100

    palette view: treat near-exact matches like exact
    
    Extend the tolerance for "exact" matches a little because painted
    strokes nominally of the same colour can vary in pixel colour to degrees
    smaller than is easily perceptible, but which were still considered
    approximate matches. The same is true of the edges of fuzzy strokes over
    short distances.
    
    Treating very near-exact matches like exact matches should improve the
    flow of the PaletteNext and PalettePrev actions a little after a
    pick-color action: if it's a near-exact match, you won't have to hit the
    PaletteNext action twice to get the next swatch.

25	13	gui/colors/paletteview.py

commit 302300e6fd78c1d8c84ef68fdd038cf105a754d9
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-05 03:16:44 +0100

    palette editor dialog: action button updates
    
    Forbid removal of a final swatch. The palette should not be empty. If
    removing a final colour would make the palette empty, add a new empty
    swatch.
    
    Improve button sensitivity management.

commit b5ef0d4dda565045e54021ff445602781c8f81b0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-03 20:49:07 +0100

    palettes: default from file, add palettes dir
    
    Add a palettes dubdiectory and begin populating it with palettes. Load
    the initial palette from here when MyPaint starts up without a stored
    palette prefs key.
    
    The palettes subdir is installed as a datapath folder, i.e. to
    /usr/share/mypaint/palettes. The files in there will typically be
    read-only, but can be used as templates for new palettes. To make
    finding them easier, make a shortcut for them in the palette load
    dialog.
    
    Minor docstring updates.

commit 09a8548dcaba4ee83f2e3332ae27dbc671bfbd9b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-06-28 16:11:27 +0100

    palette: track current colour, prev+next actions
    
    The palette now tracks the current colour, moving the index point to the
    nearest exact or near match of the current brush colour when it changes.
    Nearest-match colours are drawn with a slightly fainter border than
    exact matches.
    
    Added PaletteNext and PalettePrev actions: these move the index marker
    backward and forward through the non-empty slots, and show the palette
    tab if some other colour selector is visible.
    
    Minor method name changes.

commit 317d159f1d81cd185131188c35f0951562c13deb
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-06-27 17:17:32 +0100

    adjusters: H, C, or Y tweaks with button-!1 drags
    
    Allow the colour to be adjusted minutely after selection by clicking
    then dragging with buttons other than button 1. Button 1 drags already
    have a defined meaning.
    
    Dragging normally adjusts the luma,
    Shift + drag adjusts the chroma as well,
    Ctrl + drag adjusts the hue instead of the luma.

1	0	SConscript

commit 3c9adc3fa792b92260cd24db7b4c44aa0a16575a
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-05-20 18:03:06 +0100

    color sels: merge & revamp; palettes & gamut masks
    
    Merge the old colour selectors into a single tabbed dockable with new
    controls. Add an HCY wheel selector with a gamut mask. Add an editable
    palette tab. Palettes and gamut masks can be saved as Gimp palette files
    and loaded from them.
    
    Major UI changes:
    
    * The old dockable colour selectors have moved to a tabbed, dockable
      dialog: it's on the "c" key by defult, but this may change.
    
    * The bottom of each tab has a picker button, a pair of previous/next
      comparison widgets, a button for adding the current brush colour to
      the palette, and a properties button for the current tab which is
      sometimes greyed out.
    
    * The "HSV Cube" tab has a wide, squarish S+V surface like the centre of
      the old Color Sampler.
    
    * Editable palettes. Load from, and save to GIMP palette files.
    
    * The "HCY Wheel" tab displays hue, chroma, and perceptual luminance,
      and supports gamut masks.
    
    Gamut masks are a new feature which replaces the old harmonies dial:
    they're a significantly more flexible way of planning a colour scheme.
    Presets for kinds of colour schemes which are similar to the old
    harmonies are available via the New button in the properties dialog for
    the HCY Wheel color adjuster.
    
    The palette and gamut mask you were last working on are saved to the
    MyPaint preferences regardless of whether you saved them to a file.
    
    Internal changes:
    
    * Submodule "colors", because these widgets can be run and tested
      independently from the MyPaint core. Should help with GTK3 porting, I
      guess.
    
    * Manipulation of any colour shared between certain widgets now has its
      own interface.
    
    * Colours manipulated via the UI now have specialized, interchangable
      and inter-convertible classes. It's normally better to use these then
      direct manipulation of floating-point HSV tuples.
    
    * The brush colour is now best manipulated via app.brush_color_manager.
      Colour history now resides there.

1	0	SConscript
-	-	desktop/icons/hicolor/16x16/actions/mypaint-tool-color-rgb.png

commit fe2219ad603a19a4a5ad3ad46c9d86ecdfd4096b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-07-04 01:36:14 +0100

    SConstruct: add feature test macro for strdup()
    
    strdup() isn't __STRICT_ANSI__, so it must be asked for via a feature
    test macro when building with -std=c99 to avoid a warning. Allowing the
    compiler warning through at all breaks some picky build envionments'
    after-the-fact build log checking, e.g. Launchpad's amd64 automated PPA
    builds, and debian ia64 buildds.
    
    http://wiki.debian.org/ImplicitPointerConversions

3	0	SConstruct

commit 6ffc54bd448879a96560f822316270112de8985a
Author: = <david.e.shere@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-25 16:38:05 -0700

    Fixed bug #19772 by adding call to update_cursor method in set_zoom

1	0	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 9cfce30d76e6a888995884aac77811563ae863ab
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-06-26 14:07:38 +0100

    device detection: ignore keyboards
    
    Ignore special keyboards with built-in pointer type hardware that GDK
    reports, for the purposes of tablet detection. They presumably will
    never have pressure-sensitive hardware attached, and setting screen mode
    for them can actively screw them up.
    
    Also add what seems to be a missing "continue" statement for the
    glidepoint case: presumably that block is meant to ignore them, like the
    other special cases.

6	0	gui/application.py

commit 1268a1bc489427e942b7bedd21e9c68ab372aa0d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-06-23 17:57:45 +0100

    brushlib tests: fix build failure sans enable_gegl
    
    Regular builds were requiring gegl-2.0, which isn't available
    in Ubuntu 12.04.

commit 59b49b2253dad2800497a30660f0a98d68d50f8b
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-14 00:09:58 +0200

    brushlib: Add documentation build
    
    Use "scons enable_docs=true" to build.
    
    Makes use of doxygen, Sphinx and breathe:
    - doxygen scans the C code,
    - breathe makes this available for use in Sphinx
    - Sphinx compiles the document to HTML
    
    breathe can be found here: http://michaeljones.github.com/breathe/

commit 0df61932c6075039ac6027818e28967a25513679
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-04 16:21:39 +0200

    brushlib: Add a trivial fixed-size MyPaintSurface implementation
    
    The surface is backed by a single linear buffer, and has
    a fixed size that is decided at creation time. It is intended
    to be a simple example/reference implementation, not something
    to use in production in non-trivial applications.
    For those cases, MyPaintGeglTiledSurface can be used instead.
    
    Note: currently untested.

159	0	brushlib/mypaint-fixed-tiled-surface.c
22	0	brushlib/mypaint-fixed-tiled-surface.h

commit d9aa8aaab7da1a7968f9739d3c0dfdf453767c32
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-04 17:35:34 +0200

    brushlib: Fix unresolved types for GObject Introspection
    
    - Apparently when a struct is forward declared, the
    typedef for that struct must come before the definition
    of the struct.
    - The C99 uint16_t is not recognized, use guint16 instead

2	2	brushlib/mypaint-surface.h

commit 6b77d13bbd5ff3fad485a48b632c3a7030127e0c
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-05-06 19:46:39 +0200

    lib: Allow to enable new GEGL based Surface for MyPaint
    
    Use "scons enable_gegl=true" at build time, and set the
    environment variable "MYPAINT_ENABLE_GEGL=1" at runtime.
    
    Without the environment variable set, MyPaint will run
    as normal.

commit 1efe7edda30c3890e450afb4d5b471f675c4190d
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-06-01 23:23:19 +0200

    Build: Allow to use C99
    
    MSVC still does not support C99 fully, but most compilers
    do support most of the things we are likely to be using.
    Also, some libraries (notably json-c) use C99 features in
    some of their headers. We should avoid doing the same in
    our public interfaces.

1	0	SConstruct

    have to implement 1-4 methods for this. get_tile is mandatory,
    begin_atomic, end_atomic, update_tile and area_changed is
    optional.

commit 7a20f20b63d776412d5add8b40fa8d49b24808d3
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-05-16 23:55:56 +0200

    TiledDrawWidget: Split into four different classes
    
    Make the reponsibilities of this widget more clear by separating
    out the two main aspects into separate classes: one for
    rendering and one for event handling. A utility class is
    used for drag handling and cursor updates.
    In addition it makes the public API of TiledDrawWidget explicit.
    
    This will hopefully make it easier to reuse the code that
    is not backend-specific, like event and drag handling.

303	168	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 2dc0c4294d1c14f71dd45f0549a518cfebe4c25c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-05-13 23:40:37 +0100

    symmetry: new axis derives from display centre
    
    New symmetry axes are now the line x=N in model space which intersects
    the centre of the display at the time when the axis is created.
    Generating them in the old way looked especially strange when rotation
    was active.

4	3	gui/document.py

commit 5556f45b8542051d25b122a2d822ed18174bb033
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-05-13 23:22:24 +0100

    symmetry: refactor, manage states via UI
    
    Manage all the per-surface symmetry state using a faked global setting
    in the UI doc for simplicity. Make the state of the UI toggles and menu
    entries all match this faked setting. Track necessary changes to real
    model doc state to update it.
    
     - Symmetry is disabled on document New and Open.
     - Model symmetry state is inherited by Copy Layer and New Layer.
     - Turning Symmetric Painting on updates the axis to match the display centre.
    
    Bugfix: symmetry axis now uses model coords and not raw display coords.

26	3	gui/document.py
0	4	gui/tileddrawwidget.py
2	0	lib/command.py
24	0	lib/document.py
6	0	lib/layer.py
3	3	lib/tiledsurface.hpp

commit 1692ef1d6308f7932e2c67dcfb20a5d12741f28c
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-05-13 13:03:33 +0200

    lines: allow to constrain by releasing shift
    
    A line can now be constrained with either shift or ctrl. When
    the line is started from normal mode with a modifier (e.g. by
    holding shift), the meaning of that modifier is inverted. This
    allows to access more functionality with a single modifier.
    
    see comments at http://gitorious.org/mypaint/mypaint/commit/c0387a89a6b31d6d59ff69518c19dd40227d7128

8	6	gui/linemode.py

commit c0387a89a6b31d6d59ff69518c19dd40227d7128
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-05-11 17:11:33 +0200

    lines: swap shift and ctrl modifiers
    
    Make shift-drag draw an unconstrained line, instead of snapping the
    angle until you release shift. This makes it much easier to draw
    perspective lines. Using Ctrl to constrain makes us consistent with
    GIMP and Inkscape.
    
    Pass the modifier (ctrl,shift,alt) used to start an action to the
    dragfunc, so the dragfunc can ignore it and do its normal (unmodified)
    function.

4	4	gui/dragfunc.py
13	7	gui/drawwindow.py
20	14	gui/linemode.py
2	2	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 80a73e5e1745fba5fb4c56012940bf46693726e4
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2012-05-06 19:38:27 +0200

    TiledSurface: Make it possible to subclass for different tile storage
    
    Make the relevant methods virtual, and variables protected. Not
    the nicest way to share code with alternative implementations but
    at least it is simple.
    Also makes the surface symmetry per-surface. If it should be
    global for all surfaces in application, that should be managed
    by the GUI.

commit 248f2b357802c5874b25c6d2fbeaeaaa9b3c0c74
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-04-20 12:24:04 +0100

    tdw: refactoring: encapsulate Cairo better
    
    All of the external calls to get_model_coordinates_cairo_context() were
    used for the purposes of converting between display and model
    coordinates. If we decide to change the display backend at any point,
    exposing this implementation detail might cause problems. Provide a pair
    of methods for coordinate transforms instead, and begin using them. The
    code becomes slightly more readable in places as a result.

3	5	gui/dragfunc.py
2	5	gui/linemode.py
3	6	gui/overlays.py
49	36	gui/tileddrawwidget.py
4	5	lib/scratchpad_palette.py
1	2	tests/test_memory_leak.py
1	2	tests/test_performance.py

commit 185bed63d7386e6a1e61d613a2d75b36fbd92d92
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-04-16 23:07:20 +0100

    fastpng: fix bad handling of gAMA chunk
    
    Fix incorrect application of file gamma. MyPaint was wrongly using an
    encoding gamma when a decoding gamma should have been applied, resulting
    in overly high values in the midrange when loading files for which the
    gAMA chunk was applicable. Tested with the "gamma values" sample images
    at http://www.schaik.com/pngsuite/ and sample files from the bug report.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?19648

1	1	lib/fastpng.hpp

Date:   2012-04-15 22:25:47 +0200

commit 8b6b9fc9185391f67d594e6327f20fc7868b8450
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-04-07 21:15:17 +0100

    fastpng: 16bpc endianness fixes
    
    PNG uses a consistent byte order, but lcms2 doesn't. Fix tartanization
    on iX86, amd64 and similar architectures.
    
    Test images: http://www.fnordware.com/superpng/samples.html

17	2	lib/fastpng.hpp

commit 986c55ed815ea7387d75c8ceeabca19296b95447
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-04-02 01:01:24 +0100

    lcms2: transforms on load; groundwork for save
    
    Basic build infrastructure for lcms2.
    
    Load PNG files using whatever colour management info is in there, but
    convert to sRGB 8-bit using lcms2. At the same time, detect PNGs which
    were written without CM chunks.
    
    If/when we go to linear light compositing in line with other OpenRaster
    editors, we'll need to detect old OpenRaster files and do something sane
    with them. One way of detecting would be to use lack of CM chunks as a
    strong hint that a file was written by an old version of MyPaint. It'd
    need confirmation; possibly using (the presence of) OpenRaster version
    numbers in stack.xml assuming the spec dictates linear light at the same
    time that MyPaint starts writing version numbers.
    
    Infrastructure in place for saving PNG files with sRGB+cHRM+gAMA chunks,
    but not utilized. Right now, MyPaint defaults to *not* saving them
    because I might want to use this condition for a flag (see above...)

2	2	README

commit 0d0af20edf9d84655f99f1639643208bb38a41b0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-03-17 15:26:51 +0000

    compositing: minor optimizations
    
    Some macro-based optimisations. Not really a single code path now, but
    both the RGBU and RGBA versions are at least defined in the same place.
    Also use bitshifts instead of divs; conditional compilation of certain
    sections. Slight win vs. master:
    
    memory_zoomed_out_5x            <1%
    scroll_nozoom                       -3%
    paint_rotated                       -1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_1x_onelayer   <1%
    save_png                            -2%
    startup                         <1%
    memory_after_startup            <1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_2x_onelayer   <1%
    brushengine_paint_hires         <1%
    paint                               -2%
    save_ora                        <1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_5x                -1%
    layerpaint_nozoom                   -2%
    paint_zoomed_out_5x             <1%
    scroll_nozoom_onelayer              -2%
    layerpaint_zoomed_out_5x        <1%
    save_png_layer                  <1%
    save_ora_again                      -1%
    load_ora                        <1%

commit bfba648751cf8a77b4782608c84130c7ec91fa37
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-03-06 23:03:46 +0000

    pixops: refactor compositing code: python to C
    
    RGBA and RGBU have the same layout, so we might as well process them
    through the same code path and avoid having to maintain the same thing
    in Python and in C. A test on a Boolean constant arg is a small price to
    pay for better code maintanability.
    
    Tested against master, and visually identical to it (using renderings of
    the W3C "Uluru" test image):
    
      * src-over
      * multiply
      * screen
      * dodge
    
    Tested against master with visually differing output:
    
      * burn - here an inconsistency in master between the old RGB and RGBA
        modes in the case with zero source colour components goes away. It's
        most evident when burning with black over bright colours. Behaviour in
        this range is consistent with GIMP, and isn't really noticable in the
        burn-specific W3C sample image.
    
    Also, document the hell out of things, in the name of code readability.
    Draw parallels with the operators' definitions in the W3C spec itself,
    http://www.w3.org/TR/SVGCompositing/
    
    measurements: (tests/test_performance.py -c 7 -a)
    memory_zoomed_out_5x            <1%
    scroll_nozoom                       +6%
    paint_rotated                       +2%
    scroll_zoomed_out_1x_onelayer       +2%
    save_png                            +4%
    startup                                 -2%
    memory_after_startup            <1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_2x_onelayer   <1%
    brushengine_paint_hires         <1%
    paint                               +1%
    save_ora                        <1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_5x                +1%
    layerpaint_nozoom                   +3%
    paint_zoomed_out_5x             <1%
    scroll_nozoom_onelayer              +3%
    layerpaint_zoomed_out_5x            +1%
    save_png_layer                  <1%
    save_ora_again                  <1%
    load_ora                        <1%

350	87	lib/pixops.hpp
6	124	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit ff76a38da8d753a8c95d5b96e44d3722c11165c3
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-02-05 17:01:56 +0100

    get rid of RGB pixel format, use RGBU instead
    
    RGBU = RGB with unused alpha channel
    
    Saving 25% memory is probably not worth the effort of maintaining
    code for two different pixel formats.  On-screen rendering must be
    RGBU anyway (graphic card acceleration fails if it isn't).
    I expect to make real use of RGBU compositing ops in future commits,
    where the alpha channel has to remain unmodified.
    
    Performance impact: scrolling 5% slower, painting 2% slower
    
    measurements: (tests/test_performance.py -c 7 -a)
    memory_zoomed_out_5x change <1%
    scroll_nozoom +4%
    paint_rotated +2%
    scroll_zoomed_out_1x_onelayer +1%
    save_png +6%
    startup change <1%
    memory_after_startup change <1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_2x_onelayer +6%
    brushengine_paint_hires change <1%
    paint +2%
    save_ora +1%
    scroll_zoomed_out_5x +5%
    layerpaint_nozoom +3%
    paint_zoomed_out_5x +1%
    scroll_nozoom_onelayer +5%
    layerpaint_zoomed_out_5x change <1%
    save_png_layer change <1%
    save_ora_again +2%
    load_ora change <1%

1	1	gui/tileddrawwidget.py
13	12	lib/backgroundsurface.py
7	5	lib/document.py
6	1	lib/fastpng.hpp
2	1	lib/layer.py
15	18	lib/pixbufsurface.py
67	109	lib/pixops.hpp
51	43	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 38ada522fddfba72d295890121bafd9b5d4fc06e
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2012-01-25 23:24:11 +0100

    strokemap: don't record two brushes as one stroke
    
    Create a new undoable stroke when any but the most basic brush
    settings change. This was especially a problem when toggling
    eraser often in mid-stroke. Picking a stroke that started in
    eraser mode but ended in normal mode would pick an eraser brush.
    
    http://gna.org/bugs/?19044

13	0	lib/document.py

commit 9a15e2c4e3b36e0bf266dbbe10c71f890fbf353b
Author: Martin Franco <mfranco@gmx.com>
Date:   2012-01-08 11:13:09 -0600

    Add symetrical drawing
    
    View->Symmetry, bound to the pipe character "|".  Drawing and straight lines
    are mirrored over the x axis in realtime.
    
    TiledSurface has new variables do_symmetry and center_x.
    
    center_x is set to the center of the drawing area.  This is dependent on the
    size of the window, so resizng will change the center axis.
    
    Closes bug: https://gna.org/bugs/?func=detailitem&item_id=18375

commit 2258511515917f2249e8a8e7c1f3eeac81aed9eb

    feedback/overlays: begin categorizing, add toggles
    
    Add toggle actions and boolean user settings for those classes of
    feedback which are currently implemented as overlays. Scale display
    defaults to on, last-pos feedback defaults to off.
    
    If we add a statusbar, certain kinds of textual feedback should go
    there and not to the overlays if the statusbar is visible. Fading
    overlays are quite visually noisy! This will require some sort of
    textual feedback manager, but... later.
    
    Regularize overlay constructors. Move responsibility for overlay
    management to the drawwindow for now.

commit 619789d13d1b3de2c66d8785b749dc7bb5f835a0
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2012-01-11 01:02:30 +0000

    overlays: api for showing info on tdws
    
    Experimental stab at an internal interface for animated or static
    fragments of overlaid information which respond to user events.
    Currently just a scale/zoom level indicator and a marker for the last
    painting position, both of which fade out and are careful to only redraw
    their own section of the screen.
    
    Intended uses: textual explanations of fancy modes with lots of keyboard
    chording, showing the document frame both normally and when being
    edited, anything which must be displayed that isn't the canvas being
    worked on. Maybe even previews of the current brush, its radius, colour,
    stylus nib angle, whatever.

commit 7014f2e365a07f2c2da8dd63f93f3066dac762d5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-08 19:16:04 +0000

    brushlib: colorize brush blendmode with weighting
    
    Add a tinting/colorizing brush blend mode which applies the source's hue
    and saturation while retaining the value of the target image.  You can
    colorize with aa different colour immediately afterwards if you like,
    and theoretically at least, only a little information is lost.
    
    This uses a variant on the Krita way of doing things, similar to that of
    PDF implementations using the open spec: the algorithm comes from the
    spec addendum.
    
    Colorize mode is weighted. I've used the luma coefficients from the
    HDTV/sRGB specs rather than the older SDTV spec, but there shouldn't be
    too much to choose between them. Most calibrated monitors approximate
    sRGB, so that should be OK.

2	1	brushlib/brush.hpp
1	0	brushlib/brushsettings.py
2	1	brushlib/surface.hpp
1	1	gui/brushsettingswindow.py
126	0	lib/brushmodes.hpp
9	1	lib/tiledsurface.hpp

commit 545d6f808d39a6f351e9b68c7704d8be3d66281d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-26 20:49:42 +0000

    layer move: strokemap too + cursor & idler tweaks
    
    Add support for moving the layer's strokemap after the user finishes the
    drag. Do it unobtrusively in the existing idletask processor.
    
    Cursor fix: now that layer moves are more responsive, the four-way arrow
    or closed fist cursor feels nicer.
    
    Internally, there is now one idletask processor per StrokeShape, not a
    single global instance. Shapes can now be forced to completion
    independently of other shapes, which may be slightly faster when picking
    if the shape of interest is near the top of the stack. The payoff from
    using individual processor objects is far more certain when queueing
    strokemap translate operations.

8	4	gui/dragfunc.py
4	0	lib/layer.py
47	7	lib/strokemap.py
18	18	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 34a620fc4cb633ed5d9933d16aab7476df88fd33
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-25 23:16:12 +0000

    layer move: blank tiles during & after drag
    
    Avoid flickering and some redraws by blanking tiles needing it just
    before writing if they're also to be written, or in a big batch right at
    the end of processing each position update if they're still pending.
    Looks a bit crap and dropping-y for sparse layers, but it seems to work.
    
    Refactor the interactive move by encapsulating its redraw progress state
    in a helper object rather than passing lots of stuff around. Move
    responsibility for tile-side bookkeeping back into the surface
    implementation where it belongs.

25	43	gui/dragfunc.py
8	29	lib/layer.py
78	68	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 8245091ff6abeabbb4ebfa133282034cd97c11cb
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-24 20:23:57 +0000

    layer move: make undoable, distance weighting etc
    
    Allow the layer-move action to be undone.
    
    Distance-weight and dither the tiles being dragged around. Use modern
    key-based sorting too.
    
    General code tidy and path reduction.

commit 82b7f9e8514e058980b49b445dd556746fe6d4ec
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-24 02:10:05 +0000

    move layer: improved feedback & responsiveness
    
    Improve the apparent responsiveness during a drag to move the current
    layer. The idea is to update the display during the drag in an idle
    handler, lazily to avoid doing unnecessary work. Schedule the first tile
    shifts to happen around the cursor, since that's where the user is
    presumably looking. Still a little slow to start because of the initial
    snapshotting and sorting, but it feels far more responsive now.
    
    Add cursors for the various drag operations, just because.
    
    Hourglass/watch cursor after a move-layer drag while it slots the
    remaining tiles into place.

Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-11-16 19:07:02 +0000

    move layer: initial implementation
    
    Tiles are sliced up in Python code during moves.
    
    Abstract out all the drag functions as distinct classes with a
    start/update/stop interface and a common object lifecycle. This lets
    more complex drag objects be stateful.

commit 8c646ef4e4c807d3c87abef29f6248066741f593
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>

8	4	lib/document.py

commit d562b24346de89c0c6c10a9fafaf1d1778276a53
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-11-20 02:06:15 +0100

    load_ora: load png layers faster, use less memory
    
    Use libpng directly (fastpng.hpp) as we already did for saving.
    No longer load the full png into a gdk_pixbuf, but load and
    convert one tile row at a time.
    
    This should use less temporary memory, especially if lots of
    tiles are empty, because we can free them again early.
    
    This should fix https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?17568
    
    Also remove code to recognize solid backgrounds (because it expects
    the png to be in a gdk_pixbuf). Rely on the background_tile attribute
    instead.
    
    load_ora benchmark: 2.75 --> 2.08

3	4	lib/command.py
27	26	lib/document.py
169	0	lib/fastpng.hpp
2	2	lib/layer.py
80	22	lib/tiledsurface.py

    mypaintlib: Use SharedLibrary instead of LoadableModule in build
    
    On OSX LoadableModule will try to create a module bundle,
    which is not what we want. The SHLIBSUFFIX was also ignored,
    so produced file had the wrong file extension.

commit 325fcf93a14b84254d46974e5607f8c3911affa3
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-10-28 19:25:17 +0200

    brushlib: fix bug with smudge_length=0
    
    For brushes with smudge_length=0 (eg. in Ramon's concept art brushset)
    smudging was broken by my optimization 5dd46ce. For performance reasons
    we force smudge_length to be greater than 0.01 now.
    
    Ramon's concept art brushset uses a tiny smudge radius, so neither
    this commit nor my previous one affects their performance.
    
    Reminder to brush creators: increasing smudge_length does improve
    brush performance with the new code. Instead of using a tiny
    smudge radius (which can result in faster-than-expected smudge
    color changes) you can use a normal smudge radius and increase
    smudge_length instead to get performance.

3	2	brushlib/brush.hpp

commit 9dfe45b415235827af9e18eb9dc47dfe550892ef
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-10-22 23:18:11 +0200

    brushlib basic anti-aliasing
    
    Automatically adjust the dab hardness to prevent aliasing.
    
    Most current ink brushes use a low hardness to prevent aliasing, and
    are only suitable (fine-tuned) for a given resolution. With this new
    code, many brushes can now just set hardness to the maximum (1.0).
    
    Some advanced ink brushes make the hardness depend on speed or pressure,
    in order to get better anti-aliasing when the radius changes with
    speed or pressure. This is no longer needed and should be disabled
    to prevent blur.
    
    Anti-aliasing is enabled by default for all brushes. Existing pixel
    brushes and erasers that want to erase 100% and not just 99.9% will
    have to disable it.
    
    This is not the perfect anti-aliasing implementation of course; thin
    strokes (with radius close to 1px and below) tend to disappear because
    of the hardness implementation. This is because the math used in the
    implementation is correct mainly for large dabs with high hardness.

23	1	brushlib/brush.hpp
2	1	brushlib/brushsettings.py
1	1	gui/brushsettingswindow.py

    canvas.

commit 076f8fb25644ff4f8c3b22fe3de2df773eea4aa4
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-10-03 20:35:22 +0200

    Make TiledSurface an internal member of Layer
    
    Most part of the code should not care about
    the surface implementation used. Provide wrappers
    on layer for common things, and let the exotic
    things call layer._surface to make it clear they
    are dealing with internals.
    In order to make it easier to swap out TiledSurface
    with another surface implementation.

    items exactly and the constructor will do that for us.

commit 18a6c4bb5c47657d8252479d636ac53e7fe246be
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-09-24 15:06:29 +0100

    dropdowns: behavioural fixes for tablets
    
    Extended input events (tablet) may be reported outside the widget's
    allocation even if non-extended ones (mouse) would not. This was
    interfering badle with other widgets in the same dropdown window as the
    brush list, so don't ask for extended events where it isn't really
    needed, and refine the PixbufList hit tests a bit.
    
    Fix accidental dabbing when using the brush selector dropdown by closing
    the panel after the mouse button or stylus nib is released, not when
    pressed down. The problem is more apparent with tablets than mice since
    it's harder to separate clicks from clicks-with-motion.
    
    Adjusting the dropdown brush setting sliders now causes the dropdown
    panel to close when the pointer leaves it, like the colour triangle's
    pattern of interaction.

3	0	gui/brushselectionwindow.py
55	51	gui/dropdownpanel.py
15	8	gui/pixbuflist.py
5	2	gui/toolbar.py

    from stock, and could probably be improved.

    place to put things that make major but reversible changes to the gui,
    and it's a nice Fitts's-compliant use of the space.
    
    No togglability for the dropdowns yet, given the fiddly setup
    post-construction.

commit ff92513309a717b09cf853378b8a8eeae8898634
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-09-11 20:02:25 +0100

    toolbar: quick brush chooser on dropdown & default
    
    The quick brush chooser is now exposed on the panel directly as part of
    a new dropdown panel. The brush dropdown button is no longer in two
    parts: testing showed that people didn't really understand the reason
    for having it in two bits, so let's simplify it.
    
    Convert the quick brush chooser's brush list combobox to a custom
    spinner-like widget; done for pointer grab related reasons in the
    dropdown. Hopefully it's a fairly understandable control and easy to hit
    with a stylus.
    
    Expose the brush chooser as an Action, and make it the primary method of
    choosing a brush; the default binding for "b". This is intended to bring
    it closer in feel to a popup chooser like those for colour, which makes
    sense to me since its functionality is beginning to approach that of a
    popup menu (and we should probably go further).
    
    The existing Brush List has moved to "<shift>b" by default and is
    renamed to "Brush List Editor": you can still use it as as a permanent
    fixture for choosing brushes though. Rename the settings editor for
    consistency too, but don't change its default "<control>b" binding.
    
    Testers were complaining about the height of the toolbar, so drop it back
    to the usual GTK_ICON_SIZE_LARGE_TOOLBAR size. The new graphical
    tooltips should help make the brush preview useful.

commit 4def27c313fd1c729aab88ac30a0885635c43516
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-27 03:42:50 +0100

    brushmanager: fix a reliance on the Deevad group
    
    The brushkey and history initialisation code was relying on
    DEFAULT_STARTUP_GROUP existing, which causes knock-on effects in the
    brush history meny if it's missing doesn't. Now default to whatever
    looks like the biggest group.
    
    Tentative fix for https://gna.org/bugs/?18575

    immediately on the toolbar. Hopefully that's sensible initial behaviour.

commit b8c2b6334cd9de827f6bbcefe81eb82c8f666aa7
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-26 23:59:52 +0100

    toolbar: add a brush chooser & history dropdown
    
    Add a brush chooser MenuToolButton to the toolbar. Button icon shows the
    current brush. Clicking the button reveals a quick brush choice dialog,
    and its dropdown menu contains history, brush blend modes, and a toggle
    for the Brush List window.
    
    Remove the file actions from the toolbar since those can be accessed
    from the menu, and they're moderately rare actions in the middle of
    painting. Some reordering.
    
    Toolbar icons are now 32x32 pixels to make brush previews more readable.
    Hopefully that looks OK with most icon themes and doesn't consume too
    much space.
    
    Towards http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-development-and-suggestions/top-panel-dockables/
