    layout: normal subwindows, remove drag-snap-in

    panels back in being annoying - mostly complaints about the sidebar
    opening up and eating windows during drag. Provide a "tear off" strip
    looking like a TearoffMenuItem for snapping back in: hopefully the
    analogy's sensible. Reinstate normal-looking subwindows too, since we
    don't need the special titlebar in that state now.

    remove dead code for snapping out.

commit 213c6beadbcdac8d3a6e98e92c25b24fc23c3638
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-22 19:21:16 +0100

    Menubar hiding, menu button on the toolbar
    
    To save vertical space, the menu bar can now be hidden in the same way
    as the toolbar. When the menu bar is hidden, a menu button appears on
    the toolbar. This is roughly the way newer Firefox versions do it.
    
    The defaults are now to show the toolbar and its menu button, and hide
    the menubar.

    split_stroke optimization #2
    
    Turns out that we call load_snapshot() after every completed stroke.
    While this seems to be pointless, it doesn't cause any harm if we
    check whether the snapshots are equal before doing more work.

4	0	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit d9448b9d533c1e25e8f5486e7ed2fdc5a16834da
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-08-21 14:17:26 +0200

    split_stroke optimization
    
    This decreases the delay from "end of undoable stroke" until "ready
    for the next stroke" which is notable mainly during automatic splits
    of very long strokes.
    
    Obvious optimization. In the profile this lead to <method 'items'
    of 'dict' objects> making up 40% of the split_stroke() time.
    Setting: big image, zoomed out, small-radius brushing over the
    whole image.

commit ba72f9bbcf71912cf24dd0bc568f51867d6965e4
Author: Griatch <griatch@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-08-16 10:48:27 +0200

    change warmer/colder keyboard shortcut
    
    Changed the warmer/colder keyboard shortcut to not stop at a designated
    "cold/warm point" but instead go all the way around the hue circle.
    
    The reason for this is simple -- combined with brighter/darker and
    purer/grayer these keyboard shortcuts make for a very powerful way to
    select colour using the keyboard without having to click in the selector
    -- something I've not seen in any other program. With the hue selection
    (cooler/warmer is not really a good name for it in this case -- maybe
     hue plus/minus?) wrapping around, I can put the colour selector on a
    different screen entirely and only use it as a visual cue when
    navigating it via the keyboard.

10	14	gui/document.py

commit 79e22fa3a0f6cf212acc1c1144d4cd83ab5f0f9b
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-14 15:18:31 +0100

    colorsel: support older pygtk, add x2click details
    
    Since the PPA builds (and Windows builds if you want pressure support)
    need to support an ancient pygtk without a wrapped gtk.HSV, go back to
    the nasty old trick of rummaging around in a donor gtk.ColorSelection
    for spare parts. Sigh. Featurewise, this is slightly better. We regain
    draggable colours from the prev and next widgets, which we can use
    elsewhere: bits of the UI are now sensitive to having colours dropped on
    them, so might as well provide a source.
    
    Also add a trivial but nice to have colour details modal dialog on a
    double-click of the colour comparison boxes. You can now type hex codes
    into the dialog to set the current colour.

commit 2157d3fe562eb5c5a3530d65df4d5acb272ac841
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-08-07 14:32:22 +0200

    pixops: dithering for display and for saving PNG
    
    Since dithering is a cheap operation now, also enable it for
    the display when converting from 15bpc to 8bpc. When saving
    a solid PNG it is now dithered, too (not only transparent PNGs).
    
    I'm not claiming I can see the difference on my display, but
    you can certainly see when you post-process the PNG.
    
    scroll_nozoom_onelayer: performance seems to be unchanged (<5%)

commit 08c475d632edbd1b465a51780116fc926a2c05ed
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-08-06 13:54:27 +0200

    strokemap: thresholds tuning
    
    Replace ugly thresholding code with more ugly thresholding code.
    
    The previous code did compare the difference of premultiplied
    color components, with the result that white strokes had more
    weight than black strokes. This at least is fixed now, and
    hopefully everything is better tuned, too.

commit 74d3458a2182f19a84ece8db1e214a3bde7a7c1f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-05 10:02:42 +0100

    toolbar: force into icons-only mode
    
    Workaround for a (py)GTK bug. The style-changed signal fires at startup
    with an erroneous GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH setting even when overridden both in
    the user's gtkrc and in gconf, and even when the docs say the default is
    GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ. Forcing a style at that point means we can't
    respect the user's style changes later, and rather than fiddle and set
    up handlers within handlers and state flags to model GTK's peculiar
    world view, it's simpler for our code to just do something that'll be
    right for most users (who yes, tend to be graphical thinkers with good
    eyesight; but for those who aren't: we still allow overriding the
    toolbar icon size, and tooltips still work).

1	8	gui/drawwindow.py

commit d8ea2e69d6b13b296a4ad2409a25c8e5dce768c6
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-04 17:58:18 +0100

    toolbar: ignore really huge style defaults
    
    Override user settings of gtk.TOOLBAR_BOTH for the toolbar becuase
    that's way too big for sensible display of the number of buttons we
    have even at this early stage. Use gtk.TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ instead since
    that partly respects the user's desire for text (or it would if we
    declared any items as important).
    
    gtk.TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ is the default for most systems these days.

7	0	gui/drawwindow.py

commit 26da161f988482633655fe7820978d036978a756
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-08-02 22:20:55 +0100

    app: use an explicit path for icon searches
    
    Create the app instance with an explicit extra location for the icons,
    based in the install prefix as derived from argv[0]. Fixes the app not
    beeing able to start sensibly if installed somewhere not within the
    bases for the usual icon search path. Be even more picky about missing
    needed icons too so that people doing odd things get nicer feedback.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?18442

commit 96757fe02fd9b2155652cab1aba18b0fae71355f
Author: Ben O'Steen <bosteen@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-08-01 01:08:26 +0100

    Scratchpad: Refactored palette drawing code for reuse
    
    Moved the code to lib/scratchpad_palette.py:
    
    squiggle, *_squiggle --> various methods to generate brush 'events' that
    draw different 'squiggles'.
    
    draw_palette --> parameterised method to draw the palette. Can be given any document.Document
    object to draw on, and can be passed a palette of colours, offset and squiggle method to use.
    
    GimpPalette --> palette that can load in a gimp palette. May need to be renamed to simply 'Palette' and
    change 'load' method to reference gimp format as this palette object is more generic

commit 468aa1e859af266af2a73d79f8f3e72c672376d5
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-31 19:06:09 +0100

    brush modifier: fix eraser size regression
    
    Some bad logic meant that when leaving eraser mode, the radius change
    wasn't being stored. That also meant that it wasn't being reset either,
    so the brush size would just continue to grow and grow (or shrink and
    shrink) with a non-zero document.eraser_mode_radius_change setting.

commit 4568faa56bffef13e35eb5acff44c31728a05ac1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-23 23:42:20 +0100

    brushmodifier: redo states using gtk.ToggleActions
    
    It's fiddly to have toolbar and menu toggleactions track the state of an
    internal StateGroup's states, so rewrite brushmodifier using normal
    gtk.Actions.
    
    We now distingush between brushes that are dedicated eraser brushes and
    ones which aren't when entering and leaving eraser mode.
    
    This emulates a group of radio items, but since two of them can be
    toggled off by clicking them or pressing their key, it makes sense for
    them to be ToggleActions instead.

commit 8ab4edc7180ec25cd4867c3ce4f702b679b7b1d0
Author: Ben O'Steen <bosteen@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-07-28 00:10:41 +0100

    Scratchpad: Added palette drawing feature
    
    Provides a menu option in the Scratchpad tab to Draw a palette in the current
    scratchpad. This will open a file dialog and let the user select a Gimp Palette
    from the filesystem.
    
    The colours within this palette will be used to draw a grid of colours, using
    the current brush.

commit e912b3f5f8e7db43b4f5c5739cf53cd48fd45b18
Author: Ben O'Steen <bosteen@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-07-21 16:12:40 +0100

    Scratchpad: Fixed 'Save a copy' bug
    
    When warned about scratchpad autosaving over a file not in the scratchpad
    directory, the save a copy option didn't update the filename variable so
    that resuming after closing MyPaint would open the original instead of the
    safe copy.

7	2	gui/filehandling.py

commit e70f38f4cb3f59449ad5393157925739c5d2bfb4
Author: Ben O'Steen <bosteen@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-07-21 15:56:37 +0100

    Scratchpad: Added warning dialog about autosaving
    
    Allows the user to load a compatible file from anywhere on disc, but offers
    the user a chance to save a copy within the scratchpad directory so that
    inadvertent changes to the scratchpad are not propagated to the file loaded.
    
    For example, you may want to load a painting to copy its style, colour and
    framing, using 'Pick Context' to load brushes from it but not actually
    affect the underlying painting by accident.

0	2	gui/filehandling.py
31	1	gui/scratchwindow.py

commit b651739ff5c8ff1c7adaa8fd03974a9baadf2438
Author: Ben O'Steen <bosteen@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-07-21 14:19:05 +0100

    Fixed scratchpad (un)dock panning glitch
    
    Undocking or docking the scratchpad used to cause the view to pan,
    as it was calculating the view from the top of the container window, not the widget.

commit 65f751043cfe1a0233f93eb2591146723b5619fe
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-31 19:06:09 +0100

    brush modifier: fix eraser size regression
    
    Some bad logic meant that when leaving eraser mode, the radius change
    wasn't being stored. That also meant that it wasn't being reset either,
    so the brush size would just continue to grow and grow (or shrink and
    shrink) with a non-zero document.eraser_mode_radius_change setting.

    puzzled at blank icons.

commit c788c19ed455996a3ecb6a7637171cf4b7352f10
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-23 23:42:20 +0100

    brushmodifier: redo states using gtk.ToggleActions
    
    It's fiddly to have toolbar and menu toggleactions track the state of an
    internal StateGroup's states, so rewrite brushmodifier using normal
    gtk.Actions.
    
    We now distingush between brushes that are dedicated eraser brushes and
    ones which aren't when entering and leaving eraser mode.
    
    This emulates a group of radio items, but since two of them can be
    toggled off by clicking them or pressing their key, it makes sense for
    them to be ToggleActions instead.

Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-10 19:25:01 +0100

    layout: persuade metacity even harder about focus
    
    Fix a regression with metacity whereby keyboard focus would be given to
    floating windows which don't need it, breaking flow. Now declare tool
    windows as never receiving input focus, and push re-focusing the parent
    window back into the "map" event handler.

commit 5a7d407801b15e4f0789605075d35480b3b8e079
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-07-09 20:17:52 +0200

    brushmanager: fix brush saving after device change
    
    Make selected_brush always the same as the highlighted brush.
    
    When selecting a devbrush (because of switching devices), we used
    to highlight the parent brush, but behind the scenes the temporary
    devbrush was selected. In the brush editor, saving the brush settings
    would save into the temporary devbrush, instead of the selected brush.
    Reported here:
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-general-discussion/brushes-not-saving/
    
    Remove find_brushlist_ancestor(). We don't need to do a deep search,
    because the parent of a brush, if it exists, is always a ManagedBrush.

commit eba106b862bf0f49f8767b825ef63b4e54ced36a
Author: Elliott Sales de Andrade <quantum.analyst@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-05-02 01:19:11 -0400

    Don't translate a sentence fragment.
    
    It's not a good idea to translate sentence fragments, especially ones
    involving plurals. Depending on the language, the whole sentence might
    translate differently (e.g., French plural verbs). This also translates
    formatting, which is probably not a good idea.
    
    I tried to combine the translations as best I could, but some of them
    weren't translated completely. Some were fuzzy, also, which is probably
    because of the sentence fragment, but I'm just guessing.

commit 21dca8b9a18532fa6010f28b1cabd4007601d41e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-01 01:23:31 +0100

    layout: floating tools are now undecorated
    
    Remove the window manager decorations from tool windows in the floating
    state. This avoids witlessly repeating the title and close button at the
    top of the tool, and it saves a bit of vertical space too. Also the
    snap-out drag preview rectangle now shows you exactly where the window
    will go when you drop the window. To me it all looks and feels a little
    tighter and more consistent.
    
    Possibly controversial because people choose window managers for the
    looks and behaviour they like, but this commit should be easy to revert
    since it's just one line. OTOH, not every WM will respect the
    decoratedness hint anyway, so we may be fine there. The windows are
    still managed normally, so alt-tab should work normally where it's
    already supported.

1	0	gui/layout.py

commit e445ca7000aacbceaa6663c2e4204c9202fab55e
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-01 01:17:24 +0100

    resize grip: display when floating
    
    Display the resize grip when the window is floating, and make it more
    useful in that state. This is intended to support future changes to the
    floating windows' appearance, but it might be helpful on its own in WMs
    which don't allow tool windows to be resized.

commit 6b1a2bd069b1c032a959bb2f0b4b94dba714b480
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-01 00:25:03 +0100

    sidebar: fix positioning glitches
    
    Fix a couple of annoying positioning glitches when snapping out tools
    which are docked in the sidebar:
    
    * If the tool window hadn't yet been mapped, the WM would reliably
    choose a position other than what the user chose. Now the windows should
    go to where the user dragged the drag handle and not somewhere random.
    Tested with evilwm, compiz, wm2, metacity.
    
    * Using the snap out button would put the tool in its last-known
    location (or the wm default as above) rather than close to the button
    you just pressed. The user shouldn't have to remember where they dragged
    the tool in from, so the button now puts them close by in a cascading
    fashion.

107	16	gui/layout.py

commit 5afb14f12e68e82e72aaffea2eb3c69497e1d20d
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-07-01 00:01:15 +0100

    widget styles: plainer drag handles, state fix
    
    Cosmetic: some GTK styles use overly glossy buttons or draw with ugly
    indented borders. There's also the problem that what we drew as a button
    wasn't a button, which is confusing and bad UI. It's better to draw with
    a slight gradient instead and let the ordinary frame border take care of
    the outlining.
    
    Cosmetic: draw the resize grip using the current state, not "normal".
    
    Document some override methods.

37	7	gui/layout.py

commit 760c196356a4805c778a5245dcffdb9885078659
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-06-30 23:36:09 +0100

    sidebar: don't recenter the view on hide or show
    
    Cosmetic: showing or hiding the sidebar would cause the main viewport to
    recenter or "jump around" due to the resize. Fix by oberving sidebar
    shows and hides then ignoring the next size-allocate event.

commit 5b9d24c9dc882b823392b62ff9dc460dbcf8b74b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-06-18 16:07:25 +0200

    undo: slightly increase number of steps
    
    Moderate increase from 20 to 30 steps.
    
    Seems some people thought we have too few steps now, which is
    probably because we started to split strokes more often.
    
    Memory usage of a step can be significant if the stroke goes
    all over the image. Ideally we would take the diff and compress
    the history during natural breaks, like with the strokemap...

commit 2f7dce7adf2fd1142f5600c22a78b1bc99f2239b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-05-17 21:01:01 +0200

    rework locked_alpha and eraser mode GUI states
    
    Move code related to modes into brushmodifier.py (new module).
    
    Detect color change by observing app.brush. This gets rid of calls
    to end_eraser_mode() all over the place.
    
    Locked alpha state is now a permanent GUI state: brush selection
    does not terminate it. Things like entering eraser mode while the
    GUI is in locked alpha state should now lead to useful results.

commit 4472422add893519eb0194a75e229524cf655e44
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-05-16 10:43:43 +0200

    refactor brush observer code and its users
    
    Make ManagedBrush the primary class for storing, manipulating
    and observing brush settings.
    
    The Brush class (the one which inherits from the C++ brush
    class and is used for painting on a surface) is no longer
    manipulated directly, but observes a ManagedBrush instead.
    
    Refactor functionwindow.py such that it no longer assumes
    to be the only manipulator of app.brush. It will now update
    its GUI when the brush is modified, not only when a different
    brush gets selected.
    
    ManagedBrush now owns a private dictionary instead of
    inheriting from dict, and is manipulated from outside
    through accessor functions (to make it observable).
    Observing the dict alone is not enough, because it contains
    list instances that are manipulated without modifying the dict.
    
    startup performance benchmark: no change

commit 72ba38de9fa5986877c4f57caf87dbb0ce212c2b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-05-09 21:05:21 +0200

    draw_dab: revert separate eraser mode (fix smudging)
    
    BlendMode_Eraser was a regression, because the mode did allow only pure
    erasing, while the old code also allowed smudging. This commit fixes
    the smudging and "watercolor-like" brushes again.
    
    Moved the blending modes into brushmodes.hpp and added explanations.

commit 96d08724aca059e692d2232226b54a50a92591b8
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-04-03 20:27:11 +0100

    layout: fix saved window positions with x=0 or y=0
    
    Restored tool windows with x=0 or y=0 would return on the far right or
    bottom of the screen. Fix by accepting 0 as a valid top or left
    position when positioning windows.
    
    Alao, since negative x or y has meaning with our new window positioning
    code and is generally unhelpful anyway, don't save negative x or y
    window positions. The value 0 will be saved instead.

5	3	gui/layout.py

commit 0b23383a2dbef71561f7aa2788b93631f3989045
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-04-03 20:08:31 +0100

    layout: positioning fixes
    
    No longer use gtk.WIN_POS_MOUSE: https://gna.org/bugs/?17915
    
    Favour gtk.Window.parse_geometry if we have all the required window
    position and size info. This works better with some window managers.
    
    Definitively set the position of tools which are snapped out by
    dragging with the mouse and the preview window to take of the preview
    window in a deferred handler.

17	9	gui/layout.py

    windowing: disable gtk color selector by default

    code requiring a very recent pygtk version that is not availabile
    to many git users yet: https://gna.org/bugs/?17947

    an empty config directory on such a setup.

    * New default window positions.
    * Nothing's in the sidebar by default now.
    * Bugfix for bad sbwidth starting when nothing's in the sidebar at startup...
    
    Internal changes:
    
    * Can now assign default position to plain (non-tool) SubWindows
    * Generalise position saving and loading with a couple of mixins.
    * Can now set position relative to both left and right screen edges, and

    * Support calulated widths (based on monitor size)
    * Might as well claim copyright over the new module.

commit 7551c3d51e18071e0eeb25b5df9658a615718041
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-02-18 17:48:39 +0000

    More subwindow loading is now deferred, which should speed up loading
    times a bit. In addition, this change is necessary for supporting
    dockable ToolWidgets later on.

    new layout framework will allow us to get most of that back, eventually.

commit ffab8cd9e2c28d14b679fb0d2f5f3bb18e30ed69
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-02-18 17:25:28 +0000

    drawwindow: don't just trust that fullscreen works
    
    Do fullscreen properly by not just assuming that it works when we ask
    for it, but by listening for GTK window-state-events. This may *seem* to
    break fullscreen in ancient, weird WMs that don't support EWMH and
    _NET_WM_STATE_FULLSCREEN. Additionally it means that if something other
    than the callback fullscreens MyPaint, it will respond correctly.

11	3	gui/drawwindow.py

commit 16511ef41dccbe9d4604b357203e1ec6e6fd5c9c
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-02-18 16:25:57 +0000

    fullscreen: use gtk fullscreen method, not gdk
    
    Call gtk.Window.fullscreen() rather than gdk.Window.fullscreen() for
    the main window. A member variable was shadowing the method name which
    is probably why this came about.

6	6	gui/drawwindow.py

commit d66c96db3c1bccc5874fbe423473f8adc27d3db1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-02-18 14:22:57 +0000

    layout: add library code for managing sidebars
    
    Introduce a layout manager class that can construct tool widgets or
    windows or parts of the main gui using a factory method and cache
    combination. Tool widgets can be docked into the main app's sidebar, or
    snapped free into floating windows. Window and tool positions will be
    saved and loaded to the user's runtime configuration.

Date:   2011-03-01 12:03:24 +0000

    use a standard X11 cursor that looks OK and expresses the concept well
    enough in a few common cursor themes (dmz, oxy-white, whiteglass).

3	1	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit 90d23af770d8a27ccf67a17543efb6e31f9bc495
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2011-03-01 01:06:20 +0000

    layer lock: prevent accidental selection & drawing
    
    Layers can now be locked so that you don't inadvertently draw on them.
    Additionally, invisible layers are now treated in the same way, since
    drawing on those is even more confusing.
    
    Locked and invisible layers cannot be drawn on, and the Pick Context
    and Select Layer at Cursor actions will skip past them. You can however
    still merge them, select them, change their ordering, and delete their
    contents.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?17140

commit 6289926d11e5f0a5e359586ee461b0868e22ed5c
Author: David Revoy <davidrevoy@gmail.com>
Date:   2011-02-26 20:09:41 +0100

    brushes: deevad V4.1
    
    http://www.davidrevoy.com/index.php?article55/mypaint-v4-brushkit
    
    Quote from the website above:
    * More tools 'variations' than in the previous kit, for a faster
      workflow.
    * All the V4 Brushkit are optimised to produce bigger artworks at
      better resolutions, you should set your default zoom at startup
      at 50% (Mypaint>edit>preferences>view) for a better experience
      while using them.[picture exemple]. Sorry if your machine slows-
      down, but V4 is clearly a production brush kit designed for
      professional use.
    * Brush are not labeled with their name as in the 'transitional
      V3+ BrushKit' I created for Mypaint 0.9 release. The new
      icons were painted in Mypaint preview square on the fly.
    * Almost all the brush were tweaked to have a better behavior.
      If you want to have the same feeling I do while using them,
      consider changing the curve to something similar to this configuration
      (mypaint>edit>preferences>input).[picture exemple]

    have triggered another (fatal) exception.

    for us.

commit 89f9c9f06fe664c7dddb0a53f1b20706b68b7842
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2011-01-30 15:38:34 +0100

    thumbnails: 256x256 preview, 20% faster saving
    
    Some refactoring of the thumbnailing code. We now use 256x256
    whenever possible. When saving a PNG, we no longer load the full
    file back from disk (in addition to the data we already hold in
    memory) just to generate the thumbnail.
    
    Saving ORA and PNG is both around 20% faster now. This is not
    noticed by the performance benchmarks that don't use the GUI.

8	5	gui/filehandling.py
18	16	lib/document.py
55	31	lib/helpers.py

commit 28b786aa649cfdbd573b2ceb25167f0ac333c369

Date:   2011-01-29 11:59:21 +0100

    fix startup crash for non-ascii home directory
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?17111
    
    Tested on Linux, but should also work on Windows. At least I
    checked that on Vista getfilesystemencoding() returns a codec
    that can decode the USERPROFILE environment variable.

    prefs: allow rebinding of more buttons & mods
    
    Add an extra tab to the preferences window which allows device buttons 2
    and 3 to be rebound. Additionally combinations of shift, ctrl or alt
    plus any device button (1 through 3) can be rebound.
    
    Defaults have been set to the old actions before this commit.
    
    Only certain actions make any sense here, so only those are offered in
    the prefs dialog.

    The two ideas are separate; mixing them up causes problems.

    legitimately, and sometimes MyPaint tried to highlight them and not
    their ancestor in the brushlist.

commit e9dfcda7c37d5fcf44ca1c92b17f4495e91160ad
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-12-29 01:26:41 +0000

    brushmanager: bugfix brushkeys and devbrushes
    
    Commit e1d211436645db1e6be0782b5db0b590d87bd4ef broke brushkeys and
    devbrushes' parent relationships. Rollback and fix. In future, we'll
    just have to be explicit about whether we want to retain parent names
    when loading.
    
    Also, load all brushkey brushes on startup. Not ideal, but the deferred
    load doesn't know and shouldn't care if a brush is a brushkey one.

8	7	gui/brushmanager.py

    or default brushes can't be found: basically widen default brush
    searches and/or pick plausible defaults.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?17253

57	6	gui/brushmanager.py

commit e1f1c217a4844cda8246317d58da631e76a5cb13
Author: Andrzej Giniewicz <gginiu@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-12-28 18:49:19 +0100

    Use correct version of python for generate.py
    
    The brushlib/generate.py is called by build script using "python generate.py",
    if default Python is Python 3 as in my case, it makes the build fail on new
    print-as-function syntax. Simply using same python version as for rest of
    MyPaint fixes the issue.

    Function editor: Treat translated text better. (Remove title())

    Initial Cased:
    
     A) There are languages and locales that don't use Initial Case for
        headers.
     B) str.title() can only work on ascii.

commit 6d532c8dc3e39533cf36de9c2deac042e0f5f72f
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-10-28 01:54:35 +0100

    eraser mode: play nice with restored brushes
    
    Bugfixes and behavioural changes. Eraser mode was misbehaving when switching
    devices or restoring things.
    
    * Forget eraser mode when a brush is restored from any source (context,
      pick context, device-specific brushes)
    
    * Don't save (eraser, radius) from eraser mode for pen devices, but *do*
      save (eraser, radius) from eraser mode to eraser devices. This
      allows users to pick a non-eraser brush with the eraser end of their
      pen, flip MyPaint to eraser mode and have the effects of eraser mode
      saved for the device.
    
      Conversely, switching devices back to a pen allows you to draw even if
      you went { pen1 -> eraser mode -> pen2 -> ... -> pen1 } and forgot
      about having engaged eraser mode.
    
      This isn't very symmetrical though. Suggestions welcome!
    
    * Remember the eraser mode size change as a saved preference.

11	6	gui/brushmanager.py
73	29	gui/document.py

commit c8932112d5df04b105ac8eb62f965d4843e95c73
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-10-22 21:16:58 +0100

    user brush tweaks: process device changes 1st
    
    Glitch fix: for UI parts that the user can tweak the settings of the
    current brush with, if the device switches with the very event used to
    tweak the the brush, the tweak should be applied *after* switching to
    the new brush.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?14695

commit 627dcb8460f2a9ac7a2b2ce2aef48d36977a37a1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-10-16 23:39:36 +0100

    per-device brushes: remember across sessions
    
    Undoes some of the nastiness introduced by my commit
    http://gitorious.org/mypaint/mypaint/commit/bc3fc61f7fa3 and improve
    things a little. Specifically, record per-device brushes as proper
    ManagedBrushes, save them between sessions, and don't force everything
    else that uses non-persistent ManagedBrushes to go through the same UI.
    
    Brush setting strings now contain parent_brush_name, the name of a
    persistent ManagedBrush. This is intended to be used for highlighting
    the parent brush when picking strokes, switching between input deveices
    or pressing brushkeys.
    
    Remember the brush-to-device association at the end of a stroke, and
    keep track of changed settings.
    
    Default to the last-used brush+settings at app startup.
    
    Save per-device brushes+settings when the application ends.

Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-10-30 19:59:33 +0200

    canvas: mouse zoom/pan/rotate shortcuts
    
    Ctrl-(MMB or space) = zoom (Blender convention)
    Shift-(MMB or space) = rotate (no convention, just don't use Ctrl)
    And draw straight lines only with LMB.

    for saving, and the current directory for opening.

commit a26f33a92924117204247530d8d0b6f0b543a73b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-10-18 15:01:24 +0200

    portability: make filenames unicode
    
    This fixes various problems on Windows with saving/loading files
    with special characters. https://gna.org/bugs/?16109
    
    Note that we pass unicode strings to os.* functions to get
    back unicode filenames (instead of the encoding of the system).
    
    brush names: utf8 --> unicode
    group names: already unicode
    layer names: utf8 --> unicode
    bruspack filenames: broken --> unicode

commit 355c3b71250f02ab195bb06114bf44af37e433f1
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-10-06 14:46:04 +0100

    color sampler: colorwheel size when expanding
    
    Color wheel now stays the same size when twizzling the expanders at the
    bottom. The window changes size instead.
    
    Tweak initial window positions. Deevad's brushset is laid out around a
    4xN rhythm, and a narrower brush selection window makes that happen for
    more GTK styles, even ones with thinner scrollbars.

8	8	gui/application.py
28	3	gui/colorsamplerwindow.py

commit c5c096eeb45066631b35ebf5071c548ca9d094a3
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-09-25 16:10:11 +0200

    Windows: workaround for bad timer resolution
    
    Fix for 0.9 release; fixing it in the brush engine would require
    careful checking/retuning of existing brushes.
    https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?16569
    
    This also fixes far-out dab with some brushes on Windows that would
    enlarge the canvas size a lot, possibly leading to out-of-memory
    when saving. This was happening because the brush engine uses a very
    small time delta (0.0001 seconds) when the dtime input is zero.

26	1	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

    Disable the timer during normal mypaint usage.

commit 101c34432f342db87dc9ff2ffcb3661744279486
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-09-15 22:10:47 +0100

    TiledDrawWidget: fix dropped events after pen use
    
    Workaround for https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?16253 in which for some
    tablets (Wacom Bamboo, Wacom Intuos3, UC-Logic WP8060U) use of the pen
    or eraser would cause button presses or scroll events from other devices
    to stop being received until the tdw lost the pointer. Seems we only
    need to acknowledge gdk.PROXIMITY_OUT_MASK events in some way.

6	0	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit d17cd38f8337fa9c70113ec1d42cbaf52be8b842
Author: Andrew Chadwick <andrewc-git@piffle.org>
Date:   2010-09-15 14:32:06 +0100

    GroupSelector: improve feedback in brush drags
    
    More visible highlighting, show the drop action via the cursor when
    dragging, press shift when dragging to force move. Appearance and UI
    when dragging a brush onto a text label is now more consistent with that
    seen when dragging a brush from one opened brushlist into another.
    
    http://gna.org/bugs/?15353

commit d32207c91effa4fa11bda1234d75c4cc3c7c9ddf
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-09-12 00:06:41 +0200

    Brusheditor: Make default values insensitive
    
    Make "reset to default value" button insensitive when the
    brush setting is already at the default value.
    This is better because:
    1) In this case, the button will have no effect
    2) It makes it easier to see which settings are non-default, and
    therefore are "special" for this brush and determines its behaviour

    fix weird behaviour when selecting old brushes

    Before, selecting an old brush would keep all the settings
    (like aspect) that were not overwritten by its brushstring.

commit 8e5afe55188f725ecc0df8fb783721dd7330a922
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-08-29 10:47:57 +0200

    profiling: get rid of disk write activity
    
    All gui performance tests run a bit faster now.
    
    The gui tests were calling gtk.main() quite often, and whenever
    this function returned, gtk did write the list of recent files.
    Using gtk.main_iteration now.

commit f40b2b74160b8fffca424b6ee73c276195e50666
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-08-28 20:10:53 +0200

    save_ora: speedup 30%, no more dithering
    
    save_ora 3.026 --> 2.177
    
    When converting from 16bit to 8bit much time was spent in rand().
    Doing simple rounding again, which also avoids errors during
    load->save cycles.  I tried error diffusion but it's tricky to
    keep it from altering the image during load->save cycles.

4	36	lib/pixops.hpp

commit 52d49c8b4081c4cd637f92f1af8841571f79b3ec
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-08-28 13:50:28 +0200

    remove debug print

0	2	lib/layer.py

commit 279868eccf2116b2d964b57e5bb30a0146f5c8b9
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-08-27 14:06:47 +0200

    strokemap: optimize save_ora, get rid of protobuf library
    
    Most of the saving time was spent inside protobuf while saving the
    strokemap.  We now use a different binary format. Old strokemaps
    in existing files will be discarded.
    
    In addition, about 50% of the strokemap size and saving time
    was used for the brush settings. Those were saved as string with
    each stroke. We now save only an index in a separate brush table.

0	13	lib/strokemap.proto

7	0	lib/backgroundsurface.py
5	0	lib/pixbufsurface.py

commit 04def30a3022a816b6a1e1fdc61bf3f3bd1e20aa
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-08-15 10:34:55 +0200

    saving: optimization, process tile scanlines
    
    Instead of rendering a full gdk.Pixbuf and saving it, we
    now render scanlines of the height of a tile and feed them
    progressively to libpng. The motivation was mainly to avoid
    running out of memory while saving.
    
    Benchmarks:
    save_png_layer 2.137 --> 0.520 (4x speedup)
    save_ora       3.522 --> 3.342 (only 5%, I wonder why?)
    save_png       0.607 --> 0.571 (only 5%)
    
    The speedup is more than I expected, and most likely because of
    caching effects (libpng reads memory that we have just written).
    But why does this not propagate to save_ora...? Maybe compositing
    all those different layers for each tile clears the cache?

5	0	lib/backgroundsurface.py
20	17	lib/document.py
40	22	lib/fastpng.hpp
28	6	lib/pixbufsurface.py
3	2	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit c9e5d0f96f27d282f7907fe7922538e9172be9b9
Author: David Gowers <00ai99@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-07-17 14:52:03 +0200

    add pixel brushes, allow extreme zoom-in levels
    
    "This brush is just for hard-edged, exactly 1 pixel, drawing. I spent
    quite a while adjusting it to get the neatest lines without any
    breaking.
    
    Also I made a few others (one for hard-edged blocking-out, the other
    for hard edged inking). This should also enable oekaki-style drawings,
    which I rather like the aesthetic of myself but I haven't tried in
    MyPaint yet."

commit bedc2198fe4867b8403da9951417617cc22e18e2
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-07-16 17:36:32 +0200

    fix attempt for touchpads without pressure data
    
    This fixes mouse button painting. A button event is now treated
    like a motion event. (Tablet pressure changes are reported through
    motion events, so it works now the same way.)
    
    This will not fix glitches with touchpads that report pressure but
    no motion events without pressure.
    
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-help-and-tips/touchscreen-brush-%27trailing%27-issue/
    https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?13622 (partial fix)

27	3	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

commit b68699133e571c8e8d7b8b421cd9d4cb3cf7d1c8
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-07-13 07:17:29 +0200

    canvas: pixelize at zoomlevel > 1.5
    
    It looks like crap because we don't seem to do antialiasing, but
    everyone agrees that after a certain zoom-in level blurring is not helpful.
    
    http://forum.intilinux.com/mypaint-development-and-suggestions/zoom-blur-probleme-and-suggestion/

4	5	gui/tileddrawwidget.py

1	1	gui/document.py

commit 3fea139ddbf913f5716daaadde02264ea7c7117e
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-06-23 21:39:37 +0200

    speed up zoom/rotation 3x on some hardware
    
    Render to RGBA image instead of RGB. This allows hardware to
    accelerate more of it. For ati/radeon on xorg this speeds up
    scroll_zoomed_out_5x by factor three; hopefully other hardware
    works similar.
    
    Worst benchmark for software-only rendering is 5% slower.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?16122
    https://bugs.freedesktop.org/show_bug.cgi?id=28670

16	4	gui/tileddrawwidget.py
42	18	lib/pixops.hpp

commit ea2595fd8be5356240b5883b45532d1ded0e6233
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-06-22 21:09:54 +0200

    fix slow zoom-out on some hardware
    
    Current ATI driver was doing a fallback about 10 times slower than
    pure software rendering, see https://gna.org/bugs/?16122

commit 1080b7d6b23f8bb56e79a24c283b1fb0b0856d90

Date:   2010-05-15 21:06:18 +0200

    scraps: Default prefix to ~/MyPaint/scrap
    
    Means that the scraps end up under the users directory no matter what
    cwd is, and that we don't pollute it.
    Especially nice on Windows, as files ended up in the same dir as the
    mypaint.exe before
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?15997

commit bf081be846e55a62e9b279d9b4ff7240f8d56782
Author: Ramón Miranda <mirandagraphic@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-06-03 11:08:00 +0200

    brushes: brushset update from Ramón
    
    "I have made some new brushes to add to my set. The Reason is that we can
    now have a good dynamic glow airbrush,( untill blending modes appear) So i
    have mapped saturation, lightness and hue changes to increase the fake
    effect.  more pressure hue changes and it looks like additive mode, it works on
    my tests so there you have. B-pencil And H-Pencil are made for people who
    like draw skethes but not so dirty. they produce a clean stroke that we can
    control more than a dirty brushstroke. good for Architecture or comic
    drawings , like superman on the forum. Then we have a cool Thin Pen that
    is v5 pilot pen . with a lot of things that can be easily manipulated to
    vary the effect.. What about blenders? yes! i like a lot blenders and this is
    the reason that i have made some more  again. Water, is usefull to blend
    colors like we do with a simple brush with water and no color. and the others
    are more expressive for weird and very funny effects. They Work Well at high
    res. and i hope you will enjoy them.maybe the last brushes for a time,
    (allwais saying the same thing  ¬¬)"

commit 0248cf02ae86b11f9886c1e6a0eb4cc104506015
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-06-02 16:58:36 +0200

    speedup saving PNG/ORA factor two
    
    Speedup comes from telling libpng not to try every filter function.
    New build dependency: libpng
    
    Benchmark change (for a real painting):
    save_png 2.727s, 5.5M ==> 0.963s, 5.4M
    save_ora 11.583s, 10M ==> 6.036s, 9.9M

commit e068413297767052361666cca71e7b28e6e99523
Author: Andrzej Giniewicz <gginiu@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-05-15 16:15:34 +0200

    brushdialog: Dragging brushes onto group labels
    
    Simple implementation of wish #15353, dragging brush to group label that do not
    have given brush adds it at end of list, in case brush is there already it's
    removed from source group (to make it similar to behaviour when dragging between
    groups list).

    preferences: move data/logic out from window

    of being attributes on the preferencesWindow. The on-disk format remains the same
    and the window is still responsible for loading the settings on startup.

commit 9ae8b4b2f451e015e2fd9a43360f51c5cb82a4e4
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2010-03-30 23:46:50 +0200

    gui: Move code from drawwindow into separate file
    
    Introduces a new file and class, Document, whos reference is held by Application
    It contains most of the code concerning the document model and view, so
    a lot of code that previously used drawWindow.* now uses doc.*
    
    Summary of changes:
    drawWindow.document_related_method -> doc.methodname
    drawWindow.tdw -> doc.tdw
    drawWindow.doc -> doc.model (the lib.document.Document)
    
    Still in drawWindow:
    Input handling
    Main- and some sub-window handling
    Information dialogs

commit abe84cab53908d32f7c67b51497ecc1323f8bb01
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-03-13 14:13:03 +0100

    testing: more robust leak test
    
    Python sometimes does a strange memory increase after a few
    iterations (even for pure Python test statements), so now we wait
    until we got a fixed number of iterations without memory increase.
    Simpler than before, and more stable.

Date:   2010-03-13 13:39:05 +0100

    testing: move memory leak test into own script
    
    Fork before starting the test, so each test starts without the garbage
    of the last. This allows to see memory increase after fewer iterations.

commit 866f638c695dfaebf7db6a0898d15249a5d8fa2b
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-02-14 15:23:46 +0100

    layerswindow: fix memory leak
    
    The layerswindow did keep a reference alive to every layer that ever was.
    This did leak huge amounts of memory on repeated loading.
    This fix may contain traces of black magic.
    
    Note: commenting the line
      self.visibility_button.on_toggle = self.on_visibility_toggled
    did also fix the problem, this might have been used for a different fix.
    
    https://gna.org/bugs/?15350

5	1	gui/layerswindow.py

commit d97602f09abb76f5ee2638bb9f7bd4d813ae05d5
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-01-17 21:06:39 +0100

    brushlib: fix small problem opaque_multiply
    
    Don't allow opaque to become positive when both opaque and
    opaque_multiply are negative (--> unintentional painting)
    
    Brushes where this could happens:
    hard_sting.myb
    Ico_Color_Smudge_+.myb
    Ico_Linear_Watercolor.myb
    Ico_Pastel_Stain.myb
    s109.myb
    splatter-05.myb
    splatter-06.myb

commit 4d34d7f15c3a9450a101cc2a3875591751e67aac
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2010-01-17 18:10:51 +0100

    don't store/restore brushsettings for the mouse
    
    When editing brush settings, it is often more convenient to use the mouse.
    Because of this, we don't restore brushsettings when switching to/from the mouse.
    We act as if the mouse was identical to the last active pen device.

11	0	gui/drawwindow.py

commit af537fc6bb5f1be91968b12639b4702923337f7d

commit 2561f2639248c889f100466f4efdc066ee2e9c6f
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-11-29 21:27:47 +0100

    brushgroups: fix unicode problem
    
    Somehow when starting mypaint from emacs my system's default
    encoding is set to "ascii". This made the current implementation
    throw exceptions when using non-ascii group names.
    
    Seems safer to write our config file in a fixed encoding (utf-8)
    instead of using the system's default (which might change, or might
    not be able to encode one of the names of the default group names).

2	3	gui/application.py
0	3	gui/brushselectionwindow.py
0	9	lib/helpers.py

commit 175c77ad8cc6f4a773cfe18327900f75dd6494fa
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-11-26 10:37:26 +0100

    brushgroups implemented, basic drag&drop working (wip, known bugs)
    
    Partially based on the implementation by Ilya Portnov. One major
    difference is that groups are not stored into the brush itself.
    This avoids duplication of information, and needless copies of
    stock brushes (which are not updated any more on changes).
    
    Removed the application's brush list in favour of the group dict.
    Logic for merging changes in the shipped brushes was rewritten.
    
    TODO:
    - GUI to add groups
    - brush management (file creation/deletion) known to be buggy
    - fix unittest

commit e0b37a99715a5b161a732aea4e8972cb1352d1e6
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-12-06 16:41:10 +0100

    i18n: round number for ngettext to detect singular
    
    Before, we did round by using '%d' in the string format, so
    ngettext did always see a fractional number, never choosing the
    singular form.
    
    Singular can't happen here anyway, but still... ;-)

commit 3eb39b13cd5abe802fa1389dfd53f347b5a29248
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-10-25 13:09:07 +0100

    fix leak test, idletask/strokemap code refactoring
    
    The idle handler was leaking memory, because it added a callback closure
    to the gtk idle handler that was never called during the test. That
    closure held a reference to the surface, which in turn was never freed.
    
    No impact when running with GUI, but it's fixed now anyway.

47	0	lib/idletask.py
10	32	lib/strokemap.py
9	15	tests/test_mypaintlib.py
1	1	tests/test_performance.py

commit bbcf9dc9e6e02bece5b318db54aa42ab6dc9f1d1
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-10-24 23:01:30 +0200

    fix memory leak: Surface class not collectable
    
    Ensure swig does not create empty Python destructors.
    Those must have prevented the garbage collector from freeing the circular
    references that Surface creates (Python can't decide which destructor to
    call first in such situations).
    
    The symptom of this was probably visible only when loading many big images.

1	1	lib/SConscript

Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-10-24 23:00:51 +0200

commit d2d8ced71c3a0e9d1fc46d6dc62720fa27487603
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-21 19:42:28 +0200

    Fix far-off dabs seen on Windows with some brushes
    
    This was caused by brushes with zero offset_by_speed_slowness.
    Require some minimal filtering now, as a workaround. Those brushes
    were probably highly dependent on the motion event timing.
    
    Those brushes did place a few individual dabs far far away from the
    rest of the stroke. This resulted in a very large layers, for example
    20000x20000 pixels. This used up all resources when saving.
    
    The offset_by_speed feature is mainly producing interesting glitches
    and should be replaced anyway with something more intentional.

11	1	brushlib/brush.hpp
1	1	brushlib/brushsettings.py

commit 4c024a093fc986282fe38a03f8404a928ed33207
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-21 15:20:30 +0200

    win32: fix bug when overwriting .ora files

2	0	lib/document.py

commit a748208570a1a1527c8e4d4672b8d01381532857
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-11 10:45:05 +0200

    Respect the display's maximum cursor size
    
    Fixes two bugs:
    https://gna.org/bugs/?13716 (Severe screen artifacts with Compiz)
    https://gna.org/bugs/?13975 (Some brushes have bugs?)
    And opens a new one:
    https://gna.org/bugs/index.php?13992 (Visual feedback for big brush radius)

8	3	gui/cursor.py

commit ff4732cd4946b295d6a939c9984ef1ab05967962
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-19 20:54:21 +0200

    mipmap: fix unittest, use less memory
    
    Turned out that the mipmap code did allocate memory for empty tiles.
    
    This had the effect to give unpredictable layer sizes when saving,
    because of empty tiles sometimes being there and sometimes not.
    This also caused more empty tiles to be rendered than neccessary,
    but the performance penalty for doing that was very small.
    
    Use a special "mipmap-dirty" tile now that replaces the dirty flag.
    
    memory_zoomed_out_5x 185846 ==> 166961
    performance tests stay the same (less than 5% change)

31	24	lib/tiledsurface.py

commit 5c223fa98608da5b152311114c96ae82c2e08b13
Author: Jon Nordby <jononor@gmail.com>
Date:   2009-07-19 16:44:19 +0200

    better errors on saving with insufficient space
    
    partial fix of bug #13820
    permission checking is now done by catching the errors and not in advance

Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-18 15:08:09 +0200

    Portability: use rand() instead of random()
    
    for Windows build

7	7	lib/pixops.hpp

commit a8f5970bf44b8336730eedeae9dcca8e68cd53ce
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-07-13 10:00:55 +0200

    Use event timestamps to measure key press duration
    
    When pressing home shortly to toggle layer solo mode, there was/is
    a problem when the display update takes too much time. We then
    sometimes get a too long key press reported, and we leave layer solo
    again because we think the user was holding the key down intentionally
    long.

3	4	gui/stategroup.py

commit 6d5f07503e9c61d174ffab753d985f387cdc932e
Author: Tanda <info@lodetanda.com.ar>
Date:   2009-07-11 22:10:03 +0200

    New brushes: Oils,Acrylics,Watercolors...
    
    Oils:
    The painting is not infinite, when  the brush is not painting anymore start
    to smudge but with more presion you can paint a little.
    Each paintbrush have two variants for use combined:
    To paint(Paint).
    Brush Clean(Clean)): it's equals to "Paint" but clean, only smudge the
    paint.
    and finally:
    Mop: it's a paintbrush "mop" for smooth the paint.
    ---------------------------
    Acrylics:
    Each paintbrush have tree variants for use combined:
    To paint(Paint).
    To paint with more water (with water).
    To use only water(only water).
    --------------------------
    Watercolor:
    Each paintbrush have two variants for use combined:
    To paint(Paint).
    To use only water(only water).
    ---------------------------
    Water:
    they are for splash water, work without the presion, with the presion and
    with the velocity, for differents effects.
    ---------------------------
    Decoration: nothing special but experimenting with them I could make the
    paintbrushes.
    ---------------------------
    Texture: they are very utils for works of textures, and for speed sketches.

Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2009-06-27 21:55:28 +0200

    Implement stroke picking from canvas
    
    Record a one-bit bitmap of each stroke. This is saved per layer.
    When looking for the stroke at a given pixel, this bitmap is
    checked for each stroke.

commit f22570d4b4ae449b1b4f6d80eeec53b230ddd22c
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>

commit 742e3ccde2eba4fcb355ed040ce800eb96503400
Author: Tanda <info@lodetanda.com.ar>
Date:   2009-06-21 14:48:29 +0200

    new brushes: characoal, airbrush...
    
    The airbrush "real" try to emulate the movement of the hand in one real
    airbrush. Slow for details and fast for big diemeter and with the
    presion more o less paint. But is not necessary use the presion, you can
    use "S" and "A" for start to paint, to acomplish a realistic feeling, like
    if you are using a real airbrush. :) The digital airbrush is more easy to
    use but not with a real movement of hand.

commit 1e5269379de0535be52bdece29e7ba1ae1c62d42
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>

commit 0430bb111afd69e9386aac44fdf911f1486cf697
Author: Martin Renold <martinxyz@gmx.ch>
Date:   2007-02-08 20:40:40 +0000

    Reworked user-defined brush curves a bit.
    - Brush curves have now fully adjustable x range.
    - Added "normal" values for all inputs. Only changing a "by input" slider
      generates a curve that is zero at the normal value.
    - Think "curve = list of points". Fewer special cases.
    - Brush files (.myb) now have a version number. Convert from old format.
    Still needs testing.
